story:
My Story

Seven years ago I got on a plane and took a trip to see a run down, boarded up Victorian hotel that had sat empty for a number of years. It overlooked the ocean in a small fishing community on the south shore of Nova Scotia. I knew it had to be restored. I knew I had to do it, so I bought it.

For several years I travelled back and forth from my home and job in Ontario trying to work on it as much as I could and making plans to one day open the doors again to visitors from around the world who wanted a comfortable, welcoming place to visit and enjoy. 

In the fall of 2017 I unexpectedly lost my job. I was devastated. Within 3 days I had packed up my car and started driving east to make the hotel home and make my dream a reality.

It has been a struggle but I am creating my dream. When I first moved in I had no running water, no toilet, no bathtub, no heat. I drew water from my well  and used a bucket. Not very glamorous or easy.  Over the last year I have had plumbing added to the building and some of the electrical replaced. I have also fully gutted the first floor and part of the second. Added insulation to the walls and with some help the floors and the original tin ceilings have been restored. 

I was able to hire a carpenter and have a beautiful ramp added to the front entrance that will allow everybody access to the building with ease. During this work the rotted beam and structure under the front door was replaced with a new sill and beam to allow people to enter for the next 100 years. A parking lot was also excavated in the back to open the space for lots of cars to park. 

I still need signifigant funding to finish this project but from the start I have relied on a simple mantra that continues to motivate me and be able to focus on and create the progress that you can see has happened over the last year.

One room at a time.

Although I don't take this literally it has come to represent the mind set that I focus on what is in front of me. What do I need to do next? What do I need to do today? That is what keeps things happening and eventually it will happen.

Right now I need funding.

It can't be escaped. This project needs funding. I am so grateful for and have been blessed with so much help and support so far by wonderful people who believe it can be done. I am now able to run a small business out of the building selling my home made preserves and soap as well as teaching workshops on soap making. This is creating some income which ultimately goes right back into the bigger project. I am looking forward to this expanding in the coming months with the addition of other artisans bringing me their products to sell for them to locals and travelers coming through this season. 

The funds I receive from this campaign will be used to help complete the renovations to the second floor to open up the Air BnB rooms. These rooms will provide me with a year round income accommodating both tourists on the lighthouse route and workers who need housing during the lobster season. Those renovations will be to complete 3 guest rooms with 2 full shared bathrooms. 

With your help I know this can be done. There are so many ways to help. There is the obvious method of making a donation but if you can't do that there are others ways too. You can share this campaign on your facebook and with your friends. If you wanted to hold a fundraising event that would work too. Maybe a bake sale or garage sale and donate the proceeds. Everything little bit helps. 

Please check out my perks. There might be something that catches your fancy and its a double win for both of us.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read my story.

story:
Support Community Housing Capital’s “Homes for Good” Campaign

Studies have shown that family and community stability, economic growth, and positive social change are proven outcomes of high-quality, affordable homeownership and rental housing.

CHC’s “Homes for Good” campaign supports the development and financing of affordable housing for working people in communities across the U.S.  We do this by lending money to nonprofit community development organizations that are members of the national NeighborWorks® network. These organizations use the funds to build or rehabilitate housing for people who work hard but may not have access to quality housing that they can afford – people like firefighters, nurses, veterans, teachers, small business owners and others.

How You Can Help

It’s up to you! Be a part of this creative effort to ensure that we continue to meet the basic human need of decent, stable housing for all.

Support for affordable housing has declined in recent years, and everybody knows someone who has struggled to find a good place to live that’s affordable.  The timing is perfect for your gift to make a difference in the lives of families and the future of communities. Your contribution is tax deductible.

Your dollar is like a magnet, and it immediately attracts $4 from our other investors.  Help us raise $100,000, and together we can provide half a million dollars to finance great housing solutions that are affordable for people like Connie, Kyle and Eric, whose stories are featured in our video. 

The benefits of your contribution will extend beyond these individual families.  Affordable housing helps the whole community.  Stable housing promotes greater community involvement, educational achievement, lower crime, better property maintenance, and even better health.  And housing creates investment in local economies. It creates jobs, attracts new employers and skilled workers, and it increases revenue for cities and states.

Help us reach our goal by year's end to make a real difference in the lives of hard-working people across the country. When the “crowd” comes together, we can accomplish change that none of us could achieve alone.

About Community Housing Capital

CHC has a proven 12-year record for making sound investments that increase access to affordable housing. This year, we’re on track to provide housing for many more families nationwide. Your contribution allows you to be part of this movement.

CHC promotes affordable housing by lending money to nonprofit community development organizations across the country.  These loans provide the flexibility required to fund the development of affordable rental housing and homes to be purchased by modest-income individuals and families. In our first 12 years of operation, we and our community development partners have financed 9,000 units of affordable housing nationwide, which equates to a billion dollars invested in community redevelopment.

The local NeighborWorks organizations working with CHC have a national reputation for strengthening communities through affordable housing and providing economic opportunities.  These organizations also educate residents about their responsibilities as homeowners or renters. Many provide additional services such as computer labs, after-school programs, budgeting skills, energy conservation and more, to take a holistic approach to community development.

story:
The Elm Street Café

The Elm St. Café will be located in a great space with a vintage Art Deco bar that will be transformed into a cool coffee and smoothie bar; sharing space with the Common Wealth Kitchen Incubator at 907 Elm St. It’s a terrific location-just blocks from the YSU campus dorms, historic Wick Park on the north side of “rust-belt chic” Youngstown. The Elm St. Café will be perfect for community members, college students and folks who work nearby to grab a drink, pick up prepared foods from the adjacent shared-use kitchen and support locally sourced, healthy fair trade eats and drinks.

A little about us

The Elm St. Café is one of the projects of Common Wealth Inc., whose seasoned staff

provides technical assistance to democratically owned and managed enterprises and economic and housing development ventures.  Common Wealth, Inc. has helped new businesses, co-ops and organizations flourish over the years; supporting such efforts as the Northside Farmer’s Market, Lake-to-River Cooperative and Buying Club, Community Colors painting cooperative, Ohio Employee Ownership Center, ACTION, the 30 Mile Meal™ Lake to River OH/PA and the Common Wealth Kitchen Incubator.

What are we going to do with the money?

Elm St. Café will serve Youngstown and the greater Mahoning Valley. This community, with its working-class vibe and inimitable, off-center character, ought to have a place to gather and celebrate its uniqueness. Money raised from the Indiegogo campaign will be used to re-furbish the 1920’s wooden bar, update plumbing and electrical systems and purchase some coffee and smoothie equipment.

What do you get out of it? 

A great place to gather with friends, enjoy great food from local farmers, bakers, pizza makers and more. The chance for a diverse group of people, both old friends and new, to contribute to real community economic development and make the most of it. And we have some pretty great prizes from our donors too!

Other ways to help

We know that not everyone can donate money, but you can also help by spreading the word to your friends and family! This is one of the most helpful things you can do.

And please know how much we appreciate your support!

story:
Our Story

As San Francisco rents have skyrocketed, long time mom and pop shops have closed their doors, working class families have been pushed out of our barrios, and everyday workers have had first-hand experiences of exploitation. 

We are eight talented and passionate immigrant leaders that have come out of these struggles to build a community-inspired worker owned catering and restaurant cooperative.  Our group's decision to pool our talents came fresh from late-night action team meetings, weekend skill shares, collective sharing of recipes and food traditions, and organizing alongside PODER (People Organizing to Demand Environmental & Economic Rights).

We are Enrique, Maria, Leny, Juan, Rosy, Alex, Max, and Sofia.  Through sheer passion, collective organizing and community will, we are emerging from the hardship and economic struggle to help create an economy in the hands of the people.

Together we have created a powerful vision that builds community, creates neighborhood assets, preserves traditions, puts decision making power in the hands of local residents, and serves as an inspiration to immigrant-led movements fighting displacement in their working class barrios.

What We Need & What You Get

Coop members are investing our heart and soul into making this dream a reality, but creating a community-inspired and worker-run enterprise requires a lot of start up costs.  So here is why we are asking for your support.

We are fundraising $6,000 for working capital to sustain the coop in its first few months. The money raised will pay for site renovations, permits, start up costs, and supporting members while cooking, developing an enterprise, and governing together.  Your support will help sustain our coop in these critical first few months and plants the seeds to strengthen immigrant-led coop movements across the Bay and beyond!

To appreciate you for your support, check out these perks!

DONATE $25: Almuerzo - Lunch on us!

DONATE $50: Para dos - Bring a date! Dinner for two.

DONATE $100: Para 4 - Dinner for 4!

DONATE $250: Cocina - One and a half hour cooking class for 2 with lunch! Learn how to make traditional foods of Mexico and El Salvador.

DONATE $500: Comida Familiar - We'll make you and your family or friends (up to 10 people) a full meal and deliver it right to your door!

DONATE $1000: Sabor Para el Corazón - We'll cater your next event, up to 20 people.

DONATE $2000: Fiestón - Have a party! Our space is yours for the night.  Includes food for up to 50, and private use of indoor and backyard space. 

Don't live in the Bay?  Gift your perks to a friend! Just give us their name and address and we'll take care of the rest.

*If you want a perk at a lower option than you are giving at, no problem!

Other Ways You Can Help

-Share this link on your facebook! Email it to friends!
-Have Maya Luna cater your next event! Call 415-410-9834 to schedule.
-Visit Maya Luna and enjoy the flavors of the Americas at 2341 Folsom St., between 19th and 20th, in the Mission District.
 
Contact Enrique del Valle at (415) 410-9834 for more information.

story:
Contribute $30 (or more!) to our funding campaign before December 25th to WIN a FREE trip for two to Seaside.

February 21-23rd at the WorldMark Seaside Resort. Raffle winner will be chosen at random and notified the first week of January 2014. 


Who Is REvolve Waste, LLC?

We are the bridge between multiple industries needed to close the loop on fabrics. We are passionate about reducing waste and improving our community. We are committed to changing recycling locally so we can impact the rest of the world.

We are geeks and specialists in the fields of textiles, communications, research and development, and project management. Around us we've got an amazing network of people who lend expertise in sustainability, marketing, law, business, apparel development, design, and more...

Why Are We Doing This?

Americans throw away 22 billion pounds of old clothing and fabrics every year.
  • This is trillions of gallons of water, millions of pounds of fertilizers and pesticides, and significant amounts of energy dumped into landfills annually.
REvolve sees an opportunity to create new jobs, help local businesses, and provide new educational opportunities by recycling instead of dumping.
  • Today, the US only recycles 15% of our textile waste.
  • REvolve is taking it to 50% and beyond, and we're helping the community while we're at it.
NOW is the time for REvolution!
  • YOU can help us close the loop on textiles!

How Will We Close the Loop?

  1. Map what kinds of clothing and fabrics we donate or throw away
  2. Collect and recycle more of these unwanted textiles
  3. Enable new regional recycling and upcycling opportunities
  4. Create more national recycling and upcycling opportunities

What Will REvolve Do With the Funds?

Your support gets Project #2 off the ground!
- Pay staff for 2 months: 1 full time project manager, 1 part time communications specialist
- Print marketing materials for 2 months
- Cover small expenses for 2 months: office supplies, presentation materials, mileage, etc.
- Indiegogo fees, campaign perks, and shipping

We need YOUR HELP to collect and recycle more textiles!
Estimated project start date: Feb '14

More Project Details...

Project #1 was funded from our own pockets. It helped local artisans source sustainable, affordable materials and spend their hard earned dollars within the community. We also collected info on the kinds of clothing and fabrics people donate or throw away.


What is Project #2?

This project increases the amount of fabric we recycle.
  • Recycling more creates job opportunities and supports local businesses.
  • YOUR hard-earned dollars will build the model to collect America's fabric waste.
This project allows us to collaborate with students to tailor a new textile recycling message and collection strategy. We'll test our strategy, tweak it until it works, and build a model to do the same thing in your community.

Goal:
Increase the amount of textiles recycled in the Portland Metro Area to 50%

Details:
- One year project focused on regional marketing and collection strategy for textile recycling
- Work with marketing and sustainability students to execute this project as a part of their studies
- Customize a marketing and collection strategy for unwanted fabrics, track how effective it is, adjust as necessary
- Participation from thrift organizations, college-level marketing and sustainability students, and the community is critical to the success of this project

Success at 2 months:
- Regional thrift organizations and local students agree to partner on the project
- Marketing message and collection strategy is in place
- New fabric recycling campaign launches in Portland, Oregon

What Has REvolve Already Done?

Launched Project #1: Recycled Fabric Market
First we collected unwanted clothing and textiles to set up a recycled fabric market. It helped local artisans and crafters source materials for the upcoming holiday season. In the process we learned:
- What types of clothing and fabrics people no longer want
- What is being done to reuse them today
- How we can increase this type of recycling in the community

Planned Project #2: Increase Textile Recycling
Next we are increasing the amount of fabric recycled in our area by changing the message of recycling. We have a plan that will:
- Give students the chance to change the world
- Decrease the amount of clothing and fabrics thrown away
- Work with thrift organizations, textile recyclers, and local businesses to create more ways to reuse these fabrics
- Create a model to recycle more fabric profitably across the country

REvolve Can't Change the World in Two Projects... Can it?

No... This Is Just the Beginning!
While we're helping our community today, we're working on other pieces of the puzzle for tomorrow. Namely:
- Enabling more recycling, upcycling, and technology development
- Bridging multiple industries to spread the effort
- Finding short term uses for unwanted fabrics
- Creating long term solutions for upcycling unwanted materials
- Working with local businesses, students, thrift organizations, and industry leaders to create a profitable fabric recycling model that can be used across the United States

What If I Can't Give Money?

You don't have to give us your money to be a REvolutionary! (You CAN ask someone to contribute and give you the perk as a gift, though...)

Speak up and spread the message.
Join us on Facebook
Follow our Blog
Check us out on Twitter

Most of all ALWAYS (wash and) DONATE YOUR OLD CLOTHING, even if it's beyond worn out. It will get recycled.

Thanks!

story:
Welcome

Have you, or someone you know, ever looked for help or support in your community and not found it, when you really needed it, only to find out later that it was there all along? We have and we have talked to thousands of others who have been in the same situation.

Well we have found a solution.

The Team at If Everyone Cares (IEC) would like to introduce you to The Online Interactive Community Map - ODODOW.  Below we are going to give you a brief summary of the project, who it is for and how it will help to empower individuals and strengthen communities. Then we will let you know what we need and why and what you will get by supporting us. Finally we will share with you other ways in which you can help and give you the opportunity to suggest a perk that you would like to see us offer. (Please be realistic and polite - but you are encouraged to be creative)

Before we start to properly introduce you to who we are and why we are doing this - here is a taster that may help you to understand that this really is a Huge ‘B-Hag’ - A BIG HAIRY AUDACIOUS GOAL! - But it IS achievable.

After more than 2 years of research and feedback the IEC Team (all volunteers at present) truly believe that the creation of an Online Interactive Global Community Map provides a solution that has a true global perspective. It is not based on any one community, any one sector of life, any one country or any one issue … … it is based on Uniting People who need help, want to help, can help, etc with The Community Projects,  Non-Profits and Charities, around the Globe, that are providing it. The ripple effect from this is huge, in fact some have said ‘mind-blowing!’

What Is - ODODOW - The Interactive Community Map

Another question:

Do you know Google Earth? With a few clicks of a button you can find a hotel, restaurant, etc, in any area of the country or even the world.  The results give you ‘choice’ - the opportunity to make an informed and empowered decision.

Using similar technology, ODODOW will provide an innovative and flexible solution to some of the challenges faced by individuals and communities. It will be launched initially in the UK and focus on Four Key Areas of support:

  • Helping those who need help - to find it
  • Sign-posting those who want to help - to projects that need their support.
  • Connecting New and Existing Projects to each other - so that they can share best practices, tools, strategies, services and more.
  • Encouraging businesses - to support projects within their local community, forging stronger community links.

And all of this will be available free, 24/7, at the click of a button.

Our Mission - To Empower Individuals and Strengthen Communities - One Click at a Time.

NB - Although ODODOW will be launched in the UK initially - once we have it up and running smoothly we will be ‘rolling’ it out globally. In fact we have people waiting to help us in America, Canada, Australia, India & Europe. Meaning that, supporting us now will benefit every country in the long run.

To Make ODODOW a Reality We Now Need Your Help -

To date the volunteers and I have given more than 10,000 hours of our time and expertise along with thousands of pounds of our own money to get this far. Apart from all of the research that we have done, we have built a firm foundation and created sustainable business plan that we believe will have If Everyone Cares & ODODOW self-funded within 3 years, from launch. Once we have progressed to a point where we generate profit we will set up a Trust/Foundation that will allocate grants to Community Focused Projects. 

Before we share all of our perks with you we would like to give you a guide to how the money raised will be spent. Even though our initial goal is £50,000 we do have BIGGER goals as shown below.

Our Goal & A Guide To How the Money Will Be Spent

If you have any questions please do not hesitiate to connect with us - either via email - Jaki@IfEveryoneCares.org or on our active Facebook Page - http://facebook.com/IfEveryoneCares

The Perks

That Warm 'N' Fuzzy Feeling - £1 + Optional Donation

This is the one for you if you just want that warm ‘N’ fuzzy feeling of knowing that you are supporting a really great project that really is going to make a positive difference in the lives of many :) 

- Your donation of any amount will be gratefully received and put to good use.

-------------------------------

Become an Official Community Ambassador 

Community Ambassadors are people who care about the future, they make a difference, they realise that change starts with each and every one of us caring enough to take even the smallest of actions. To acknowledge your action we will send you (via email) the Official Community Ambassador ‘Logo’ for you to use on all of your social media sites, business cards,  emails, etc.

Plus you will get that Warm ‘n’ Fuzzy feeling of knowing that you are supporting a really great community project.

You can start straight away by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and with your friends.

-------------------------------

Thank You Certificate!

We will email you an exclusive ‘Personalised Certificate’ Saying a Huge Thank You from the Team at If Everyone Cares.

You can have it made out to you, a friend, family member, or even your business.

Plus we will email you our Community Ambassador Logo, and you’ll get that Warm ‘n’ Fuzzy Feeling from supporting a really great community project.

If You like this perk and our goals please help us by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and with your friends - Thank You

-------------------------------

Thank You Post!

We will Post an Online a personalised ‘Thank You For Your Support” message on our dedicated Crowd-Funding Gratitude Page.

You can do this for yourself, a friend or family member.

Plus we will email you our Community Ambassador Logo, and you’ll get that Warm ‘N’ Fuzzy Feeling from supporting a really great community project.

If You like this perk and our goals please help us by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and with your friends - Thank You

To See the Gratitude Page - http://www.ifeveryonecares.org/crowd-funder-gra...

-------------------------------

Limited Edition Token and Certificate!

We will send you one of our Limited Edition Tokens with the original ‘If Everyone Cares’ logo and a Certificate of Authenticity Card. One of only 2000 in existence kindly donated by St Paul’s Mint - Birmingham.

Plus we will email you our Community Ambassador Logo, and you’ll get that Warm ‘N’ Fuzzy Feeling from supporting a really great community project.

(For International orders please add £3.50 for shipping & Extra time for delivery)

If You like this perk and our goals please help us by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and with your friends - Thank You

-------------------------------

1-2-1 Skype Mentor Time with Jaki

This is a unique and rare opportunity to spend 1 - 1/2 hours with Jaki on a personal skype call that is focused exclusively on you and your goals.

For the past two years - Since having the idea for the Interactive Community Map, Jaki has only held calls like this with people within her 'circle' of clients and friends - so this really is a rare opportunity and the value does not come down to £'s and pence - it is the value that you give to it.

-------------------------------

Personalised Thank You Video!

We will email you a personalized mp4 video from The Team @ If Everyone Cares giving Our gratitude and thanks. We will name you, your family, your business - Your choice.

Plus we will email you our Community Ambassador Logo, and you’ll get that Warm ‘N’ Fuzzy Feeling from supporting a really great community project.

If You like this perk and our goals please help us by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and with your friends - Thank You

-------------------------------

Permanent link On Website

Great for your business - A Permanent credit with your company logo and a link to your website on our Main If Everyone Cares homepage.

Plus we will email you our Community Ambassador Logo, and you’ll get that Warm ‘N’ Fuzzy Feeling from supporting a really great community project.

Please contact us before pledging for this 'Perk' 

If You like this perk and our goals please help us by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and with your friends - Thank You

-------------------------------

Key Note  Speech

Our CEO will give an inspiring speech at an event of your choice.

(travel/accommodation to be covered by pledger)

Plus we will email you our Community Ambassador Logo, and you’ll get that Warm ‘n’ Fuzzy Feeling from supporting a really great community project.

NB - Before selecting please contact us to talk about the brief - pencil in dates and discuss arrangements

If You like this perk and our goals please help us by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and with your friends - Thank You

-------------------------------

 Business Pledges

-------------------------------

 The Community Pledge

Be one of the 1st companies to sign up to The Community Pledge. A highly visible symbol that will instantly show your customers/clients that your business is committed to being a part of a caring and empowered community. A Force for Good.

The Pledge is not only good for your business it is the primary funding tool for ODODOW - The Interactive Community Map

For an Introductory price of £350 you will be signed up to the pledge until Dec 31 2014 & will receive - via email - the logo to use on all media materials - This is a Saving of £170

To See More - go to - http://www.ifeveryonecares.org/community-pledge/

If You like this perk and our goals please help us by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and with your friends - Thank You

-------------------------------

 Key Sponsor - ODODOW

This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to become the Key Sponsor of ODODOW. (valid till December 31st 2014)

Your company logo will be prominently displayed at the top of every page on the site - main pages, searches and results pages - generating high quality visibility.

We hope to build a long term, mutually beneficial relationship with a company that really cares about doing business for good

It is essential that you contact us before pledging for this 'Perk' 

 -------------------------------

Other Ways You Can Help

We really hope that you have found a perk or two that you like. Thank You in advance for your support - every pound really does count.

You can support in other ways too - Here's how - 

Just in case the text above is hard to read - 

You Can Help - Be 'A Community Ambassador'

You Can Help Us to Raise Awareness and Gain Support for -
ODODOW - The Interactive Community Map. 
It's as Simple As 1 - 2 - 3
You Can Share by: Word of Mouth, Through Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google+ 
or even just email your friends - Be Creative, Be Positive and Be Respectful. 
Many Thanks In Advance :)
 
By Working Together - We Really Can Be the Change We Want to See in the World.

 

Please Do Not Hesitate to Contact Us if You Have Any Questions or If there is a Perk that You Would Like Us To Offer (Please be realistic and polite - but you are encouraged to be creative)

In Gratitude

Jaki and The Team @ If Everyone Cares :)

story:
Help Me Volunteer In Tanzania

Hello All,

My name is Brenton and I am looking forward to nothing more than to be able to have the opportunity of going to Nicaragua this upcoming summer and volunteering in the local communities there through a program called GIVE(Growth International Volunteer Excursions). The program is designed to help the local communities, by doing things such as building schools, teaching children english, and so much. My campaign is especially important to me because I strongly believe that we have a duty as humans to help those who need it the most. By donating, your contribution will help fund the trip so that I may help those in Nicaragua build a better future the communities that I will be helping.  

GIVE and Receive 

Every dollar that is donated will be going to fund the trip to Nicaragua. It will not go elsewhere.

For those who would love to donate, here is a list of what you can get by donating! 

  • A $1 donation rewards you a thank you e-mail extending my sincerest thanks for your donation!
  • A $5 donation rewards you with a thank you call expressing how much your donation means to me
  • A $10 donation rewards you with a shout out on social media so that people know how awesome you are for donating!! 
  • A $50 donation will also reward you with a shoutout! But will also land you a sweet video chat with yours truly so that you can see the face you'll be sending to help in Tanzania!
  • A $100 donation rewards you with the above and a $10 gift card to any major US retailer of your choosing! 
  • A $250 donation rewards you with....the above....and....me taking you personally out to dinner! (Only applies to those in the central valley area)
  • A $1000 donation rewards you with the same as above, but I will travel to anywhere in California to take you out to dinner! 

If the sufficient funds are not raised by the end of the period. Your donation will still be used to fund the trip! And I will try other means of trying to fund the rest of my trip!

Your Contribution

There is nothing more satisfying in the world than making a difference in a persons life. Your contributions will not only help me with funding my trip, but help me make a difference in the lives of many people. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel life there is more that you can do to help, you can directly donate to the GIVE program where your money is allocated to help in communities in both Tanzania and Nicaragua! Via this link http://www.givevolunteers.org/donate.html

Thank you so much!

story:
Public transit is an essential service to break the cycle of homelessness that people can get trapped in.  We've launched this campaign to raise public awareness about the specific challenges faced by homeless people, the need to plan for transit access for all, and that there are effective programs in place in other cities.  Let's learn from other cities and meet our community needs.

The Renfrew-Collingwood Home and SAFE Committee is a leader in the not-for-profit sector in addressing homelessness outside the downtown core. Downtown it may be possible to walk to support services - but in the rest of the Metro Vancouver finding a place to live, a job and keeping in touch with friends requires transit access.

Through the support and coordination of homeless services and service agency networks we have worked to: de-stigmatize people that access homeless services and to normalize services to those who are homeless within a middle to low income neighbourhood.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We hope to raise $5,000 to support a public education campaign starting with a public forum October 16th at Collingwood Neighbourhood House. Funds raised will be used for honorariums to support homeless individuals assisting with organizing, travel expenses of invited guests and to provide for public transit access needs of individuals accessing programs. 

Contributions over $10 will receive a charitable tax receipt

Contributions over $25 will be acknowledged in our program + receipt

Contributions over $50 will receive a Collingwood Neighbourhood House umbrella + receipt

The Impact

Our fundraising goal is modest - but it could contribute to significant policy change. We have a massive transit system providing 350 million passenger trips per year - the homeless population is 2,600 people from our last regional count.  It's possible to have specific targeted programs that work to end homelessness and are affordable and effective.  We just need to promote what works and see that it is implemented. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please circulate our campaign information to your friends and networks; please use the share tools on the Indiegogo site. Together we can end homelessness.

story: Due to unexpected circumstances, this campaign is being terminated, but note that Indiegogo does not permit early ending of a campaign, so it needs to run it's course.  Please do not contribute.  All contributions received to date (8/12/2013) will be refunded in full after the campaign ends and Indiegogo releases the funds.

story:
BBRAXTON Exceptional Grooming for Exceptional Men

Hi! My name is Brenda Braxton and I'm so proud to have been able to supply a much needed service by launching BBRAXTON; Exceptional Grooming for Exceptional Men, a men’s grooming salon in New York City. The salon is the first of its kind and occupies 2,000 sq. ft. of storefront in one of the city’s first “green” luxury high rise condominiums. The salon complements this evolution by providing the atmosphere of a traditional gentlemen's club, barber shop and new age spa; offering services such as hot towel straight razor shave, hair cuts and hair styling, body massage and integrated skin care. Patrons can catch up on the news, style trends, watch sports or relax and listen to R&B or Jazz music streams. 

What We Need 

While launching BBRAXTON in 2006 was an amazing undertaking it was also a personal financial drain. At that time bank financing for this new venture was impossible. The lending institutions could not wrap their heads around the concept of an upscale barber shop. So, by refinancing my home I was able to fund the entire start up costs and prove there was a market for this venue. But the economy has taken a toll on everyone and Small Businesess have felt it in a big way! Until now BBRAXTON has been able to survive through shear persistence and continually providing excellent custom service. But I now find I need help to keep our doors open and  go to the next level.

BBRAXTON  is raising  $60,000 to develop a BBRAXTON Product line which will continue to add revenue to the brand, launch a marketing/PR campaign and perform much needed salon repairs. To date, there are no other full service, upscale barbering parlors and spas in upper Manhattan (above 110th Street), thus BBRAXTON can still be considered a first to market venture, setting a precedent which has made it a staple of the present Harlem Community. 

What funds will be used for

BBRAXTON is seeking to establish its own brand of grooming products. Having a branded line of products will help our bottom line by allowing us to have a retail product that can be sold at our salon and website and eventually in other venues.

Our first product line is called First Shave by BBRAXTON ™ which is a three step shaving kit for the young first time shaver. It provides a regimen that  teaches the importance of proper grooming in life. First Shave by BBRAXTON™ is not just another shaving product. It's a young mans first step into manhood. It sets the tone for how he treats himself and how the world views him. To date there are no products that address this young niche. Most shave products are made for mature gentlemen and are too harsh for younger first time shavers. First Shave by BBRAXTON ™ is perfect for this demographic! 

Product Formulation          3,000

Lab Hours               2,000

Packaging Design        2,000

Labels         5,000

Formulation Copy write    550

Labels              5,000

Formulation Copy write      550


MARKETING PUSH      (5 month plan)               15,000

Efforts include the initiation of a sustained marketing strategy utilizing company-sponsored events, public relations and social media to build brand recognition and drive sales in the metro NYC area through its flagship location and the internet

BBRAXTON has secured the social media services of Biz Chica to enhance our marketing presence on the internet. Ideas include the implementation of the BBRAXTON YouTube channel, Twitter feeds, Blog Talk Radio and the continuation of its Facebook Fan Club page

Corporate Events

BBRAXTON will promote its space as a private event space for high profile corporate events. Companies include Black Enterprise, Gillette, American Express, NBA Players Association, NY Urban League Young Professionals, UPTOWN Magazine and other Wall Street Based companies.

Salon Repairs

While being in business for over five years is a great thing, it also put wear and tear on our physical space. We are in need of many repairs. 

Floor repair                               5,000

Wall Paper Repair/Painting      4,000           

                           

Working Capital

The remaining funds would insure the ability for us to have working capital and breathing room...What a concept :)

About Me

 Theater has been my life since I was 19 years old when I got my first Broadway show. I never thought I would find anything that gave me as much pleasure and fulfillment as being on stage until I launched BBRAXTON Exceptional Grooming for Exceptional Men. As an actress I always knew at some point I would have to figure out what I would do on that day when work didn't come as quickly as it use to. So when I launched BBRAXTON and felt the same thrill I knew this was my next passion and career! That feeling was further solidified when in 2009 I was the only woman honored with the “Men of Style Award ” given by Gillette Fuzion and the BBRAXTON salon hosted the Gillette Fuzion Tour in New York City for the second year.

So here's a little about me. I am a native New Yorker (born in the Bronx) and graduate of the High School for the Performing Arts. At the moment I'm starring in an off Broadway show called Cougar The Musical. Previous to that I played  Velma Kelly in Broadway’s hit musical Chicago.  I was also featured on Broadway in the musical revue Smokey Joe’s Cafe, a performance that earned me a 1995 Tony Award nomination, the NAACP Theater Award, the city of Chicago’s Jefferson Award and a Grammy Award for Best Cast Album. My other Broadway credits include Jelly’s Last Jam, Cats, Legs Diamond and the original production of Dreamgirls.

In realizing the importance of giving back, I founded a not -for-profit organization called, Leading Ladies Just for Teens (LLJFT), seminars geared toward empowering young girls to be the best they can be. Leading Ladies began in 1996 at the Virginia Theater while I was performing in Smokey Joe's Cafe. They were a series of seminars designed to encourage, challenge and inspire young girls to dream and set goals. For my work with LLJFT I received the Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. “Living the Dream” Award given by New York Gov. George Pataki and the Josephine Baker Award from the National Council of Negro Women.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help by getting the word out about BBRAXTON by visiting us at BBRAXTON 1400 5th Avenue 212 289-3200 or www.bbraxton.com.  We are ready to pamper our gentlemen! Please feel free to use the Indiegogo Share tools to pass on our story and campaign. 

I THANK YOU IN ADVANCE!
story_txt:
BBRAXTON Exceptional Grooming for Exceptional Men

Hi! My name is Brenda Braxton and I'm so proud to have been able to supply a much needed service by launching BBRAXTON; Exceptional Grooming for Exceptional Men, a men’s grooming salon in New York City. The salon is the first of its kind and occupies 2,000 sq. ft. of storefront in one of the city’s first “green” luxury high rise condominiums. The salon complements this evolution by providing the atmosphere of a traditional gentlemen's club, barber shop and new age spa; offering services such as hot towel straight razor shave, hair cuts and hair styling, body massage and integrated skin care. Patrons can catch up on the news, style trends, watch sports or relax and listen to R&B or Jazz music streams. 
What We Need 
While launching BBRAXTON in 2006 was an amazing undertaking it was also a personal financial drain. At that time bank financing for this new venture was impossible. The lending institutions could not wrap their heads around the concept of an upscale barber shop. So, by refinancing my home I was able to fund the entire start up costs and prove there was a market for this venue. But the economy has taken a toll on everyone and Small Businesess have felt it in a big way! Until now BBRAXTON has been able to survive through shear persistence and continually providing excellent custom service. But I now find I need help to keep our doors open and  go to the next level.
BBRAXTON  is raising  $60,000 to develop a BBRAXTON Product line which will continue to add revenue to the brand, launch a marketing/PR campaign and perform much needed salon repairs. To date, there are no other full service, upscale barbering parlors and spas in upper Manhattan (above 110th Street), thus BBRAXTON can still be considered a first to market venture, setting a precedent which has made it a staple of the present Harlem Community.

story:
***Before you buy tickets for the actual quiz, please pop me a message first to make sure there's still space! (A bit tricky to put options for different paying things on here and get the limited numbers right, but you get the idea!)***

This is basically a site to allow people to both pay their entry fees to the quiz, and to encourage those who can't make it to make a donation, of whatever size, to help bolster the funds we can send to Uganda's Pole Pole Foundation this Christmas, to help them building their school and other important things! - there are different size donate buttons,  from £5 to £500(?! worth a punt...) so just do whatever you can! 

I visited Pole Pole last year, and was bowled over by the work of Jordan who runs the foundation, caring for over 60 kids of all ages. The kids themselves had made over 40,000 bricks to build the on-site school (doing this in their holidays and after school), and now they need help finishing it off - from doors for the toilets to desks and books. Please help us send them a Christmas gift that'll really help!

Prizes on the night include:

A studio session with platinum writer and producer OD Hunte (www.odhunte.com) - you can hear one of his tracks on Radio 1 all this week! Record a favourite cover, an original track, or pick this up as an awesome Christmas present for the aspiring musician in your life!

A pair of cinema tickets at Riverside Studios in Hammersmith

A selection of goodies from www.joythestore.com - more great Christmas presents (or to keep for yourself)

The entire back catalogue from Paper Aeroplanes! ( www.paperaeroplanesmusic.com ) - Amazing Welsh folk band who you'll have heard on the radio or telly or all kinds of places, and who are just cracking.

A personal training session with George Edwards Training - he works with Chelsea Football club!!

A photoshoot with me! www.rosiecollinsphotography.com

story:
How often when you read something online or watch a video clip about a natural disaster, an underfunded program, or a humanitarian crisis do you have an immediate impulse to help?

What if you could – in an instant – share your interest and concern and know that hundreds, thousands – perhaps millions – of others are doing the same. What if you could turn that very kind and generous impulse into an immediate and positive action, an action repeated the world over?


How? Meet George  

George is an online sharing tool that reads content and connects people with the issues they care about. George is unique in that its algorithm reads Web news content and matches charities and non-profit organizations with that content. With the click of a George button, you can instantly give a gift of $1 - a George - to the charity or non-profit concerned with the issue at hand. The George button will be accessed alongside any of the usual social sharing buttons to allow you to express support and provide help.

And unlike existing social giving tools that are static and “direct” funds to just one specific non-profit or charity, George is unique, open, flexible, and operates using the “selected” method, which will allow you to choose from a selection of organizations the one that you feel will work best.

George is the product of an ongoing collaboration of concerned people from tech, finance, media, and the non-profit and charitable sectors who believe that social media can do more to help non-profits and charities. Just as we now impulsively share content: video, stories, news with friends and families, soon George will allow us to assist in a solution: making a small, but significant difference and turning impulse into action.



How do we bring George into a world that needs him?

We have determined that in order to build and develop George, and to take it from the Beta- testing stage to a full public launch of the application, we will need $40,000. This amount will pay for developers to build the algorithm, put the application and basic platform together, and allow the key players in The George Project a six month window to get George up and running. So this is why we are asking for your assistance. And know that every gift of even the smallest amount will go directly towards helping to bring George into the world and - through George - to make that world a better place. Help us build George today.

And of course, above and beyond whatever financial assistance you can provide, we do have some pretty cool perks. First of all, everyone who gives, no matter the size of the donation, will receive a prominent mention on our site as a benefactor of George. Beyond that, we have tote bags and t-shirts and magnets and even elegant covers for the tablet you will one day be Georging on. For those exceptional donors - a $1000 contribution - 50 trees will be planted in your name as part of an ongoing and vital reforestation project. But no matter what you give, nor how much you give, please remember that you will be helping George come to life and will be doing worlds of good.

And even if circumstances will not allow you to help in any financial way, you can still get the word out about George to your Facebook friends, your Twitter followers, and all your other social media networks. Just take a moment and like or share or tweet this page. Or you can copy our URL from the address bar in your browser and email it to those who you know will be interested.


Thank you.



The George Project


     Kurt Sorensen    |   Co-Founder & CEO

Kurt served two tours in the US Army as a Radio Broadcast Journalist and a Russian Translator. He has spent the last 20 years running annual fundraising operations for various charities and non-profits in Colorado, Oregon, and Alaska.

View Kurt's profile


     Robert Prehatney   |   Co-Founder & COO

Robert has a BA and DMD from the University of Pittsburgh. Robert practiced in Millbrook, NY while concurrently developing a high end artisanal jewelry design business with sales and distribution outlets locally and in Manhattan. Robert moved to Brasil in 2004 where he has built a substantial independent business that imports souvenir material from the US, customized for each client (museums, galleries, major bookstore chains, events…), and is fabricated in country with American knowhow and attention to detail. He has been with The George Project from the start, organizing the business side and contributing ideas, time, and energy.

View Robert's profile



   Matt Bassett   |   Creative Director

Matt Bassett is Principal & Executive Producer at One Hundred Robots in NY. He has been a creative director and designer for more than 15 years. He has produced and directed campaigns for clients such as MCA/Universal, Levi’s, MasterCard, Citi, NYSE, Philips, Sony, VH1, Island Records, GAP, Old Navy, 20th Century FOX, and Chronicle Books. Matt currently lives in Brooklyn.

View Matt's profile


    Rosanna Maietta   |   Communications Consultant

Rosanna Maietta is an award-winning global communications executive with 20 years of experience in journalism and communications. Her work in PR has focused on designing and implementing integrated global and national media campaigns, public affairs and crisis and strategic communications.  Her clients have included Fortune 500 companies, government – both foreign and domestic – associations and non-profits. Rosanna has a strong global perspective having lived in Rome, Italy and working as a journalist with international news organizations, covering topics such as politics, travel, and financial news.

View Rosanna's profile


     Forrest French   |   Creative Strategist

Forrest is the principal of FA French, LLC, an architecture practice with additional work in audio-visual and multi-media. He has been a practicing architect, planner, musician, sound recording engineer, and multi-media producer for 20 years and has won awards for both his buildings and music. He has produced, edited, and directed film/video for exhibits, marketing campaigns, and a variety of other multi-media endeavors. His active in his community as Vice-President of the American Institute of Architects, Richmond Chapter and as Chairman of the Main Street Revitalization Program in the small town near his rural home.

View Forrest French's profile



     Peter Quinn   |  Creative Strategist

Peter Quinn is an award-winning creative director and brand strategist in Washington D.C. with over 18 years’ experience working in brand development, integrated marketing strategies, influence, messaging, and cause-related marketing. His roster of clients includes well known fortune 500 companies as well as small non-profits and NGO’s. Peter cultivates unique creative approaches through design, messaging, and integrated strategies that can be a catalyst for social change.

View Peter Quinn's profile



     Ed Marsee   |   CFO

Ed is owner and operator of Certified Public Accounting in Freehold, NJ. He has operated his firm since 1995. The firm specializes in aid to small and startup businesses in the New York metro area. From 1980 to 1995 he was Chief Financial Officer for Wilson Logistics, Inc., a supply chain management and industrial services provider. Ed is a CPA and has a Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting from Montclair State University.

View Ed's profile

story:
Introduction:

Dear funders, 

We are a small startup business located in Delaware. The Idea behind 1 Software Place is to obtain all your software needs from one place with excellent customer service and realtime updates.

After tons of research and a lot of school experience, one common theme we found is that there are barely any businesses that are able to provide Software applications, Mobile applications, and Websites/Web Applications at one place. Of all these businesses, we also found that they all lacked customer service and flexbility. 

So we decided to build a business that provides all three applications with great customer service.

What we really do:

1 Software Place specializes in software solutions for small businesses in the greater Delaware area. Given our experience with software development and web design, we can offer a unique and personalized service to small businesses. The services we offer include website development, web application development, web hosting, software applications, mobile applications, maintenance, marketing, and analysis.

Three Pillars of Success:

Customer Service     Transparency    Cost Effeciency

                         

For more information about us visit:

www.1splace.com/about

www.1splace.com

or

www.contemporarysoftwaresolutions.com

 

What We need from You:

As everyone knows, starting a business without any startup funds is nearly impossible. We would like you to invest in us for the rewards we can actually offer.

Goal: $20,000

Where the money is going:

-Software

        -Adobe Licenses

-Hardware

       -Computers

       -Professional Camera

-Legal Fees

       - Patents, Copyrights, Contracts

-Office space

-Utilities

Thank You Page: www.1splace.com/thankyou

$1: Your name will be included in our thank you page.

(Your Name)

$5: Your name will be bolded in our thank you page. 

(Your Name)

$10: Your name will be bolded and green in our thank you page.

(Your Name)

$25: We will graphically design your name on our thank you page. 

 

$50: We will make you a logo on our thank you page.

 

$250: We will create you a logo that links to your own personal page.

(Logolink)

$500: We will create you a logo that links to your own personal mobile enabled page.

(Logolink)

$1000: We will create you a logo that links to your website with up to 3 pages.

(Logolink)+

$5000: We will create you a logo that links to a website which we will create for you, with mobile compability.

(Logolink)++Mobile Site

Goal: $20,000
Where the money is going:
-Software
        -Adobe Licenses
-Hardware
       -Computers
       -Professional Camera
-Legal Fees
       - Patents, Copyrights, Contracts
-Office space
-Utilities

Thank You Page: www.1splace.com/thankyou

$1: Your name will be included in our thank you page.
(Your Name)

$5: Your name will be bolded in our thank you page. 
(Your Name)

$10: Your name will be bolded and green in our thank you page.
(Your Name)

$25: We will graphically design your name on our thank you page. 
 



$50: We will make you a logo on our thank you page.

 

$250: We will create you a logo that links to your own personal page.
(Logolink)

$500: We will create you a logo that links to your own personal mobile enabled page.
(Logolink)

$1000: We will create you a logo that links to your website with up to 3 pages.
(Logolink)+


$5000: We will create you a logo that links to a website which we will create for you, with mobile compability.
(Logolink)++Mobile Site

story:
The Challenge

On 7 June 2014, Elsa Hammond will depart from Monterey Bay, California to row at least 2,400 miles across the Pacific Ocean to Hawaii. Alone in a 24 foot rowing boat for up to three months, she will be subject to storms, seasickness and the psychological effects of so much time in total isolation. Along the way she will have encounters with rare marine life, plastic pollution, huge waves, flat calms, and many other experiences unique to rowing thousands of miles alone across open ocean. 

Elsa is competing in the Great Pacific Race 2014: the inaugural rowing race in the Pacific Ocean organised by New Ocean Wave. Some may be familiar with the Atlantic rowing race, whichrunseach winter between La Gomera and Antigua. The Great Pacific Race is similar, but is the first ocean rowing race to attempt to cross part of the largest ocean in the world, and is therefore a big step forward in ocean rowing. There are no engines or sails involved in the race – instead, crews rely on their own muscle to propel their boats 2400 miles to Hawaii. New Ocean Wave have said that, “due to advances in on-board technology, boat design and materials, race organizers expect that most of the 24ft long, 6ft wide boats participating will break the route’s current world record of 64 days, set in 1997.” However, solo rowers like Elsa may well take up to 100 days to complete the race, depending on weather and conditions. The boats are ruggedly built to withstand the conditions that they will face in the Pacific, and will self-right in the event of capsize. Living conditions are basic: the toilet is a bucket, and drinking water is desalinated seawater. Elsa is currently the only female solo entrant from the UK.

Elsa is rowing in aid of the Plastic Oceans Foundation, an amazing charity that is tackling plastic pollution in our oceans. It is a UK based charity with international reach, and works to raise awareness of plastic pollution through film, education and social media. The race will take Elsa just south of the ‘Great Pacific garbage patch’, the most notorious example of concentrated plastic pollution, and Elsa is keen to raise awareness of this issue through her blog and updates during the row. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Ocean rowing isn't cheap! The whole project will cost £100,000. The majority of this will come from corporate sponsorship, but Elsa is hoping to raise £25,000 from individual and small business contributions to pay for the boat. On top of the boat there is a huge amount of equipment, insurance, race fees, travel and shipping, courses, accommodation at both ends, and food (8,000 calories a day!), which will come to around £100,000. Anything that Elsa raises over what is needed to make the row happen will go to charity and to raising awareness of the cause. She will not benefit financially from the row at all; aside from wanting to raise as much as possible to fight plastic pollution, it is against race rules!

There is a range of exciting perks ready for you to get your hands on, from personal phone calls from the middle of the ocean, to exclusive invitations to the launch party, to original artwork inspired by challenging the Pacific. Any perk over £5 also includes all the cheaper perks as well, so you get a whole range of exciting things for your money! Please get in touch if you wish to ask about any of the perks in more detail (and let me know if you'd rather remain anonymous).

Elsa is hoping to raise the full £25,000 in this campaign to pay for her boat. Not to worry if the full amount is not reached, however - every little bit helps towards this exciting challenge, and nothing will be wasted. 

 

The Rower

Elsa rowed for her college at Oxford, and spent some time training with the University Women’s Squad at Durham. She has a history of adventurous expeditions, including unicycling across England, and sailing in the South Pacific. Elsa was born with a club foot, and has had multiple operations on it - the first when she was only months old. Having spent so much time in plaster when she was young made Elsa determined not to let this hold her back.She is determined, engaged and able to take on this challenge; she will spend the next year preparing her body and mind for the physical exertions and isolation of the row, as well as spending more time on the open water, and undertaking four courses with the Royal Yachting Association. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people are unable to contribute financially but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. Get in contact to see how you can get involved with this exciting project - the more people we have on board, the better! Also, please spread the word as much as you can - on Facebook, Twitter, by email, at work, with friends and family, and by using the Indiegogo share tools. 

Thank you, all you wonderful people!

Thank you, all you wonderful people!

story:
I'll sum it up first, then to the story... 

We need $2,500.00 so that I, a young single mom, can get my Driver's License back!  No lies here, only humble honesty. I owe this money to the DMV for an accident that I was involved in a few years ago. It has been too long, and my family needs to be road worthy!  Imagine grocery shopping for a family without a car!  I don't want you to buy me a car, I am just asking you to help me become a legal driver again, so that maybe I can borrow one from time to time. It may sound small to you, but my life would be immeasurably simpler. 

If you decide you can help (THANKYOUTHANKYOUTHANKYOU), please take advantage of the Perks I have set up!  We would love to make you something to show our appreciation!  And remember: even a small amount will add to the bigger picture.

All donations up to the goal, even if goal is not reached, will go toward paying the DMV fees that are owed.  Any amount of money donated that exceeds the set goal will go into a savings fund we will be working on to buy an inexpensive used vehicle of our own. 

Now for the slightly more gritty details of the sometimes painful truth, and my ride through tough lessons learned. 

 

Me and My Family...

           and the accident.

Hi there! My name is Kit.  I'm a young woman, and single mother of one beautiful seven year old girl named Zoe (she is the artist of the rocket picture).  I have worked hard all my life, never had anything handed to me.  I have fed, clothed, and sheltered myself since I was 15 and have provided all that my daughter has ever needed since her birth.  I was reacquainted with my own father when I was 20 (five years ago) and as an to attempt to mend some wounds he gave me the wonderful gift of a used car!  It wasn't much, but it was a convertible.  Sure, she might have been an old LeBaron, not much to look at, but she was mine and I could put the top down.  I felt so cool.  I had just gotten my license at the time.  Since I had been on my own at 15 I had never learned to drive, but having a young child made getting around incredibly difficult.  The car, and the driver's license, lifted a huge weight off my shoulders. Fast forward to just short of a year later. The worst thing I could have imagined came true.  I crashed that car.

 My daughter was in the back, and I thank Graco everyday for making a good carseat.  She wasn't injured at all.  I was another story though.  On the surface, I was ok.  The air bag knocked me out, but luckily it didn't give me a concussion.  My arm was all kinds of dark ominous colors from hitting something, but what really started to hurt after a while was my psyche.  Maybe it is worth mentioning that someone I was very close with had died in a car accident only months before, and I had still not recovered from the loss.  But I don't cave to my emotions, so instead I tried to brush it all off. What a mistake. I ended up having a long road to travel before I was able to face and deal with all the aftermath of that accident.  My father, who had a serious drinking problem at the time, had misinformed me about having added me to his insurance plan, as the car was still registered to him.  Since I did't have insurance, I was automatically found at fault. I lost my license, and began to have panic attacks in vehicles, especially when I was no longer the driver.  I felt like I was putting my life into someone else's hands, and I couldn't be sure they knew the true gravity of that.  Now, 4 years later, I have made a great deal of progress.  I have grown, and changed.  I have let go of the people I have lost, and accepted that life is a mess sometimes, and that mistakes do not make me a flawed person.  I'm even going to college, moving towards a career in Art Therapy.   And all through these last four years I have walked to the grocery store with a fold up rolling cart every single week.  I have hauled christmas presents on a two hour bus trip.  I have biked and skateboarded from one end of California to the other and walked more miles that I can count... And the truth is, I'm tired. I'm getting older, and I NEED to get my license back.  I don't know anyone that is as safe on the road as I am because no one has the kind of motivation to be a safe driver that I do. Get me on the road so I can take my daughter on vacation! Get me on the road so we can get a whole month's worth of groceries at once!  Get me on the road so I don't have to wonder how long it would take me to run uphill to the hospital if there were an emergency. Help me have the same piece of mind that so many families have. 

It's funny how things change.  I suppose all we can do, as human beings, is try to navigate that change in the direction of positivity. 

  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please help me spread the word.  Share my campaign on Facebook and Twitter, and whatever other crazy social networking gadgets you're using!  Thank-You!!!

story:
Introduction

Thanks a lot for checking out my campaign!
 
One day I found myself crawling around under my car in the parking lot of a DIY store, struggling to find a place to secure a piece of string that I had tied to the rear window viper. I thought to myself: "Why isn't there a more convenient solution to this! Every car owner must have had this problem several times!".
 
So I started developing the product, and after several prototypes and extensive testing, I arrived at something that is simple and intuitive to use, and just works!

The reason for this campaign

Now the product is here - I have "bootstrapped" the project all the way. So with nothing but my own savings, I have developed the product and had a small batch produced, but I need your help to really get it off the ground. Specifically I have to:

1.Create a better packaging design with better images and graphics, so it will look better in the shops

2. Get the packaging and instructions translated to several languages

3. Add a small brightly colored bag, for increased safety while the product is in use, and for convenience when it is not in use

4. Get the product certified by an accredited testing agency

These things cost money, and require larger production runs. Your support will be a great help in order to take these next steps. And every bit helps - that is why I have chosen a flexible funding campaing, because even if I don't reach the full target I can still get started.

 

How it works

Step 1: Push the buckle with the closed loop into the active part of the boot/trunk lid until you hear a "click".

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Step 2: Hook the other buckle into the passive part of the boot/trunk lid.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Step 3: Carefully tighten the strap with one hand, while supporting the boot/trunk lid with the other hand. Pull until the boot/trunk lid touches the protruding objects, and there is no slack between the buckles.

 

 

 

 

 

Step 4: All set and ready to go! Use the strap to mark the end of the objects you are transporting if need be.

The brightly colored bag will be attached to the end of the strap, for increased visibility in these situations.

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help with spreading the word, by letting your friends know of this campaing, share on facebook, twitter, g+ etc. and by using the Indiegogo sharing tools. And if you are interested in selling The Boot Strap in your shop, or know someone who might be, then please don't hesitate to contact me.
 
Thanks a lot for your trust and support!
 
//Thomas

story:
OUR NEW PERK AT $5000 INCLUDES YOUR AIRFARE, TRANSPORTATION, FOOD AND HOUSING.

Here is an article about our effort in the Newpaper. Click this link to read it.

Note:Our business model adapted since the above article ran. You'll see below. We posted it because it provides a good overview and a few great photos.

All questions can be directed to:

Conrad Evarts (406) 475-4994 or conradevarts@hotmail.com 

Digital Connect is a small computer shop in Nairobi, Kenya.

Sisters Irene and Maureen operate Digital Connect. I have known them for seven years and their father for thirteen. My name is Conrad Evarts and over the past 13 years I've traveled extensively throughout Eastern and Southern Africa for my work as a television camera operator. You can read from the article linked above that Irene and I have worked successfully to take her from running a plow in her village to lecturing about computers at the University. She also writes code and adapts software to the Kenyan market.

We're now taking things to the next level. We are in the first few months of opening Digital Connect. It is a small shop selling laptops and tablets to students. We are selling new items at the moment because we can ship them from the US without paying tariffs. Irene now wants to expand into locally acquired refurbished computers for people that can't afford new units.

The new and refurbished computer sales will eventually fund a training center for ladies who want to increase their earning power by learning software. The training center will be operated by Irene and will be in the same neighborhood.

What do we need?

  • Capital for refurbished computers. $300 USD per unit.

Why should you trust us?

  • You can meet us anytime. We'll chat on the phone or tour you around Nairobi. Heck, come up to Montana and I'll take you fishing.
  • So far this entire endeavor is funded by my (Conrad) middle class salary. In fact I'm selling my car today (April 18) so I have more cash to invest when we return in June. I believe in Irene and the Kenyan economy very deeply.

The Impact

We will grow this model of hi-tech opportunities for women across Kenya by eventualy franchising Digital Connect. Selling curios and soda pop is fine use of microloans for some women, but just as in the US there are Kenyan women that are capable of much more. The educated, energetic Kenyan woman owns a nimble and creative mind. By investing in this energy and creativity we all have the opportunity to benefit financially and environmentally.

The Timing

I am heading back to Nairobi in June with my 14 year old daughter. we will be working with Irene and Maureen to grow this business, buy a business vehicle and work on understanding the market more thoroughly. We want to have the refurb investment money together before then so we can make a bulk purchase and restock the shop in mid-June.

What do you get?

  • A look into east Africa’s largest economy and an opportunity to learn about investing in one of the world’s thriving developing economies.
  • An opportunity to assist in sustainable, long-term alleviation of poverty.
  • The ability to begin manifesting your dream of visiting Kenya in an authentic way by developing relationships with Kenyans.

What else do you get?

For $35...

For $50 We will send you this beautiful pair of photos Laurie took in 2006 of Irene's Grandparents. When Laurie snapped these photos outside their home in Musalala where Irene grew up the "Grands" were married for 70 years. They were very proud of Irene's accomplishements at University. We are also posting a suggestion for framing. We can't afford to frame these, but this is how we did this in our home and it makes a great conversation piece. These are the first three photos in our gallery.

 

For $2500: "Investment Safari"

The business desperately needs a car. We will be offering an "Investment Safari" to donors who contribute $2500 or more. This will be a series of meetings in Nairobi with young entrepreneurs over the course of four days. Irene and I will be your guides. If you like, we will also arrange for an animal safari (at your expense) to the Masi Mara and a few days in the mountains spending time with Bantu people. It will be a blast and get your feet wet in this incredible country filled with opportunity.

For $7500: 2006 Mercury Montego

This is Conrad's car. By selling it we can pay down our little bit of debt and have cash to buy more computers in June.

106,5xx miles. Clean Carfax. VIN 1MEFM40106G611210

Well maintained and clean. Huge backseat and trunk, balanced ride and handling, attractive and functional cabin, excellent visibility. V6 3.0 6 speed transmission. 19/26 mpg. Traction Control. This is the two wheel drive model. This car handles very well in winter driving conditions and is very comfortable. 

Will deliver within 800 miles of Helena, MT for $8000

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out. If you're a broke college student, send this to your rich uncle.

So far this entire endeavor is funded by my (Conrad) middle class salary. In fact I'm selling my car today (April 18) so I have more cash to invest when we return in June. I believe in Irene and the Kenyan economy very deeply.

The Impact


We will grow this model of hi-tech opportunities for women across Kenya by eventualy franchising Digital Connect. Selling curios and soda pop is fine use of microloans for some women, but just as in the US there are Kenyan women that are capable of much more. The educated, energetic Kenyan woman owns a nimble and creative mind. By investing in this energy and creativity we all have the opportunity to benefit financially and environmentally.
The Timing
I am heading back to Nairobi in June with my 14 year old daughter. we will be working with Irene and Maureen to grow this business, buy a business vehicle and work on understanding the market more thoroughly. We want to have the refurb investment money together before then so we can make a bulk purchase and restock the shop in mid-June.
What do you get?

A look into east Africa’s largest economy and an opportunity to learn about investing in one of the world’s thriving developing economies.
An opportunity to assist in sustainable, long-term alleviation of poverty.
The ability to begin manifesting your dream of visiting Kenya in an authentic way by developing relationships with Kenyans.
What else do you get?
For $35...
For $50 We will send you this beautiful pair of photos Laurie took in 2006 of Irene's Grandparents. When Laurie snapped these photos outside their home in Musalala where Irene grew up the "Grands" were married for 70 years. They were very proud of Irene's accomplishements at University. We are also posting a suggestion for framing. We can't afford to frame these, but this is how we did this in our home and it makes a great conversation piece. These are the first three photos in our gallery.



 
For $2500: "Investment Safari"
The business desperately needs a car. We will be offering an "Investment Safari" to donors who contribute $2500 or more. This will be a series of meetings in Nairobi with young entrepreneurs over the course of four days. Irene and I will be your guides. If you like, we will also arrange for an animal safari (at your expense) to the Masi Mara and a few days in the mountains spending time with Bantu people. It will be a blast and get your feet wet in this incredible country filled with opportunity.
For $7500: 2006 Mercury Montego
This is Conrad's car. By selling it we can pay down our little bit of debt and have cash to buy more computers in June.
106,5xx miles. Clean Carfax. VIN 1MEFM40106G611210
Well maintained and clean. Huge backseat and trunk, balanced ride and handling, attractive and functional cabin, excellent visibility. V6 3.0 6 speed transmission. 19/26 mpg. Traction Control. This is the two wheel drive model. This car handles very well in winter driving conditions and is very comfortable. 
Will deliver within 800 miles of Helena, MT for $8000


Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out. If you're a broke college student, send this to your rich uncle.

story:
2013 Student/Farmworker Alliance Encuentro

Since 2000 the Student/Farmworker Alliance (SFA) has been fighting in solidarity, hand in hand, with one of the most successful, inclusive and creative farmworker justice movement of our generation, the Coalition of Immokalee Workers (CIW).

SFA is a national network of students and youth organizing with farmworkers to eliminate sweatshop conditions and modern-day slavery in the fields. 

Come this September, one of our most important traditions will continue as students and youth from across the SFA network converge in Immokalee, Florida — the birthplace of one of the most effective movements for dignity and justice that our generation has seen — for the annual SFA Encuentro: an in-depth weekend of relationship-building, training, strategizing and reflection.

What are we fundraising for?

Each year, allies from all over the nation come to Immokalee for a weekend of strategy and movement building. SFA is dedicated to providing this opportunity to anyone who desires to be part of it. As such, we are seeking to raise funds for travel scholarships. 

What you donate here will go directly to the cost of supporting the students and youth traveling thousands of miles to be part of this in-depth weekend of strategizing, relationship-building, training and reflection. All participants are encouraged to fundraise on their own as well, so funds are coming from a variety of fundraising efforts. 

Other Ways You Can Help

contribute financially but would still like to support student and youth participation and development in the Campaign for Fair Food

 

If you can't contribute financially but would still like to support student and youth participation in the Campaign for Fair Food, you can:

  • Encourage friends to apply to the Encuentro! Deadline is August 12th.
  • Pass along this fundraising opportunity to friends and family!
  • Visit the SFA and CIW websites to find out how you can stay involved locally.
  • Email us at organize(at)sfalliance.org if you have more questions!
