story:
Who are we?

Hannah Conner, owner, and founder of the Little Lehigh Market Garden, first cultivated her love of plants and fresh food in her grandfather's vegetable patch.  This passion for things that grow lead her to pursue a B.S in Horticulture. After acquiring her degree, she ventured to the Washington D.C. area, where she became immersed in Organic CSA farming at Clagett Farm, operated by the Chesapeake Bay Foundation. After 3 years of farming at Clagett, she decided to return to her hometown and took the position of Field Manager at Anchor Run CSA. Now with 6 years of organic growing experience, Hannah is thrilled to be fulfilling her dream of operating her own farm and hopes that her food and flowers will bring nourishment and happiness to the community!

 

Lauren Rosse, field manager, is passionate about environmental preservation, and local healthy food. She has a B.A. in Non-Fiction Writing and over 3 years of farming experience including a summer working with Hannah at Anchor Run CSA. Lauren looks forward to using both her farming and writing skills to ensure Little Lehigh Market Garden is a benefit to the community.

 

Mark Conner: Mark (Hannah's brother and Lauren's high school sweetheart) has a B.A. in English as well as a Masters of Library Science. Mark also spent time working for Hannah at Anchor Run CSA during college. Mark will mostly work off the farm but looks forward to participating at the market and reminding Hannah and Lauren to occasionally leave the field!

 

Mark Lichtenwalner: Mark's family has owned and operated this farm for three generations. Mark produces a selection of specialty vegetables on a portion of the property and will serve as a mentor for Hannah as she begins her journey as a farm owner.

 

About Our Farm

Beginning in Spring of 2019, we will produce all of your favorite summer vegetables as well as berries, herbs, baby salad mixes, and handmade flower bouquets.

 

Our growing practices will reflect our purpose to nourish and positively impact our community.  This means we grow with human and environmental health in mind. While we will not be certified Organic, we will follow USDA Organic standards that prohibit the use of dangerous synthetic chemicals as well as follow principles that promote biodiversity, protect the local watershed, and protect soil structure.

Our soil fertility will be provided by natural sources of nutrients such as compost. Pests will be controlled by physical barriers such as fencing and insect netting.  To reduce damage to the soil and prevent erosion, we plan to use a permanent bed system that reduces how often the soil is worked and includes perennial buffer strips that will soak up excess water and nutrients during rain events. The buffer strips will be planted in perennial flowers and herbs that encourage biodiversity on the farm and create a habitat for pollinators.
 

D.E Lichtenwalner Farms

In response to the limited farmland in Macungie and a passion for protecting local agriculture, the Lichtenwalner family made the decision to seek out young farmers who wanted to bring fresh food to their hometown. As a result, our market garden sits on 1.5 acres of the Lichtenwalner family farm.

 

The Lichtenwalner family has owned and operated the farm for the past three generations. For many years it produced traditional crops like wheat, potatoes, corn, and soy. For the past several years, farm owner Mark has been growing summer vegetables including tomatoes, melons, and sweet corn.

story:
UPDATES:

January 18, UPDATE:
We're setting a NEW GOAL of $30,000! If you haven't yet found the PERK of your dreams, we hope you'll take another look. In the coming days, we will adding more of the popular items and coming up with some new items!

January 7, UPDATE:
We ordered the Mugnanini Oven yesterday!!! Thanks to all of you!!

January 2, UPDATE:
Bob and I are completely humbled by all of the support! Thank you all very much! 

Short Summary

Gourmet au Bay turned 20 in 2015! And because of supporters like you, we have grown to a point that our current location is just not working for us (and more importantly, YOU!). We need a bigger outside area, we need more parking, we need more inside seating...fortunately, we've been able to secure the only other available waterfront location in Bodega Bay. And we are expanding the concept of GAB to include a wood fired oven! The move is planned for April 2016.

All the planning and designing we are doing is with our customers in mind. We want the GAB experience to be better than ever. We are so excited about the opportunity to create an even better Gourmet au Bay.

That's where you come in. This move, although needed, wasn't entirely in the long term plan. We want to offer our customers some awesome deals in exchange for helping us procure the BEST wood fired oven - manufactured right here in Sonoma County!

What We Need & What You Get

The Mugnaini Wood Fired Oven is the best for what we want to create. The great news is the oven will be visible from the shop, so you will be able to watch flatbreads being fired in the kitchen.

The oven we need is $10,500. All the funds from this campaign will go toward the oven. Any funds over and above the cost of the oven will help us to offset the cost of building out the kitchen and shop.

We are offering some really awesome perks - discounted gift cards, exclusive T-Shirts and Hats, party's for you and your friends. AND our original Wine Surfboards are up for grabs! (Don't worry, we're having new ones made...Wine Surfing isn't going anywhere!)

The Impact

The difference this move and expansion will make for Gourmet au Bay is big! Because we are moving off the highway, we're confident the addition of a kitchen will entice folks to go the extra mile to find us. 

We know you all are behind us and want us to continue. That's why we are asking for your help.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge other than budget is making sure that we are able to reach our customers - old and new! We've put together a great team of folks to help us design the new space and the menu. We have a marketing plan in place to get the word out about our new location. But our biggest asset are the customers that have supported us through the years.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any help you can offer! 

  • Tell your friends!
  • Share on social media!
  • Send us some good vibes!
  • Come see us when we get moved in!

story:
Summary

We are Bob and Lydia Whitley. Lydia has been a professional chef on cruise ships and for major hotels and I've been a professional businessman and property manager for over 40 years. Between us we have over 60 years in hospitality and have established our own brand of B&B in Bali.  We started building our brand in late 2010 and by 2013 we were the number one B&B in Jimbaran, Bali on TripAdvisor out of 53, and in the top 25 in Indonesia. With only 3 rooms, we have held on to the number one spot ever since. Aahh Bali Bed & Breakfast can be found on TripAdvisor.com, Booking.com, Agoda.com, Airbnb.com, Flipkey.com and others. Seraya will be our second location.

Our philosophy is to treat our guests like friends and the way we wanted to be treated when we traveled. Any place you travel is only as nice as the people you meet there. Before people even come to us, we provide them with a 3 page list of Bali Tips and when they arrive we help them with their itinerary, transportation and whatever they may need to get the most from their visit to Bali. 

We have bought some land with beautiful unobstructable 180 degree ocean views and started to build our next location with 7 rooms and a full time restaurant. To date the structure is up, the access is in, power and water are in, and we have no debt or mortgage. We are starting to put up the retaining wall for the pool. You can see the site on our video and our website https://aahhbali.net  under "site progress". This is located in an unspoiled part of Bali that is not over run with tourists and offers a true Bali experience. What is that you might ask? Bali is truly like no other place on earth. Some of the most friendly, open, kind, polite, accepting people you will find anywhere. No road rage, no angry hostile people (other than the rare foreigner). Always in the top ten island destinations list and probably the cheapest of them all. The serenity and beauty of this island will make you not want to leave and will keep you coming back.

We would like to invite you to share our dream and help us complete this project sooner than later. We are building the most Eco friendly project we can, catching rain water, using gray water for toilets and plants, having our own solar power and hopefully enough to power some of the village and give back to the community. We've tried to create a perk package for every budget from one week to 20 year leases. The weekly packages are transferable, sell able and don't expire. Of course the leases are sell able and transferable as well. See our "Retire to Bali" page on aahhbali.net. Please consider helping us and discovering something you will cherish as we do, BALI. 

We are looking to raise $150,000 USD. This will finish our project and create an Eco friendly B&B with it's own power grid, fabulous views through double pane windows with low E glass for high efficiency, along with an eye on water conservation. The more power we can save the more we can pass on to the local village. As much of this project as possible will provide jobs and opportunities for the Indonesian people from the construction itself to the furnishings inside. Everything that possibly can, will be made locally. If the funding goal is met we can open within 4 to 6 months. If it is not, we will continue and finish as our cash flow will allow, but we will finish and all perks will be guaranteed at our current location after July 1, 2016, until it IS finished.

We are also offering an incentive plan for those that may not be able to afford to buy in at the higher levels. If any of you know someone and refer them to us and they buy into the 20 week package, as a referral perk you will receive one week for your referral.

RISK: For those of you buying weeks, your worse case scenario risk will be that you will book into our current location to start using your weeks until the project has completed. For those people buying leases, those units will be completed first and will be usable, but your worse case scenario might be waiting for the completion of all the amenities. In that event your lease period will not start until everything is complete.

Check us out on our website https://aahhbali.com or any of the above websites (bottom of the first paragraph) we are on and of course our website on this project https://aahhbali.net

story:
At the Yuva Ekta Foundation we believe in the Power of Youth to transform the world around them, and thus constantly create opportunities, to enable them become agents of positive social change!

Our one such project has been The Young Visionary through which we have sensitized youth on issues like Environment, Waste Management and Human Rights. The Young Visionary Festivals have been spaces of great fun, learning and experience for school and NGO students from across the country, as “Stakeholders in Sustainability.”

Delhi has become one of the most polluted cities in the world and solid waste management requires immediate attention. Despite many attempts by the government and municipal corporations, we still continue to produce 8000 tones of solid waste every day, most of which finds its way to illegal landfills in the city.

The time has come to take ownership of the city we call home, and address the problem of waste management at its roots.

The Young Visionary 2015 will focus on Waste Management and Environment Sustainability.

Through this project we will mobilize 400 young individuals passionate to make Delhi a cleaner, greener city. These ‘Young Visionaries’ will actively engage with communities across Delhi/NCR and come up with community specific solutions to work on issues of waste segregation and recycling. We will also use ‘Social Arts’ to sensitize the public and encourage them to take responsibility and ownership of their community.

What you see in this video is a sample of our work in Jahangirpuri, a resettlement colony on the outskirts of Delhi. We plan to implement this project in 9 other marginalised communities like Mahipalpur, Trilokpori, Tis Hazari, Ramesh Nagar, Najafgarh, Salahpur, Okhla, Kotla and Vikaspuri.  We have also tied up as our Resource partners, NGOs with expertise in Environment and Waste Management like TERI, Goonj, Chintan and Toxics Link.

Join the movement! Become a Young Visionary!


What We Need & What You Get

We need Your help to make this happen. The funds we raise through this campaign will be used to facilitate sensitization programs, start up-cycling centers, create vermi-compost pits and organize street plays to be performed in public spaces and institutions.
Each of our funders will get very special merchandise which will be the output of our up-cycling workshops with schools, NGOs and communities. 
In case we do not reach our target, we will still continue the work but will have to scale down the outreach and planned activities.

The Impact

Through this project we reach out to marginalized communities and urban villages and slums in Delhi and generate awareness about the issue of 'Solid Waste Management' and initiate on-ground projects.

Through our up-cycling centers create opportunities for Social Entrepreneurship.

Create community-specific models and innovative solutions which can be replicated in other communities and cities.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this initiative with your friends and family and on social media. 
  • You can partner/volunteer with us. For details please get in touch at bhanu@yuvaektafoundation.org

In case we do not reach our target, we will still continue the work but will have to scale down the outreach and planned activities.

    The Impact Through this project we reach out to marginalized communities and urban villages and slums in Delhi and generate awareness about the issue of 'Solid Waste Management' and initiate on-ground projects.
Through our up-cycling centers create opportunities for Social Entrepreneurship.
Create community-specific models and innovative solutions which can be replicated in other communities and cities.


    Other Ways You Can Help  Please share this initiative with your friends and family and on social media.  You can partner/volunteer with us. For details please get in touch at bhanu@yuvaektafoundation.org

story:
We’d like to give a heartfelt “thank you” to all 169 contributors + the countless others who spread the word about our campaign and helped us surpass our $12,500 stretch goal!

For those who weren't able to participate in the campaign, it's not too late to support Wine Down & get some awesome swag:

Order your "Drink Up!" t-shirt or hoodie today, and every time you wear it to Wine Down, you'll get 10% off your bill!


Above: Sarah Garand & Jaime Hiraishi, Wine Down's Founders & Co-Owners

At the end of. . . well, most days, we like to relax and unwind with a good glass (or three) of wine. We call this glorious time “wine down.”

When we worked office jobs in downtown San Francisco, we'd count down the minutes until we could grab after-work drinks.  No matter how many places we tried, we never found the right bar. We’d consistently find ourselves sacrificing quality, comfort, or our hard-earned dollars, and so were our co-workers and friends.

One day (over some wine, of course), we decided to take the leap and create that magical spot ourselves.  We set out to make drinking wine and beer more fun, sustainable, and down-to-earth so you’ll always have the perfect place to "wine down" your days.

We've been researching, planning, and working on Wine Down for over two years. We asked over 100 people what they want in a bar—they answered and, through Wine Down, we'll deliver:

Value:  We're all about maximizing enjoyment, so we won't compromise on quality or affordability.  We’ve searched high and low to find the best, local wine and beer at a good price from producers who share our values.  We'll also offer bites with the same philosophy.

A laid-back vibe: We believe a bar should be a fun place to hang out and relax, without any fuss.  That's why we're building a cool, simple bar with a short menu, so you can spend less time deciding what to drink and more time drinking. We'll rotate it frequently so there's always something new.

Good, friendly people: We want you to feel like this is your "Cheers!"  We'll celebrate your good days and will be here for you on the tough ones.  Never shy away from asking us a question or letting us know what you think of your glass. Our job is to make sure you're enjoying yourself and your drinks.

We're launching this campaign to give our community the opportunity to get more involved with Wine Down's early 2016 opening and to bring some of the finer details of Wine Down to life.

With your support, we're aiming to raise $10,000.  We've personally invested our own savings, as have many of our family and friends, but this campaign will help us cross the finish line with everything from outfitting our outside patio to getting precious under-counter hooks in place.

Above: Rendering of Wine Down's exterior

We're beyond excited to “wine down” with you in Spring 2016! 

If you can't contribute to the campaign at this time, you can still help us out:

  • Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter
  • Share this campaign with and spread the word to your friends! Sample posts below
  • Visit us when we open! We'll be at 685 Folsom Street (at 3rd)

Here's sample a Facebook post and Tweet to get you started:

  • Facebook: Wine. Beer. Parties.  Need I say more?  Join me in supporting @WineDownSF: http://igg.me/at/winedownsf #WineDownDrinkUp
  • Twitter: Join me in supporting @Wine_Down_SF, a cool new #bar in SF!  http://igg.me/at/winedownsf #WineDownDrinkUp

Thank you so much for all of your support!

Special thanks to Harold Nguyen for the embarrassing, but awesomely done video and to all of our friends and family who have been along for this ride!

685 Folsom Street (@3rd St.)
San Francisco, CA 94107

Questions, Comments, Ideas?  Email: sarah [at] winedownsf.com

story:
Kes me oleme?

Oleme Märt ja Triinu Tartust. Märt on juba pikka aega unistanud oma lauamängu kohvikust ja läbinud selleks Tartu töötukassa ettevõtluskoolituse. Lauamängud on paelunud juba mitmeid aastaid. Alustatud sai ikka Monopolyst ja Reis ümber maailmast kuid nüüdseks meeldivad tõsisemad strateegiad ja ajude ragistamised nagu Agricola, Wormhole ja Android: Netrunner. Triinu õpib hetkel Tartu Ülikoolis ajalugu. Talle on alati meeldinud seigelda - läbi raamatute, tegeledes muinas-rollimänguga, samuti on ta enda jaoks avastanud lauamängud. Seiklushimu viis teda ka vahetusaastale Koreasse, kus ta sattus elus esimest korda lauamängu kohvikusse. Kahekesi paneme pead kokku ja anname endast kõik, et tuua lauamängud Eestlastele veelgi lähemale.

Mis on lauamängukohvik?

Lauamängukohvik on just see mida sa ette kujutad. Koht kuhu sa saad tulla, võtta omale mõni snäkk, kohvi või hoopiski tee. Leida endale sobiv lauamäng ja lõõgastuda seigeldes kusagil kaugel mängude maailmas.

Mida me pakume?

  • Palju erinevaid mänge mida kõiki on võimalik mängida hinnaga 3€/3 tundi.
  • Sõbralikud teenindajad, kes vajadusel aitavad mängude reeglitest aru saada ja on valmis neid võimalusel ka õpetama.
  • Kerge toitlustus, et mängides kõht tühjaks ei läheks.
  • Maitsvad joogid: espresso, kohv, tee, karastusjoogid ja ei puudu ka valik, mis mõeldud ainult täiskasvanutele.
  • Hubane keskkond, kus nautida mänge sõprade ja perega.
  • Mitmekesine mängude valik, mis sisaldab mänge nii algajatele kui ka suurtele mängufännidele.
  • Mängude disaineritel on võimalus meie kohvikus promoda oma uusi või veel valmimisjärgus olevaid mänge.
  • Korraldame erinevaid üritusi, võistlusi ja teema õhtuid.
  • Võimalus tellida meid külla või üritustele, kuhu kaasa võtame mängud ja õpetame ka neid mängima.

Miks me tahame avada lauamängukohvikut?

  • Meile väga meeldib Tartu ja me tahaks teha midagi mis teeks siin elamist veel lõbusamaks kõigile.
  • Oma 97 000 elanikuga ja 12 kõrgkooliga leiame, et Tartu vajaks veel kohti kus saaks ühiselt aega veeta ja sotsialiseeruda.
  • Paljudel inimestel pole piisavalt ruumi kodudes ja lauamängud on ka üldiselt kallid, siin tuleksimegi meie appi.
  • Suur osa inimesi ei teagi, et lauamängud võivad olla veel põnevamad, kui Reis Ümber Maailma ja Monopol.

Riskid

Väike-ettevõtte alustamine on alati riskantne. Riskide maandamiseks oleme lauamängukohviku avamiseks teinud tööd juba peaagu aasta. Teinud uuringuid ja koostanud äriplaani, kasutanud palju aega ja raha, et kohtuda inimestega kes teavad, mis meile parim. Oleme jõudnud arvamusele, et äri alustamine saab olema edukas. Plaan on Täringu Seiklus avada suve lõpus.

Täpsustused

Auhinnad loositakse välja ja kingitused saab kätte pärast kohviku avamist. Kõikide toetajatega võtame ise ühendust. Kõiki kingitusi, kus on kirjas "kolmekordne tasuta sissepääs" ja "viiekordne tasuta sissepääs" saab kohandada endale just nii nagu sina seda soovid - kas kasutad neid ise või jagad ka sõpradega. Snäkke ja jooke saab samuti jagada. Broneeringud tuleb teha esimese aasta jooksul pärast kohviku avamist.

Teised võimalused meid aidata

Lihtsalt seepärast, et sul pole võimalik meid rahaliselt toetada, ei tähenda, et sa meid aidata ei saaks.
  • Räägi meist oma sõpradele ja tuttavatele.
  • Jaga meid Facebookis ja osale Game Of Thrones-i mängu loosimisel
Kõikidele kes ei saa paypal-i kasutada, oleme loonud spetsiaalse pangakonto Täringu Seikluse toetamiseks. Kandke raha järgnevale kontole soovitud kingituse väärtuses ja lisage selgitusse kingituse pealkiri või kui soovite kingitusest loobuda, jätke see väli tühjaks.
SEB: Märt Saaren EE841010011732213225
Aitäh kõigile kes meid vähegi toetavad. Aitäh, aitäh ja veel kord aitäh!

story:
We are a startup company who needed funding to develop a secure technical solution. All donations are very much appreciated. Thanks for everyone who contributed and shared our campaign!

 

The solution

We may not have found the only solution to a universal problem, but our solution will reduce some of the challenges. Unfortunately, we cannot tell you all about it at the moment.

Web portal (SaaS) plus Native & Cross-Platform Apps
The solution is a new radical concept. We will develop both a web portal (SaaS) and cross-platform (HTML and native) free apps. Our digital business model  is a multi-sided platform, with multiple markets (B2C and B2B), and is based on the acknowledged Freemium model.

The tool would hardly be effective if it did not manage to address the needs of both individuals and businesses.

This tool will be a part of a commercial concept in addition to the benefits of free use.

 

How it works

We cannot tell you all about it at the moment, but will reveal more information shortly.

 

Who we are, what we do

We are two founders based in Oslo, Norway, who established this company to develop products and services that address social challenges while operating commercially.

Our contribution is to develop a new service that differs from any service available elsewhere. Our solution is universal in nature and can easily be adapted to use world-wide.

 

 

Where we go from here

The two of us, Oyvind and Thomas, have complementary experience from commercial and technical service organizations. We have known each other for more than 20 years and have worked together for more than 10 years. We are engaging several specialists for product development and digital business solutions and will hire necessary staff as the company grows.

We have successfully funded the project and thank all contributors for your help. All money raised is being used to developing the solution and put our digital tool and accompanying service to good use.

Our goal was to collect USD 100,000 in this crowdfunding campaign to cover the development costs for the first version. We simultaniously worked with business angels and private investors to achieve our funding goals.

Even though this campaign did not reach our funding goal, we still use all collected money for product development.

 

What's in it for you?

We and people who need our service thank you for your support.

 

Risks and challenges

We have defined and evaluated the risk factors in this project. Since the two founders have worked through difficult times as well as glory days, we feel that we are well prepared for addressing any obstacles and any unexpected situations.

After having designed the solution, the next challenge is now to select the right technology and the technicians to help us with development. We also need to make it ready for commercial use. We will closely follow every step along the way and strive to make all decisions needed to go live in early 2017. Furthermore, this concept and solution will be offered globally. A challenge will then be to select the right sales and marketing strategies for all markets. We have therefore teamed up with several people with deep experience and knowledge of how to build a digital startup and to introduce this concept in different markets.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking time to read about our project. We have now shortened the information given while the campaign was active.

Thank you for your help.

Thomas and Oyvind

story:
"Inside Out helped me get a job, and I had support with a mentor, and tutor and good peer support."                    - Returning Citizen, Age 38

"I have been coming around here for a year and nobody ever asked me what my crime was.  They cared about me as a person - and that changed everything."                                                - Returning citizen, Age 41

"Some of my struggles upon reentry were housing and getting an ID.  I also had to worry about food and hygiene."                         - Returning Citizen, Age 22

 Inside Out Reentry offers a community of support for returning citizens in Johnson County, Iowa.  Our doors opened in January 2015.  The Spirit of Christ church provides a space for our resource center.  Inside Out started slowly and in 2015 we served 8 individuals and their families.  

This year we have assisted 71 women and men, and their families.   In 2017, more individuals will be released into the community and our office will be busier than ever. We are a predominantly volunteer-based organization that relies heavily on individual financial support.

Inside Out Reentry provides:  

  • mentoring and support groups,
  • help finding employment and housing,
  • access to other community resources,
  • housing and transportation assistance,
  • life skill training and tutoring,
  • friendship and social activities,
  • opportunities to serve the community,
  • scholarship program, 
  • resource center, and more.

Research shows that comprehensive reentry programming is needed to assist returning citizens in establishing productive lives.  Inside Out Reentry Community provides a much-needed service to the Iowa City area. Your financial help is crucial as we continue our work helping those returning to our community after incarceration.

"Inside Out gave me a place to be myself when I came out.  It helped me build up my confidence in myself, and it helped me get a job, and I had support with a mentor, and tutor and good peer support."                               - Returning citizen, Age 53

"You are not an ex-con here.  You are returning to the community."                                                              - Returning citizen, Age 28

Visit http://www.insideoutreentry.com/ for more information.

story:
Hello all!

Filbert’s bakery is a family owned bakery located in Lancaster city centre (UK).  We bake delicious fresh bread every morning along with breakfast goods, cakes and savouries.  We use organic flour and all our ingredients are as ethical, fair trade and as local as possible.
We opened shop nearly 3 years ago and have been steadily growing with the amazing support of the local community.  As a consequence our loyal and trustworthy Hobart mixer has been outgrown.  It struggles valiantly on but has broken 3 times in the last 9 months, which costs around £250 and a day or two of no baking each time.  
With a suitable amount of irony it finally gave up the ghost just as we were preparing for our Massive Christmas Eve bake (easily the largest bake we do every year).  The amazing Atkinsons stepped in to help with a spare mixer so we could fulfil our orders, and since then one of our wonderful customers is trying to fix it so we can hobble along.  This is only a short term solution as the reason it keeps breaking is that we are using it beyond it's design parameters.  

What we need:

This means we need to buy a new, bigger, better mixer.  Which is where you come in.  A number of people suggested that we try to crowdfund the mixer - it's an expensive bit of kit and while we do have a small amount of cash we can put towards a purchase we'd be forced into getting a cheaper version which may need replacing or repairing relatively soon.  With your help we could get a proper piece of kit and have the ability to continue growing without the worry and cost.
We're not shooting for the moon - a good quality 2nd hand mixer will set us back around £1700 (new they're about £8k) so any contributions towards that will be very gratefully received.  If we don't make the total we'll chuck in what we can and get the best piece of kit for the available funds.  If we go over the total we'll use the rest to upgrade other vulnerable/archaic items to future proof us as much as possible.
We can't offer 'perks' as such as we operate at the lowest margin we can to make our products as affordable to all as possible, so any contribution made would be a donation (one for which we would be endlessly grateful!).
We have over 900 friends on our facebook account, so if everyone donated £1 we'd be well on our way to getting a great new mixer.  If you can't spare some change we completely understand - but don't worry!  You can still help!  Please share our campaign to your friends and family or let people know.  We are also collecting in the shop.

Thank you all!

Fil & the team

story:
Overview

Slackers Brewing Co. is a family-owned brewery opening in Anderson Mill in Austin, Texas — a place where everyone is welcome and craft beer is approachable.

Not only are we creating a quality brewery, but a community space where diverse groups of people can gather and connect.

And as parents, we know the importance of having a place the whole family can enjoy — which is why Slackers will be a family-friendly brewery. You’ll be able to bring your kids while relaxing over a beer, a bite, or cup of local coffee.

Craft will be celebrated in all its forms — musicians, artists and others will be able to share their work within our walls.

My name is Derek, and Slackers Brewing Co. is my dream. My wife Haley and I are working tirelessly to realize this dream — but we need help.

With your help, we can add the important finishing touches to the brewery — and open our doors in only a few months’ time.
 

What We Need

We’ve made so much progress over the last two years, and have the brewery design complete. We’re now working with the city to finalize permits to begin construction in just a few weeks. 

Everything up to this point has been funded by my wife and I — but with the addition of a kitchen to support the zoning laws of the area, we need some additional support. The great news is that this means we’ll offer a menu of food and snacks to eat while you’re enjoying delicious craft beer and coffee.

The additional $25,000 will go towards the plumbing, buildout, equipment and grease trap to add the kitchen to our brewery. 

Curious what the brewery will look like with this sweet new setup? Here’s a peek at the design:

 

What you get

Other than that warm fuzzy feeling of helping someone realize their dream, you’ll get a bunch of fun swag and perks that we designed just for you!

Maker's Mug (Included in all Master and Legendary Perk Packages)*
The ultimate perk that brings you into our community. You’ll get a ½ liter beer stein that entitles you to one, free Slackers beer every day for the rest of your life.​ This will have a special place at the brewery with your name on it — cleaned and ready to go, every time you visit. There will also be private events for mug holders only and early access to new brews.


*The slackers maker's mug is still in design so this may not be the final version
 

Perk Breakdown

Helpful Slacker

Every Slacker makes a difference. Pick this perk and we’ll send you a couple Slackers Brewing Co. stickers to show our appreciation.

Included Items
Sticker (2)

Dedicated Slacker

Way to dedicate yourself to the Slacker community! Get a sticker, a coaster, and a Slackers Brewing Co. glass. Now you can slack in style.

Included Items
Sticker
Slackers Glass
Coaster

Advanced Slacker

You’re no amateur Slacker! Enhance your slacking by drinking great Slackers Brewing Co. beer in your specialized glass, on a customized coaster, while wearing your sweet Slackers Brewing Co. t-shirt.

Included Items
Sticker
Slackers Glass
Slackers T-Shirt
Coaster

Elite Slacker

An Elite Slacker doesn't slack alone. So here are 2 stickers, 2 coasters, 2 glasses, and 2 t-shirts for you and your special other Slacker.

Included Items
Sticker (2)
Slackers Glass (2)
Slackers T-Shirt (2)
Coaster (2)

Next-Level Slacker

Mind blown. You definitely take slacking to the next level. Get 2 stickers, 2 glasses, 2 t-shirts, 2 coasters, and 2 invites to our private soft opening party!

Included Items
Sticker (2)
Slackers Glass (2)
Slackers T-Shirt (2)
Coaster (2)
Soft Opening Invite (2)

Master Slacker (Both Early Bird and Regular)

We bow to you — because we’re in the presence of a Master Slacker, the Early Bird Edition! Not only do you have some nice swag and an invite to the soft opening party, but you are now part of the exclusive Maker's Mug Club. Only 5 available at this price!

Included Items
Sticker (2)
Slackers Glass (2)
Slackers T-Shirt (2)
Maker's Mug
Coaster
Soft Opening Invite

Legendary Slacker (Both Early Bird and Regular)

Holy Wow. You will always be a legend at Slackers Brewing Co. Along with the swag, you'll also get entry into the exclusive Maker's Mug Club. And because of your legendary status, you’ll get to design and brew a beer with me, Derek — the head brewer. You’ll even get to invite your family and friends to a special release party to tap your beer!

Included Items
Sticker (2)
Slackers Glass (2)
Slackers T-Shirt (2)
Maker's Mug
Brewer for a day
Release Party for your beer
 

The Impact

I’ve had this dream of opening a brewery and community space since I was in my early 20s — a place to share my creations, where others can share creations of their own. 

By supporting this campaign, you’ll be helping an Austin family make their dream come alive — and enabling us to support our community in return.
 

Risks & Challenges

At this stage of the process, I can tell you without question that there are more risks and challenges ahead. Working through some of them have made me question my sanity — yet we keep finding a way over the hurdles.

I expect there will be more hidden costs in the buildout, and that the city is not done making our journey a bit more interesting. But I feel confident that we’ll make it through. 

With your support, my personal drive, and ample beer to calm my nerves, I know we’ll open the doors to Slackers Brewing Co. in 2021.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not all help needs to be financial. We’re a brewery built around the community we live in. So spread the word, share this campaign and our social media links — and come have a beer with us when we open up! If you have another creative way you wish to help, just let us know.

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

-Derek

story:
Dear Friends,

Pinkpeas has officially launched their LOVE Bomb. Help us save this precious and invaluable resource to pregnant women and families in the Las Vegas Valley. Read on to see how you can help.

Pinkpeas Pregnancy and Parenting Care Center is a family-centered, community-based, 501(c)(3) nonprofit pregnancy and parenting care group located in Las Vegas, Nevada. In our building we provide an endless list of services, mostly free or low cost. These include, but are not limited to: Prenatal care, childbirth education, well baby checks, postpartum support groups, cesarean support group, breastfeeding information and support, vaccine information classes, babywearing support, homeschooling information, homeopathic and essential oil classes, stuff swaps, holiday parties, play dates, food coops, and so much more.

Pinkpeas has not always been a building though. Our founder has been working for more than a decade to provide incredible, life changing and affordable care to women and their unborn children.  And she has been successful. The testimonies abound in Las Vegas at how Pinkpeas has changed their lives for the better. We grow women. Wives. Families.

For the last 5 years, we have been paying our expenses, barely. We have been doing this at the expense of our founder herself. This model is no longer sustainable and we seek the help and support of the community to in turn support this invaluable resource center. As it turns out, our lease is due for renewal on March 31st. For each $20,000 raised, we can continue the lease on our building for one year and we can help hundreds of women have high quality pregnancy care. Ideally, we would love to see $60,000 so that we may sign a new three year lease. All of our directors are volunteers. We have never taken, and will never take a paycheck for the work we do and the love we provide through Pinkpeas. 100% of all monies donated will go directly to providing pregnant women with incredible prenatal care. In the event that we do not raise enough for another year in our current location, all monies will be used to renting out various spaces in the valley from other business owners for prenatal care to our community.

As a nation, we have come to a time of uncertainty for many about the future of their healthcare. The younger generation is footing the bill for the older. Where does this leave our women of childbearing years? How many young women aren’t seeking care for the next generation due to financial reasons? Many more than you might think. Seeking prenatal care through an OB can cost hundreds of dollars per visit within most healthcare plans now. Many families are faced with a terrible choice: prenatal care or rent. Or food for their young family. Or paying other crucial bills.

HELP US HELP THEM.

Pinkpeas offers prenatal care that is affordable. Not just any prenatal care either. Sure, pregnant women can weigh themselves, hear the heartbeat of their unborn, check blood pressure, but there is so much more to actual care than that. Pinkpeas prenatal care consists of groups that are 2 hours in length and offered two days each week. Women come in to share concerns, questions, trials and triumphs to a caring team of women who fully understand what it takes to give great care and to receive great care.

Imagine. The rising generation of mothers…….. being mothered themselves. Being built up and loved. Being encouraged throughout the most vulnerable time in life – pregnancy, to go back home and give their husbands, homes and families what they need to thrive. It’s not typical, but it IS normal. And necessary. Welcome to Pinkpeas. How can we help you?

How can you help us? We need the help of our community. YOU.  Pinkpeas has not always been a building, but our building is crucial to the success of hundreds of families in our city. A small, yet tangible way you can help is to donate $60. Sixty dollars gives a woman in need a prenatal appointment with our team at Pinkpeas. Help us help the next young mother that comes through our doors. Help us keep our doors open. 100% of monies contributed are eligible to be tax exempt, as Pinkpeas is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit. Not a single dollar goes into the pockets of our staff. We volunteer because we care about the next generations of mothers. Do you?

If you or anyone you know has benefited from our organization, whether 10 days ago or 10 years ago, please consider helping us.  Your contributions will be the foundation for Pinkpeas to continue to support families for many years to come.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • ·Share this campaign with your friends and family and other networks of people in your life. Whether you post a link on Facebook or Twitter, or send an email to your community, we would love for you to help us spread the word. 
  • Click onto our comments tab to give us feedback.
  • Professionals can contribute a product or service to be offered as a perk to our contributors. Contact love@pinkpeas.org for more information.

Need more information?

If you have any unanswered questions, don’t hesitate to contact us. You can reply here, or visit www.pinkpeas.org to learn more. You can also find us on Facebook as Pinkpeas. 

We greatly appreciate anything that you can offer.  We look forward to sharing many more joys with our community of families.


With much gratitude,
Corrine, Kate and the Pinkpeas family

story:
Whatâ€™s the Idea?

We want to get to know people and communities from the inside out by traveling from the east coast to the west; spreading positivity.  Once we land in LA we will keep the project going. 


1.     Body:  I lost 45 pounds over the course of 2 years by cutting out unhealthy eating options.  I struggle with emotional eating and deal with that head on.  We will track our progress on the road and while relocating; high stress activities that typically knock you off of a diet.  Letâ€™s prove that sustainable eating as a lifestyle is possible no matter what youâ€™re going through.  A.) Track our road trip work outs B.) Keep Food Logs C.) Visit Local Farms and Restaurants

2.   Mind: Education people!  Weâ€™ve always had to live on a budget, in other words, if we arenâ€™t earning income, we just donâ€™t have it.  Somehow we have managed to relocate and thrive artistically and otherwise, maintaining a high quality of life in NYC, Orlando, Las Vegas, PA and TN.  Let us tell you how to make something out of nothing, talk about choosing a life in the arts and the importance of following your dreams.  A.) We want to reach out to community centers, high school programs and more.  Plus weâ€™re professional musical theatre performers and teach vocal and acting lessons.  B.) We want to reach out to younger kids in after school programs to expose them to the art of live performance with music and dance.

3.   Soul: Volunteer.  Being a tourist is great, but big attractions arenâ€™t what make a community whole.  Realistically there are always projects and people in need.  A.) We want to help in any way we can.  Some places weâ€™d like to visit include boys and girls homes, homeless shelters or drop-in centers, prisons, and even a church group running an event.


Dude!  Thatâ€™s A Lot of Stuffâ€¦How Does it All Work?

Itâ€™s cool, weâ€™re both a jack of all trades and all about well-rounded experiences.  We think every aspect has value and we thrive on change.  If we visit one local farm, one school and one homeless shelter, it doesnâ€™t have to be all in one day. 

Weâ€™re starting with a road trip.  Hitting up small towns and big cities on the way from Winston-Salem, NC to LA; we would like to achieve one or more objective in each location we stop. 

Then, we will continue the good deeds in LA.

And, given our history, it will be no surprise if we move onto another location soon after.  


I Dig Itâ€”How Can I Help?

1.      Financial Support: We need $5,000 to make this happen.  Every little bit helps and we want you to take advantage of our perks!

2.   Spreading the Word: Tell people about what weâ€™re doing!  We want to inspire people to live like they want to; take care of themselves and give when they can.  Maybe they will feel an extra boost by watching our story.  The easiest way is to use the â€œshare with friendsâ€ tools shown above.  But use facebook, email, your blog, university radio, your voice!

3.   Join the Conversation:  Talk to us!  Tell us your ideas, weâ€™re living on a prayer and will go wherever the wind blows.  Offer us a lead or a challenge and weâ€™ll see what we can do! 


Whatâ€™s the Money Going to Be Used For?

1.     Survival

-Gas Money ; We need to get from point A to point B

-Shelter (while we are on the road); We will always reach out to our    

network and couchsurfing.com, etc first, but sometime you have to  pay for a place to land for the night

 Donations

-Sometimes places need items donated.  Weâ€™d like to have the ability  to provide them on a small scale as needed.

                         -Items for educational sessions

                        -Postage of items

       Time  

                -Hey, time is money.  We all know that.  We'd love to spend as many   

                 hours as possible finding communities, groups and individuals in need.

What If You Raise Less Than Your Goal?

We wonâ€™t because YOUâ€™RE super supportive and awesome, but really if we donâ€™t reach our goal, weâ€™ll just visit less places.

What If You Raise MORE Thank Your Goal?

We will be able to reach out to so many more people and spread the love!  


Who Are You People Anyway?

Janice: Most recently Miss Times Square for the Miss NY USA Pageant, professional vocal and acting coach, Musical theatre performer, Model and film/tv actress and modest ukulele singer/songwriter.  Check out www.JanicePicconi.com ; www.coachingbyjanice.com ; www.facebook.com/MissTimesSquare ; www.JansLand.com

Jordan: Professional musical theatre performer and tv/film actor.  Noted for his leading role on MTV and a Las Vegas Rock Opera; Plus heâ€™s awesome at a quick oil change and making you laugh on a bad day.
story_txt:
Whatâ€™s
the Idea?

We want to get
to know people and communities from the inside out by traveling from the east
coast to the west; spreading positivity. 
Once we land in LA we will keep the project going. 




1.    
Body:  I lost 45 pounds over the course of 2 years
by cutting out unhealthy eating options. 
I struggle with emotional eating and deal with that head on.  We will track our progress on the road and
while relocating; high stress activities that typically knock you off of a
diet.  Letâ€™s prove that sustainable eating
as a lifestyle is possible no matter what youâ€™re going through.  A.)
Track our road trip work outs B.)
Keep Food Logs C.) Visit Local Farms
and Restaurants
2.  
Mind: Education
people!  Weâ€™ve always had to live on a
budget, in other words, if we arenâ€™t earning income, we just donâ€™t have
it.  Somehow we have managed to relocate
and thrive artistically and otherwise, maintaining a high quality of life in
NYC, Orlando, Las Vegas, PA and TN.  Let
us tell you how to make something out of nothing, talk about choosing a life in
the arts and the importance of following your dreams.  A.) We
want to reach out to community centers, high school programs and more.  Plus weâ€™re professional musical theatre
performers and teach vocal and acting lessons. 
B.) We want to reach out to
younger kids in after school programs to expose them to the art of live
performance with music and dance.
3.  
Soul: Volunteer.  Being a tourist is great, but big attractions
arenâ€™t what make a community whole. 
Realistically there are always projects and people in need.  A.) We
want to help in any way we can.  Some
places weâ€™d like to visit include boys and girls homes, homeless shelters or
drop-in centers, prisons, and even a church group running an event.



Dude!  Thatâ€™s A Lot of Stuffâ€¦How Does it All Work?
Itâ€™s cool, weâ€™re both a jack of all trades and all about
well-rounded experiences.  We think every
aspect has value and we thrive on change. 
If we visit one local farm, one school and one homeless shelter, it
doesnâ€™t have to be all in one day.  
Weâ€™re starting with a road
trip.  Hitting up small towns and big
cities on the way from Winston-Salem, NC to LA; we would like to achieve one or
more objective in each location we stop. 

Then, we will continue
the good deeds in LA.
And, given our history, it will be no surprise if we move
onto another location soon after.  

I
Dig Itâ€”How Can I Help?



1.    
 Financial Support: We need
$5,000 to make this happen.  Every little
bit helps and we want you to take advantage of our perks!
2.  
Spreading
the Word: Tell people about what weâ€™re doing!  We want to inspire people to live like they
want to; take care of themselves and give when they can.  Maybe they will feel an extra boost by watching
our story.  The easiest way is to use the
â€œshare with friendsâ€ tools shown above. 
But use facebook, email, your blog, university radio, your voice!
3.  
Join
the Conversation:  Talk to
us!  Tell us your ideas, weâ€™re living on
a prayer and will go wherever the wind blows. 
Offer us a lead or a challenge and weâ€™ll see what we can do! 

Whatâ€™s
the Money Going to Be Used For?


1.     Survival
-Gas
Money ;
We need to get from point A to point B
-Shelter
(while we are on the road); We will always reach out to our
   
network
and couchsurfing.com, etc first, but sometime you have to  pay for a place to land for the night
 Donations
-Sometimes
places need items donated.  Weâ€™d like to have the ability  to provide them on a small scale as needed.
                         -Items
for educational sessions
                        -Postage of items
       Time  
             
  -Hey, time is money.  We all know that.  We'd love to spend as
many   
                 hours
as possible finding communities, groups and individuals in need.
What If
You Raise Less Than Your Goal?
We wonâ€™t because YOUâ€™RE super supportive and awesome, but
really if we donâ€™t reach our goal, weâ€™ll just visit less places. 
What If
You Raise MORE Thank Your Goal?
We will be able to reach out to so many more people and
spread the love!  


Who Are
You People Anyway?
Janice: Most recently Miss Times Square for the Miss NY USA
Pageant, professional vocal and acting coach, Musical theatre performer, Model
and film/tv actress and modest ukulele singer/songwriter.  Check out www.JanicePicconi.com ;
www.coachingbyjanice.com ; www.facebook.com/MissTimesSquare ; www.JansLand.com 
Jordan: Professional musical theatre performer and tv/film
actor.  Noted for his leading role on MTV
and a Las Vegas Rock Opera; Plus heâ€™s awesome at a quick oil change and making
you laugh on a bad day.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Alison Berrios. I am a 31 year old stay at home mom who is trying to get my small business really rolling. That's me in the picture, as you can see I am a Star Wars fan! This campaign is important to me because I really believe in my vision for my future and my family's future and it's something that I have so much fun doing! I think hats are a great way & simple way to dress up and show your Fandom.If I could just get a little help it would help me see if this journey can be turned into something amazing and also help me create some new designs! 


What We Need & What You Get

I need funds for several things

*First and foremost I need money for materials. Fabric and materials can get very pricey, very quickly! Having a better quality machine could help me a LOT as well.

 *Money for Comic Book show & convention booths. Comic Book conventions are a great way for people like me to showcase what we have to offer. Booths can range from $50-$750 depending on the number of days of a convention or the size.

*Money for promotional material such as- business cards, flyers, an actual website, banners, displays, etc. This helps me look more professional. 

*If the end goal isn't reached, any money that has been donated will be utilized as efficiently as possible! I will make as many extra hats as possible, and get basic supplies and do some smaller cons(which I absolutely adore) until I raise enough money to get myself to the larger shows. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate everyone who even looks at this page! If you want to help, there are other ways besides a monetary contribution. A Facebook share or like helps get my company viewed which can lead to more interest. 

*** www.facebook.com/cosplayforjedi  ** 

A Tweet or Instagram with a link to my Etsy store or a link to this Indiegogo page does the same! 

** www.cosplayforjedi.etsy.com **

story:
In desperation, 15 year-old Yahya Abdi risked his life and climbed into the wheel well of a Hawaiian Airlines jet in San Jose. In need of his mother’s love and comfort, by miracle he survived sub-zero temperatures for over five hours across the Pacific Ocean in hope of finding her.

Since he landed on Maui, we have been riveted by his extraordinary story.  Now, a group of concerned mothers in Hawaii want to help reunite Yahya and his mother and ensure his education now and in the future.  Please help to make Yahya’s dream a reality and show him that he is not alone in this world!

story:
Babies Raising Babies

Hola!  Greetings from Cusco, Peru.  We are a passionate group of volunteers who have been moved to action to make a real difference in the lives of some of the girls we met working at an orphanage.  We've partnered with a local NGO to open up a new home for teen moms and their babies.

The conditions we've seen are beyond appalling.  Pictured above is one of the moms working in the kitchen of the orphanage.  There is so much need here, however we've decided to focus on a particular segment of the orphan population. There are virtually no homes for teen moms to have and raise their babies.  Their families kick the soon-to-be moms out as young as 13 years old and they are sent to homes with dozens of other girls where they are expected to work long hours, leaving their babies unattended.

There are 3 main issues we are addressing.  

  • Basic Safety.  When we arrived the other day, we found a 10 month old and a 2 year old playing at the top of the stairs with nobody watching them.  We grabbed them and went to find their moms, only to learn they were cleaning.  The younger orphans, many with special needs, were expected to "babysit" while the moms did their duties.
  • Parenting Skills.  We've seen girls swing their babies around as if they are dolls, having no idea how delicate they are.  Many of the babies are developmentally delayed.
  • Hope for the Future.  What future can you expect for a girl kicked out of her house at 13 with no education and an extra mouth to feed?  We are providing a fresh direction.

Need & Impact

Our immediate need is to move the girls into the new home we have rented so the girls can live in a loving, baby-proof, structured home environment where they are given the perspective of ambition and hope for a successful future where both mom and child thrive.

Tourism is the fastest growing industry in Peru, those fluent in English have a huge competitive advantage over the general population.  English will be formally taught as well as spoken in the home.

Three month plan is to move the girls into a new home, hire a home "mom", set up an internal daycare, and get the girls back into the educational system.  ($10,000)

Three year plan is to open a joint Orphanage/Bed & Breakfast where the girls will learn the culinary and hospitality skills to have a solid career to provide an income where they can take care of their babies, not just while they are living in the orphanage, but for the future.  ($1,200,000)

Five Year Plan.  After five years, the Bed & Breakfast will sustain the needs of the orphanage. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Volunteer opportunities.  Our home will be open to hosting volunteers who can help us provide an intercultural exchange by sharing their time, love, and experiences with our girls. 

Please share our mission with your friends and family (heck, they don't even have to be your friends :) ...we appreciate all the help we can get)

story:
Creator Space

Releasing Creative Ability

Empowering Technical Learning

Providing Access To High-Tech Tools


Ever dream of using a tool you just can't afford to buy?

Maybe just for that one special project?

To make a prototype or a gift, but no one you know has it?

Now there is somewhere to go...


The Creator Space!


You need to use a Plasma Cutter or CNC/CAM Router? Perhaps the 3D Printer? Use the space and equipment on your schedule. Buy a monthly membership for unlimited hobby use. Meet other Makers and collaborate...


Better than the gym membership you never use...


Creator Space

Open-Source Workshops!


Tinkering. Designing. Building... However you look at it, we all long to be creative. Some paint. Some dance. You are a Maker. A Creator. Or you call yourself an Experimenter, or Tinkerer, or Inventor. Woman or Man, we all have a bit of that "spark" in our brain. That raw power of creativity that drives us. We think in mechanisms and circuits. Unfortunately few experimenters and hobbyists have the financial resources and tools to fully engage our "Inner Engineer."

The Creator Space will make tools and space available to community members, allowing them to use costly and complex equipment normally beyond the reach of the average tinkerer, inventor, or experimenter. These include: Plasma CAM System, Laser Cutter and Engraver System, Oxy/Acetylene + MIG and TIG Welding Center, Electronics Bench, Woodworking Tools and more... Much More!


Here Is The Big Idea...

You need a welder... Drop in to Creator Space and get it welded.
          Quick repairs or ornamental works of art. MIG, TIG and Gas.

A design calls for a programmable plasma cutter...
          Draft your cutting plans at home and head over to Creator Space.
          Whip them out on the Plasma CNC system in just a few minutes.
          Build your dream project quickly or create a prototype and go to Shark Tank!

A wedding present needs laser engraving...
          Pop a wine bottle in the engraver at Creator Space and voila!
          Make wooden, plastic or metal ornaments and children's toys.
          Personalize your employee ID/RFID badge, smart phone or laptop.

Plus...
#  Dedicated, secure space for your project. Low monthly fees for locked storage.

#  Fully-equipped electronics workbenches at Creator Space with soldering irons, multiple-output power supplies and all the hand tools you need. Testing and troubleshooting equipment at the ready (if needed) including oscilloscopes and logic analyzers. Even a selection of parts, if missing that one, last piece!

#  Have a Creator Class party! Invite a group of friends to the Creator Space to learn the Plasma CNC or MIG Welder and each build a project to kick off a new hobby of creating and making. Know anyone in Scout Troops, Ham Radio Clubs, School Clubs, Knitting Groups, Sewing Group, Book Clubs, Church or Singles Groups? I bet you can think of a bunch of people who would like to attend a private creator party!


How The Creator Space Works:

The use of Creator Space facilities and equipment will be based on a recurring monthly membership basis. Similar to the traditional gym membership, but without the problems of over-enrollment or waiting for a turn. You can even schedule a machine in advance.

Members will be allowed access to equipment following basic training in safety and tool use. Individuals can enroll in scheduled classes and groups can schedule custom curriculum without additional cost. The basic cost for members will be $75 per month and discounts for commitments will save members up to 25% or more. Options for spouse and family memberships are also available... We are still working out all the details, so stay tuned to this page for more details! Subscribe or follow us on Facebook!

The Creator Space will provide the tools and space for men and women, teens and families, to explore their engineering creativity. For the Creator in us all!


I need YOU to assist the community!

To turn this dream into reality we need funds to purchase:

  • Concrete Pad and Steel Building
  • Electrical Wiring, Plumbing and Restroom
  • Electronics Work Benches with Hand Tools and Test Equipment
  • Plasma CAM, Laser Cutter/Engraver Systems
  • Wood Lathe, Table Saw, Drill Press, etc...
  • Gas and Arc Welding Equipment
  • Computer Design Center with Laser Printer and 3D Printer
  • Computer Security, Access and Monitoring System
  • Public Awareness and Outreach

Plus, your contribution may be tax deductible! The Civilized Frontier is a California Nonprofit Corporation. 501(c)(3) Application in process...

story:
Summary Of '69

     Most of you that are here might know all this already, but in case you don't I'll go over the details.

     I, Eric, and my business partner, Bobby, both currently work at Penny Lane Pub in downtown Richmond, Virginia. The pub is a wonderful melting pot of a place, where we have come in contact with movie stars, governors, famous musicians, and possibly even future presidents, while at the same time serving and enjoying the company of working-class people like ourselves and also those on the less-fortunate rungs of society.

     We've both been tending bar there for several years now, and we've come to know the neighborhood and its inhabitants rather well. Although the money is good and the work often borders upon enjoyable, we've both reached the point where we want to strike out on our own. Both of us are family men and aging at a certain pace, and the bartending lifestyle is sometimes at odds with both of these facts.

     Before you become too concerned, let me tell you some good news: We've found the solution (for us all!)! We have procured a spot in the very same neighborhood that we've been serving as bartenders for years, only we have a new twist: coffee! Also, great food, beer and wine both in-store and to go, and --oh yeah-- records! Too hip, you say? Don't worry, we'll keep it toned down (for the most part), as we want our coffee house to have the same vibe as the pub: everyone is welcome but no nonsense is allowed. We think you'll love it.

     Why tell you all this? Well, we would like your help. And we know you're out there. And again, we think you'll love it.

What The World Needs Now

     Currently we have all the equipment we need in the shop and ready to go. We have orders waiting to be placed for food and beverages. We have thousands of records aching to be sold to someone who will treat them nicely and enjoy their sonic delights. We've had rent abatement for several months, but construction delays out of our control have brought impending reality to the fore. We want to be open, and we want to be open soon, and we may need your help.

     With your help, we will be able to open in a timely manner (we're now shooting for mid-January, 2014), while making sure we provide the highest quality experience for both our customers and employees alike. Bobby and I are willing to tough it out as penniless grunts for the promise of a future reward, but we don't expect that of anyone else. Without the revenue we would have had from being open already, we need just an extra push to get us to our goal: A fully operational coffee house/restaurant/record store that you love to be in and we love to give you.

     We've come up with an interesting list of perks, from stickers, gift certificates, and wearable schwag, to DJed parties and personal wooing via song. Also, there may be an as-yet-unmentioned extra perk at each level, if all comes together in the right way and time permits. Hope for the best!

     Our monetary goal would put us over the top, in the sense that we could easily segue out of our old jobs and begin the new job of bringing you an awesome coffee shop and record store experience with full force! Either way, this will happen, but don't you want to know that YOU had a part in making it happen? Plus, you get to have things that no one else gets to have! Take that, other people!


Powerful Impact, Boom, From The Cannon

     You, and only you, can help make this happen. Like we mentioned above, it's going to happen in some way/shape/or form regardless, but you can make it happen in the way that it was meant to happen! I'm calling you to action, don't you get it?


Other Kinds Of Love

     Whether you are able to give monetarily or not, you can still help further by telling others about our campaign. Just think of us as fighting the good fight, and you're on our side (or we're on yours, whatever it takes). Spreading the word helps us all.

Either way, this will happen, but don't you want to know that YOU had a part in making it happen? Plus, you get to have things that no one else gets to have! Take that, other people!
Powerful Impact, Boom, From The Cannon
     You, and only you, can help make this happen. Like we mentioned above, it's going to happen in some way/shape/or form regardless, but you can make it happen in the way that it was meant to happen! I'm calling you to action, don't you get it?
Other Kinds Of Love
     Whether you are able to give monetarily or not, you can still help further by telling others about our campaign. Just think of us as fighting the good fight, and you're on our side (or we're on yours, whatever it takes). Spreading the word helps us all.

story:
Short Summary

Hi My name is Nick Maleta. I grew up in Santa Cruz California in a little town called Soquel. For the most part, there isn't much going on in this small town but I was lucky enough to grow up next to a winery that my great grandpa, John Bargetto, founded after prohibition in 1933. Growing up right next to all of those smells and sounds of crushing and fermenting grapes quickly drew me into an interest in the wine industry. 

My mother's first cousins now own and operate the winery and since my immediate family has no financial ties to the facility I had to learn what I could from the winemakers but start projects on my own. Since the purchase of grapes is very expensive compared to apples I decided to experiment a bit with making cider. Luckily enough, the winemaker at the winery was very experienced in cider making and was very helpful in my projects. 

After making some batches of hard apple cider I began to really enjoy the taste. As the years went by, I realized that there might be a market for Hard Cider. One day at the super market a few years back, I tried one of the first hard ciders i've seen for sale commercially, and it hit me that people were actually willing to buy and sell the stuff. My dream to become one of the first dry and semi-dry hard cider producers in this agriculturally rich region took off from there! I put it all together; I had the access to a legally bonded winery for my production of relatively large batches of cider and I also had some farming connections in nearby Pajaro Valley which still has some great old orchards. 

The goal is to start off relatively small with just a few oak barrels and some decent equipment. I figure if I keep in mind quality and careful craft of the cider, what will start off as small production may very well turn into a successful self-sustaining business someday!

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need

The main cost in starting an alcohol business is the packaging, apples, press and milling machines and barrels. My first vintage of cider will be made from a few tons of apples which will cost me roughly $2,000. Quality barrels will run several hundred dollars and for the first year I will be needing about 8 barrels. 

This amount will produce about 150 cases of cider which will get me a good starting number to sell to local bars and restaurants to get my name out there. The  barrels will cost me a few hundred dollars a barrel along with a stainless steel fermenter. Packaging such as labels, cases, bottles and corks enough for 150 cases (according to some local consultants) will cost me around $2,000. Lastly, the press and apple grinder will be around 1,000. These pieces of equipment will eventually need to be replaced with much bigger versions as the yield increases but will easily do the job for the first year or two.

apples---2,000

press and milling machine---1,000

packaging---2,000

barrels/fermenters---3,000

alcohol license---$500


What You Get

Our artist, Isabel Patino, designed a great logo which will go on all of the perks listed to the right. Along with helping us bring a new business idea to the area you will also be contributing to the creation of a unique beverage that will be available in local businesses. 

Some perks you can get are: stickers, hats, shirts and other cool things to thank you for your generosity!



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute even a small amount, please help us in any other way you can! Feel free to spread the project idea to friends and family by word of mouth or by sharing this page. If you have any campaign ideas my email is njmaleta@gmail.com


Thanks again for checking out this project and helping to make this dream a reality!

story: We moved to Columbus to get out of our parents house and find solace in someplace new where we could strive for our dreams and become successful happy adults. Since moving here we have had our bikes stolen, Kelby was attacked at her job, and our car was broken in to. We both have had tough times finding good jobs and are both working endlessly to make ends meet and pay bills. After this most recent incident we just wish to get out of the unsafe neighborhood we live in and start anew. Anyone who knows us realizes that we do not deserve this and just wish to live happily with our cat and save money and achieve our dreams. This city is beating us down and making us feel helpless and we just wish to find someplace in the country where we can feel safe and sound and be amongst beautiful souls. We know we are not alone in or struggle but if someone can raise thousands of dollars to make a potato salad then why shouldn't we be able to reach out for help in this tough situation. Any and all help is appreciated and we would remain forever thankful for the support. I hate to feel the need to take to begging but we have to so whatever it takes to live the life we deserve.

story:
.




 





Risks and challenges:

••(Food Labeling): Often labels mislead consumers to believe choices they are making are healthy ones. Our educational class about reading labels properly aims to direct the consumer on making the proper decision on what to buy and look for.

••(Organics are Expensive): Consumers are often lead to believe that organic food is expensive. At POP_UP we leverage affordability by buying in bulk quantities and growing year round in our greenhouse facility. This will allow us to provide food everyone can afford. We will accept food stamps as well as other state assistance programs to increase purchasing power for customers.

••(Organic Shortage):The demand for organic food in the U.S is growing but the supply is not. Farmers that do grow organic are now a small population as to previous years. As much as 50% of food produced in U.S is genetically modified or GMO, causing major opposition by consumers. Developing a network with over 125 local farms will allow us flexibility to make sure supply is consistent. Consumers will be educated on what GMO's are through the news portion of our website, literature, educational classes, and marketing material.

••(Society and Culture): Without culture we would have no agriculture. In a healthy food system social and cultural characteristics of our community will help shape the way food is grown, processed, aggregated, distributed and sold. POP_UP realizes the social impact healthy food has on communities with limited access. Our goal is to diversify our outreach into multiple areas : Healthy food Retail, wholesale distribution, food preparation, Urban agriculture Education/ mentorship programs.

••(Collaborate): Creative collaborations can help Port Richmond address the challenges of higher wholesale costs. For example small corner stores can collaborate with us to leverage their collective buying power and engage in joint purchasing to get the lowest prices possible for customers. If one truck can supply multiple food business in a local area it would mean everyone is a winner in that supply chain.

•• (Implementing green building strategies).  Energy efficiency will be implemented using environmentally friendly building materials. In addition to the environmental benefits, these strategies will cut costs and save energy. Purchasing energy-efficient refrigerators and becoming certified through the (Green Chill / EPA partnership program). Also on the boards is a supplemental solar lighting system for greenhouse grounds. Our used cooking oil will be up-cycled and filtered to heat our greenhouse during winter months. Supplemental wind turbines are on the drawing board for the future as we grow. Our location has access to clean unblocked wind and sunshine to maximize these energy saving investments.

•• (Transportation / fuel costs): Transportation and fuels cost's often effect decisions American's make from day to day. A store may be to far away, or food costs may rise due to increased cost of gasoline.

POP_UP gourmet will collaborate with multiple partners in the form of "buyers club alliances" by doing so it assures us that our food is not taking a trip half way around the world to get on our plates. This will drive prices down for the club. Potential partners: Chef's, family's, corner stores, churches, restaurants, food trucks, cafe's, CSA members, and street vendors.
