story:
Short Summary

Hello I am James Krachinski and I am a disabled veteran. I am starting a vacation rental home company. The plan below provides the detail for a one of a kind vacation experience. I want to provide a service that has never been done to this level. When you donate you will enable me to take the next step in making peoples dreams come true on their vacation.  

 
 Objectives

ICS Consultant Group will launch its business with three vacation homes. Over the first three years, ICS Consultant Group has the following objectives:

  • Purchase 3 homes with swimming pools in Florida that are on a canal leading out to the ocean
  • Purchase 21ft to 24ft boats that will be at the dock of each home
  • Build a tropical bar and BBQ pit at each home by the pool
  • Steadily increase revenues each year
  • Achieve a 50% retention rate of customers from year 2 to year 3

Mission

ICS Consultant Group will offer competitively priced vacation home rentals oriented for families and couples to enjoy at Florida’s most popular vacation destinations. The business will seek to offer families and couples the balance of relaxation and excitement they seek by providing options for activities to suit both individuals and groups.

Keys to Success

Keys to success in the vacation houseboat business include:

  1. Impeccable upkeep of the vacation properties to maintain the luxury of the accommodations
  2. A wide variety of activities and services to promote and suggest to families
  3. Seasonal pricing to encourage year-round utilization of the property and boats

Company Summary

ICS Consultant Group offers vacation home rentals in Florida’s most popular vacation destinations to large families and groups of families. The business was formed in 2012 and will launch in 2015 upon funding. ICS Consultant Group was founded by James Krachinski, a U.S. Air Force Disabled Veteran.

Company Ownership

James Krachinski established ICS Consultant Group as an LLC. James will retain 100% of the company and will receive a loan, investments or crowdfunding to make up additional required capital.

Start-up Summary

ICS Consultant Group will invest in the establishment of three vacation rental homes in Florida not to exceed $250,000 per home including renovations, purchasing the boats and building a bar / BBQ area by the pool.

The website, brochure, and advertisements will be detailed in the marketing strategy section and Web plan.

The standard vacation home will vary in its amenities; however they will all have the following as standard amenities:

  • 3 Bedroom
  • 2 full bathroom
  • Fully equipped kitchen (refrigerator, freezer, range/oven, etc.)
  • Central air and heat
  • Bar / Barbecue
  • Swimming Pool
  • 21ft to 24ft Boat at private dock
  • Fully Furnished

Basic rental rates will depend on the season:

Summer Season (June 1 - August 31)

  • Weekly - $1650
  • 4 Days - $1400
  • 3 Days - $1200

Spring/Fall Seasons (May and September)

  • Weekly - $1400
  • 4 Days - $1200
  • 3 Days - $1000

Off Season (October 1 to April 30)

  • Weekly - $1100
  • 4 Days - $650
  • 3 Days - $600

Seasonal rates are based on peak usage times in Florida. Prices are competitive with other vacation home rentals in Florida.

Market Segmentation

The key market segments for vacation rentals are described more fully below:

Young Couples: Aged 21 to 39, young couples without children look for romantic getaways as well as high-energy activities (ski boats, beaches, hiking, diving, etc.). While some may be wealthy enough to rent a luxurious vacation home with all the extras, many have to stretch to rent a basic vacation home. It is more difficult for these young couples to put together a group large enough to afford a large vacation home, but they may be able to use smaller vacation home with fewer amenities.

Older Couples: Aged 40 and up, although some within this age bracket will still be very active and self-identify with young couples, older couples without children look for romance and relaxation. They seek quieter activities such as fishing, light hiking, etc.

Families: Couples or individuals with children. They require a mix of relaxation for parents and high-energy activities for children. They may also require creature comforts for the children, such as entertainment centers, which couples can do without on a vacation.

Web Plan Summary

The website for ICS Consultant Group will offer a great deal of information both for potential renters/vacationers. The site will inform these parties about the offerings of ICS Consultant Group, availability of properties and allow them to move forward by using a simple reservation form to make reservations online.

Website Marketing Strategy

The website will target young couples and families interested in Florida vacations. The site will be marketed through the following tactics:

  • Banner ads on travel-related websites
  • Google AdWords text ads
  • Listing in vacation home databases and websites
  • Search engine optimization undertaken by the initial Web developer and an ongoing SEO firm

Development Requirements

The website will provide the following information:

  • Services offered by ICS Consultant Group for renters (descriptions and photos)
  • Basic Rates
  • Activities in the area (links, photos and more information)
  • Contact information (email only as phone is withheld to reduce time spent on phone by Hopkins)
  • About Us – James Krachinski background, business values, vision
  • Services
  • Policies and procedures for rental
  • FAQs - How to pack, details on other rules, etc.
  • Availability Calendar
  • Reservation request form (with credit card payment)

All copy will be produced by ICS Consultant Group and the coding and design of the website will be through a Web design firm for $5,000.

story:
Short Summary

For the 3rd year, Regina's burgeoning Word Up community is sending a team to represent the Queen City at the Canadian Festival of Spoken Word! This year, it happens to be in Victoria. The opportunity to showcase our local talent on the national stage is a big one. So is the cost of sending, housing and feeding 5 poets for 6 days. So we're calling on our community to help us get there!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $5,550 total for this trip to cover travel, modest accommodation and food for 5 team members for the 6 days of the festival. This campaign, which aims to raise $1500, will supplement our other fundraising efforts including fundraiser events, performance fees, and a travel grant. 

In exchange for your contributions, we're offering some pretty deadly perks, including snow shovelling, banana bread, private yoga classes, an acoustic song written just for you, and a 3-course home-cooked meal served up by us! Give just $10 and get a personal shout-out from the stage at our next Word Up event. $18 gets you a postcard from beautiful Victoria. There's more -- check 'em out at the right!

The Impact

Word Up is one of the youngest slams in the country. We've got some incredible talent emerging from this freshly tilled prairie soil, and connecting with the national spoken word community is key to our growth as individual poets and as a community.

Despite being pretty fresh, Word Up has quickly become a popular hub for spoken word in Regina. The Slam Team has been invited to perform at events such as the Cathedral Village Arts Festival, Vertigo Series, and Saskatoon's Tonight It's Poetry. 

The Canadian Festival of Spoken Word is the only national team poetry competition in the country. It offers an annual opportunity for poets to come together to challenge themselves and each other through playful competition. It sounds intense, but really it's a big love fest. In its first two years at the festival, Regina has been welcomed with wide open, poet-sized hearts and enthusiasm. 

Your contribution will connect you with a quickly growing local community of people who are passionate about the power and beauty of spoken word. It'll also help us develop Regina's scene into an even more vibrant, diverse, skillful and inspired community that fosters healthy self-expression and poetic analysis of personal and political life.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that not everyone is in a position to donate. That's cool -- we still love you just for caring enough to read this far. 

    If you've got a skill or item to donate to our campaign as a perk, that's a great way to help.

    You can also help us out by sharing this campaign with pals and strangers. Just use the indiegogo share tools - easy peasy, and much appreciated.

story:
Hello world

Launched (not officially incorporated yet) at the end of September, 2014
Noovo is brand building company,
i.e. we consult, research, design, and publish brands.
Read more about the making of Noovo.
http://www.noovovisuals.com
Facebook, Twitter

What we do

Building brands


Incubating ideas + seeds & startups


Founder

Ein
Website
Noovo defines brand image as the personality of the brand, something which is often restricted to the bigger brands but we want to build brands out of smaller businesses & individuals. Like the cute cafe beside the street, construction companies or the teacher working to change the world.

+

We will work as brand incubators for startup companies i.e. build, manage and publish the brand in return of a small flexible share in equity.


Why the campaign

3 months ago Noovo started with nothing. Well maybe $19. Yet we made partners and clients within the first week of starting activity. That is when we had a concrete idea of how important brand image could be to small businesses.
So we want to promote, advertise to companies, businesses and startups all over the world.


TO-DO & Milestones

▪ Launch a creative production marketplace at noovo.me

SOUNDS, DESIGN, VIDEO



Investment not contribution

We are a company that builds young brands and makes them stand out. If you are one of them, as one of our initial contributors we will offer our services for FREE and you will be listed down as one of the very important contributors on the website where you can advertise and promote your own services or brand. We might offer shares of equity to certain contributors. Really thank you for your support!
If you are willing to be our lifelong partner, we will be so happy to have you. Noovo wants to make friends all over the world!

P.S. Reading is already a contribution. Noovo loves ideas, if you have one get in touch.



Reached 8.14%

It has been 2 days since the campaign started. I didn't think we would reach 5% so fast. I'm so thankful to the early contributors to believe in me when I have nothing. 

Thank you for the contribution. It is incredibly important to us.





Earliest contributors


Masato Tahara 

The first contributor we have got. Masato is an educator & CEO. An active leader in the field of Flipped-classes, active learning and other forms of self-organized learning environment.

Find him here: www.masatotahara.com

Facebook, Twitter


Ryoko Naito

Born in 1978 is a web engineer. She loves British culture, 'The Beatles', 'Altan', 'Sherlock', 'Doctor Who', 'Chieftans' and 'Harry Potter'.

Find her here: http://www.web-naito.net/  Blog: http://nyatto.seesaa.net/

Facebook


Marc Korf

An abstract painter & photographer. View his website: http://marcfotograaf.nl/

Facebook , Twitter


Yuh Etoh

I'm a teacherpreneur. I've teaching English at a high school in Osaka, Japan for more than 15 years. ( I stopped counting.) My mission is to send proactive students to the world. I love to learn with my students. I also design and make accessories. My other mission is to make all moms and moms to be happy because I believe that if moms are happy, the world will be a happier place.

Teaching: http://yufuetou.wix.com/leaf

Accessory shop: www.mamagiftjapan.com

story:
NICO FARMS HAS CLOSED

Dear Friends of Nico Farms,

We must share with you the humbling reality of our situation.

While we have vigorously invested in the farm, from our blood, sweat, & tears, to our hearts, minds, and souls, we are suffering from the fact that our recent efforts were too little too late.  And the reality seems to be that we are at our end before we really even got enough of a start.  It is painful that we must deal with the fact that we have exhausted our financial resources. 

There was nothing, then came ideas, hopes, & dreams.  We came together to create Nico Farms.  While we were severely underfunded from the start, we frugally stretched a “shoe-string budget” into a “dental-floss budget,” and managed to get through our first year.

Realistically, it takes a lot of endurance and resourcefulness to grow a start-up though the long journey to sustainability.  We have the will, but not the financial means.  Thus, without the lottery win or an extremely successful Indiegogo campaign, we have to bid farewell sooner than much of our community got a chance to discover us.

We are grateful for the privilege of being able to help Central Coast Grown break ground at City Farm – San Luis Obispo on the Calle Joaquin Agricultural Reserve.  We are grateful for many supportive people and local businesses.

Bless you all and have a happy new year.

Thank you all sincerely,

Nicola Allegretta  a.k.a.  Nico

**************************************************************************
ABOUT NICO FARMS
Nico Farms was started in San Luis Obispo, California in 2014 by local chef, Nicola Allegretta.  Nicola wanted to truly practice farm-to-table for his restaurant, Mama's Meatball in The Creamery downtown, where his family runs the kitchen. 

See more of Chef Nicola, and hear about the restaurant and the farm!
Watch our new video!
http://studio.smartshoot.com/preview_room/view/137784/98081

With the farm location in the heart of San Luis Obispo, we are positioned to greatly increase farm-to-table practices throughout the community.  We share the value of local food production and know our success depends on the support of the community.  Our growing practices have not included the use of pesticides, and we hope to begin the process of organic certification soon.  We are proud to grow food for our local community, with diverse seasonal varieties that are grown safely for a healthier lifestyle choice. 

Below, you will learn more about us and see some of our happy customers ...

There really is a Mama at Mama's Meatball, and the menu comes from her own recipes.

Mama has been making marinara sauce from our tomatoes, and selling her sauce at 55 Fresh Farmer's Market in Pismo Beach and The Grange Farmer's Market in San Luis Obispo.
http://www.55fresh.com/
https://www.facebook.com/SloGrangeTuesdayFarmer...

Appreciate the quality of local produce.

story:
What is Drunk Mode?

Drunk Mode is your new best friend. Designed to change the lives of drunk people around the world by providing you an all in one solution for the party professional for both safety and fun.

Released on the App Store: In Beta

  • Find My Drunk:  Keep track of your Drunk Friends via GPS
  • Breadcrumbs: See where you went last night and what time you were there
  • Stop Drunk Dialing: Stops you from drunk dialing your friends.
In-Development (To Be Released Feb 2015)
  • Find a Ride:  See where Taxi's, Uber/Lyfts, drunk buses, safe rides and public transportation are in real time to make it more convenient to not drunk drive.
  • Recovery Mode: Recover all your lost snapchats and where you took them.
  • Night Time Enhancers:  Receive Real Time Happy Hour & Sober Food Specials 
  • The Hype Map: Via our features Hype & Hotspots: Know where the best parties are in real time and answer commonly asked questions such as what the girl to guy ratio is at the club, who is actually at that party, etc. 

For less than a Pumpkin Spice Latte - you can contribute to making one of the best drunk apps in the world. We will be using the funding we receive from this campaign to fund technical development and marketing efforts (Mainly throwing Drunk Mode sponsored parties & giving our free swag).

  • Download for iPhone:
  • Download for Android
  • Video Tutorial:
  • How it All Began:


We Started From The Bottom 
And Now We're Here

In less than a year we acquired over 75,000 users, a team of 18 college students all under the age of 23 and we spent less than $10K doing so. Learn more about our story here:




    By Feb. 2015: We Plan To Use Your Contributions to Build These Amazing Features


    1. Find a Ride: Finding a ride is as easy as viewing our map and clicking Pick Me Up | Reducing drunk driving.

    2. Breadcrumbs: Know where you and your friends went last night so situations such as in the Hangover Movie never happen.


    3. Recovery Mode: Don't you wish there was a way to recover snapchats. We will build it. 


    4. Hotspots: Eliminating Sausage Fests by telling you the girl to guy ratio in an area. 



    5. Hype: Answering the eternal question is that club really worth going to tonight?


    6. Happy Hour: No more using Google,now the info you want, comes to you when you need it.


    We Plan To Use The Remaining Funds on Squashing Bugs and More Campus Marketing  



    Why Contribute To Drunk Mode?

    Sexy Safety: Our Features while sexy are trying to make it convenient for you to be safe while allowing you to find your next party. 
    Working Product: The Development Money to pay a development team to debug our product.
    Perks: Donating gets perks like these and more
    • Priority access to our features such as Recovering Snapchats and Our Girl to Guy Ratio Feature, 
    • Drunk People writing you Thank You Letters or Drawing You Like a French Girl.
    • Swag such as Shot Glasses, Coozies, Shirts etc.

    Lastly, Here's the Team that's making this all happen.


    You’ve heard from us and now we’d love to hear from you:

    For Inquiries regarding Drunk Mode, Partnerships, Investment & Press

    • Email: DrunkModeApp@gmail.com
    • Website: http://DrunkMode.org

    Social Media

    • Twitter: @DrunkModeApp
    • Instagram:@DrunkModeApp
    • Pinterest: @DrunkModeApp
    • Facebook: @DrunkMode



    Ways you can help!

    • Donate/Invest
    • Spread the word
    • Download our app (iTunes & Android)
    • Share with your friends

Find a Ride:  See where Taxi's, Uber/Lyfts, drunk buses, safe rides and public transportation are in real time to make it more convenient to not drunk drive.

Recovery Mode: Recover all your lost snapchats and where you took them.

Night Time Enhancers:  Receive Real Time Happy Hour & Sober Food Specials 

The Hype Map: Via our features Hype & Hotspots: Know where the best parties are in real time and answer commonly asked questions such as what the girl to guy ratio is at the club, who is actually at that party, etc. 

For less than a Pumpkin Spice Latte - you can contribute to making one of the best drunk apps in the world. We will be using the funding we receive from this campaign to fund technical development and marketing efforts (Mainly throwing Drunk Mode sponsored parties & giving our free swag).



Download for iPhone:
Download for Android
Video Tutorial:

How it All Began:




We Started From The Bottom And Now We're Here




In less than a year we acquired over 75,000 users, a team of 18 college students all under the age of 23 and we spent less than $10K doing so. Learn more about our story here:












By Feb. 2015: We Plan To Use Your Contributions to Build These Amazing Features

1. Find a Ride: Finding a ride is as easy as viewing our map and clicking Pick Me Up | Reducing drunk driving.






2. Breadcrumbs: Know where you and your friends went last night so situations such as in the Hangover Movie never happen.







3. Recovery Mode: Don't you wish there was a way to recover snapchats. We will build it. 





4. Hotspots: Eliminating Sausage Fests by telling you the girl to guy ratio in an area. 








5. Hype: Answering the eternal question is that club really worth going to tonight?







6. Happy Hour: No more using Google,now the info you want, comes to you when you need it.




We Plan To Use The Remaining Funds on Squashing Bugs and More Campus Marketing  




Why Contribute To Drunk Mode?

Sexy Safety: Our Features while sexy are trying to make it convenient for you to be safe while allowing you to find your next party. 

Working Product: The Development Money to pay a development team to debug our product.

Perks: Donating gets perks like these and more



Priority access to our features such as Recovering Snapchats and Our Girl to Guy Ratio Feature, 


Drunk People writing you Thank You Letters or Drawing You Like a French Girl.

Swag such as Shot Glasses, Coozies, Shirts etc.




Lastly, Here's the Team that's making this all happen.

story:
The Concept

A private charitable foundation “powered” by real estate investments, supporting Vermont children and families through small micro-grants that enhance wellbeing and support a shift toward self-sufficiency.

Who We Are

I can make one unequivocal statement about my experience: what we are doing is not working.  There are individual successes among countless failures.  The human service system is in dire need of an innovative approach to social change.

After years of observation and planning, I believe I have the solution.

A foundation that is funded in a sustainable and dependable way, that delivers effective, efficient and responsive supports to children and families.

What we need

The Children's Foundation is in the concept phase, looking for support to obtain 501(c)(3) nonprofit status with the IRS.  With these funds, we will also create a website, logo, promotional materials and most importantly, a fund development plan that will take us to the next stage.

Copies of receipts for each purchase will be posted on this page after the campaign has closed.  We have elected to accept all funds, even if we don't reach our goal. So every donation is helpful!

We are requesting funding for the following expenses:

$75 - Domain name, hosting

$75 - Vermont Nonprofit Corporation filing fee

$850 - IRS 501(c)(3) application fee

$1,200 - Legal support for IRS application*

$1,000 - Branding and marketing materials, logo, website customization

$1,800 - Technology, office supplies and other startup expenses

-----------

$5,000

*An attorney has agreed to cut his fee in half to support our 501(c)(3) application. He indicated a nonprofit owning investment properties is feasible, but can be a complicated application.

Overview

The Vermont Children's Foundation (VCF) is a unique organization aimed at achieving a singular outcome: to impact social justice by leveraging sustainable assets and community strengths.  The typical nonprofit determines what service it will provide and then pursues funding to support this work.  The VCF strategy is atypical in that it builds sustainable assets in the form of real estate investments, and then determines the reach and depth of the work that is possible.  By building a portfolio of real estate investments, the VCF will be sustainably funded, without the constraints of state or Federal funding.

The VCF was conceived by a social worker that was frustrated by the bureaucracy of "the system" and envisioned a new way of helping the community.  The Foundation will provide unencumbered support to children and families in the form of micro-grants.  These grants can be used to pay for services or activities that enhance the wellbeing of the child and are not funded through conventional channels.  After the Foundation is well established, it may expand to offer social casework or other direct services for children and families that do not qualify for these services through traditional channels.

What comes next

After the Indiegogo community helps us start the foundation and obtain 501(c)(3) nonprofit status, we will begin an aggressive fundraising campaign to purchase our first real estate.  It will snowball from there.  If things go well, we may be back here soon!

How you can help

If you can't donate to the Vermont Children's Foundation, please consider helping in one of the following ways.

  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, anywhere!
  • Tell a friend about this campaign.
  • Send us your ideas and input.
  • Sign up for email updates as we move forward.

story:
Short Summary

For those of you who have been following our progress as we get ready to open know it's taken a long time. Well we are down to the home stretch. We have about two weeks worth of work to finish then we can finish the permit process. The permit process should only take about a week. The problem we have is we are running out of money to finish the work and to get caught up on our rent. This campaign is to pay the rent and finish the construction work so we can move forward and be open by March 1. We hope you can help us and if you do, we will provide a special 'perk' as a thank you.

My name is Domenic Ciolino, I come from a Sicilian family where Italian deserts are just as important as the meal. I want to share the joy of great Italian baked goods like Cannoli, Rum Cake and unbelievably delicious cookies and pastries. After Sunday dinner, my whole family would sit around the table talking and catching up on each other's families and what the kids are doing. There was always coffee and home made Italian cookies and pastries on the table and the kids were not far away when the pastries came out. 

Italian pastry is also a great gift when you go visiting friends. Just think about it, having coffee, sitting with family or friends, laughing, talking and enjoying a nice Ricotta pie or other Italian pastry, cake or cookies.  I have spent the last six months getting the bakery ready just so my customers can share the same experience. Now we need your help.

If we don't raise this money by February 8th, we may not be able to open.

I'm asking for your help to get this bakery, New Hampshire's only Italian Bakery, open for March 1, 2013.

What We Need & What You Get

Basically, we need to finish the small details that will complete our remodel and construction.

We have some great perks for you too. There are different perks for different amounts of money you can commit. But no matter how much you decide to send our way, I guarantee, you won't be disapointed. And to protect your investment, if we don't open on March 1st, then you can get your money back. Of course we will still honor special orders  and you can still place your special orders online.

The Impact

Once we open, we will employ 15 people. And, when we are in full gear in a few months, we will employ over 35 people. And by purchasing from local busineses, we will help employ even more. And even better than that, You and thousands of other New Hampshire residents will have an Italian Bakery they can call their own. Just like the bakeries in Boston's North End, we will have all the favorite Italian pastries, cakes, pies and cookies. But we can't do it without your help. Please take a look at each of the options and the perks, what ever you can do to help us will be greatly appreciated. Once we are open, we hope to see you in the bakery for an espresso and we'd love to show you around to see our operation.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • All we ask is for you to help get the word out and make some noise about our bakery and this money raising campaign.
  • Tell all your Facebook friends and family
  • Visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/terrasinibakery
  • Visit our website at www.terrasinibakery.com

And that’s all there is to it. Thank you for your help and support!

 

Domenic Ciolino

Owner/ Baker

story:
Hello! My name is Sara Johnson and I am the founder of The Homegrown Home. This business has developed from the frustration of going to stores to find most of our goods being made outside of the United States.

As a working artist, teacher, spouse, and mother, I know how time consuming it is to find quality goods made in the United States for my family. I also know the pain of selling my own product in a very tough economy.

The Homegrown Home wants to eliminate these frustrations by bringing these products directly to our customers. With your help, we can build a homegrown community. Small businesses helping small businesses. Families helping families. 

Help Me!

To start up my business, I need at least $3,000.00. To some, that may not be much. To a school teacher like myself, that's a lot.

If I do not reach my financial goal, I will still continue building The Homegrown Home. Luckily, I am pretty crafty and can do most of the grunt work myself. However, as you can see, startup costs add up. Your contribution goes to:

  • Legal Fun/Company Formation - $934 (Trademarks, Filing Fees, Y'OUCH!)
  • Company Branding - $416 (Website, Business Cards, Stickers)
  • Printing of Business Essentials - $780.31 (Catalogs, Postcards, Order Forms)
  • Startup Products - $1000.00 (Collection of merchandise to take to shows.)

 

If I surpass my goal, the money will go towards:

  • Computer and Web Expenses 
  • Office Supplies
  • Future Printings and Products
  • Travel Expenses to Meet Artists, Find Artists, and Selling Merchandise

Please be a Sponsor!

Show that your business supports small businesses! With your sponsorship, you will be recognized for one year with your logo and website in our catalog and website as a Homegrown Supporter. You will also receive a lifetime VIP Card which will include a discount towards purchases.

The Impact

Making a contribution to The Homegrown Home does not only help me, but it helps my family, the artisans, their families, their community, my community, and your community. We will have higher and better quality products in our homes, products made with love and care and not on a production line.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute monetarily, you can still help!

  • Please spread the word about our company in case someone else can help.
  • Share on Facebook, Twitter, Google, or whatever other tools their are to share!

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!!!!!

story:
SoonEnuf is a multifunctional site that will establish a simple, yet engaging environment for same-sex couples to raise money from family, friends and even strangers to help ease the cost of their wedding expenses. A secondary function of the site (yet highly central to the overall goal I’m pushing to accomplish) is to act as a tool to break down the impersonal and polarizing façade that forms around highly publicized and controversial topics (in this case, same-sex marriage). By providing a more intimate, first-hand interaction with real people, their interests and experiences, and how they are/will be personally affected by the outcomes of the current battle for marriage equality, a dialogue suddenly emerges. By utilizing this dialogue while removing constant talk of impersonal aspects like legal battles, protests, petitions, etc… SoonEnuf, the LGBT community and any supporters can accelerate the trend of growing support for marriage equality (and other LGBT issues) among everyday people.

Beyond these goals, the site will have other features to assist and support various aspects of the LGBT community and its supporters with their own ventures and endeavors. A particularly useful feature for both couples and businesses that cater to any of the needs associated with planning a wedding (especially those who specialize in the particular needs associated with same-sex weddings) is highlighted in our “Wedding Planner” perk. Every Couple who sets up a SoonEnuf campaign will be personally provided with a detailed list of businesses (along with contact information and services provided) within a 75 mile radius of their location that provides wedding-related services. Keep reading below to learn more about SoonEnuf, as well as our long list of awesome perks, who I am, more great features the site will offer and the multitude of ways in which SoonEnuf will benefit the LGBT community and its supporters!


                            

                                                           

My name is Ragin Mickens and I’m the founder of SoonEnuf. I’m currently an undergrad student studying civil engineering at the University at Buffalo in Buffalo, NY. SoonEnuf is the culmination of my own experiences throughout my past 3 years in college. The idea behind it all actually grew from my desire to find a unique and effective way to boost the confidence and self-esteem of ‘in the closet’ LGBT people. I came out to my mom during my last few months of high school and the results were… let’s just say pretty disastrous. A big reason I was able to make it through my final months living with my mother was because I have a pretty strong and confident personality. Unfortunately, MANY LGBT people (and especially youth) can’t say the same and sadly, lots of them go as far as ending their own life to escape the torment they constantly live with. Knowing this, ever since I came out I’ve felt it’s been a personal responsibility of mine to ALWAYS speak up against ignorant and demeaning remarks towards LGBT individuals and the community at large. More importantly, I’ve always made sure to really explain how such remarks can really damage other people, while still remaining an open-book of sorts to those around me with questions about being gay. As a result, I’ve actually changed perspectives and decreased ignorance amongst most (if not all) of my friends and how they view the LGBT community.                                                                           

                             

I recently came to the realization that there’s a severe imbalance in the current approach to create a better life for LGBT individuals. The bulk of this approach is focused on either pushing for new laws that promote LGBT equality or trying to increase the confidence and self-esteem of LGBT individuals (especially youth). These are both ESSENTIAL to a better life for the LGBT community but they don’t really solve the core issue that spawns the needs for these approaches in the first place. That issue is simply the ignorance of many of those who aren’t a part of the LGBT community. Their ignorance (and the harmful habits that usually accompany it) is what keeps many LGBT individuals living in fear of revealing their sexual orientation to others. This lack of understanding and association is also at the core of why there are so many opponents to marriage equality and other LGBT issues. Obviously we need all the protests, rallies and legal suits to really push for equality, but the most effective way to win the overall battle is to change people’s minds and perspectives. The best way to do this is to simply let others see the more personal, intimate side of the issue; this is what SoonEnuf will do.


                                             

Although the main and most visible feature of SoonEnuf will be its use as a way for same-sex couples to raise funds for their weddings, it’s the less visible facets that will have the most important impact. By having the sites’ main visual aspect be a diverse array of thousands of happy same-sex couples who are about to take the step towards the ultimate commitment to one another, SoonEnuf becomes much more than just a crowd funding website. For the LGBT community at large, SoonEnuf will be a very real representation of what’s at stake in the battle for equal rights and marriage equality. By displaying to the world the personal perspectives and insights on how growing up and living amongst constant ignorance has affected these thousands of diverse couples, a much more personal and intimate view into the fight for LGBT equality is suddenly unleashed. Without all the distractions of legal battles and protests, stereotypes will be visibly proven false, dialogues will open up and people who previously felt indifferent towards the general treatment of the LGBT community may begin to feel more inclined to speak up against ignorance. The change amongst many individual people may not be big, but it doesn’t need to be to make a difference. Something as small as hearing the word ‘faggot’ and feeling more inclined to speak up and tell someone ‘you shouldn’t say that’, is a step in the right direction and one more vocal supporter of the LGBT community. This site will be many things to many people. For businesses that specialize in LGBT weddings, it’ll be a haven of new customers and opportunities. For LGBT organizations and non-profits, it’ll be a valuable resource from which to spread and gain support for causes and ventures. One of SoonEnuf’s most significant and powerful functions will be to stand as a beacon of hope. With thousands of happy, committed couples on display to the world, this site will stand as living proof to LGBT youth and in the closet individuals everywhere that regardless what difficulties and torment they currently face, there is a light at the end of the tunnel and things really do get better. SoonEnuf has the power to change and help millions of lives all over the world but the only way it can do that is with the support of everyday people like you. Keep reading below to learn more about the site and how you can help make it a reality.


                                         

It’s very simple actually. It’ll all work in a very similar fashion to typical crowd funding.

1. Couples who want to raise some funds to help with wedding expenses make a profile on the site. Your profile will consist of photos (maybe a short video) that showcase the awesome love you two share for each other! You’ll be asked to answer a few questions that will be displayed on your profile including things like how you two met and why marriage equality is important to you. You’ll be given the option to add perks to your campaign as a way to thank your contributors. These perks can be anything from a personally written thank you note to a copy of the wedding ceremony video to even a special invitation to attend the wedding! Next, all you have to do is specify a time limit (max 90 days) that you want to run your campaign, a monetary goal you are trying to reach and then go live!

2. From here we help give you the tools to spread the word of your campaign all across your social media, personal contacts, etc. The more you spread the word, the more funds you’re likely to raise; so tell EVERYONE.

3. We’ll safely and securely collect the funds you raise (in a similar fashion to kickstarter or indiegogo) throughout the life of your campaign while you spread the word and watch as you edge closer and closer to your goal.

4. FUNDED! Once your campaign ends (whether you reach your goal or not) we send out your money minus a 9% processing fee (if we reach at least half of our stretch goal for this campaign, the processing fee drops to 4.5%!) along with a special gift from SoonEnuf to congratulate you on your upcoming big day!


                                      

· Putting couples in direct contact with businesses in their local area who provide various services related to wedding planning

· A Q&A feature that will allow straight people (or anyone for that matter) the opportunity to ask questions they’ve always wanted to ask a gay/lesbian/bi/transgendered person

· Utilizing what will be a vast network of people who are all affected by LGBT issues to get the word out about other ongoing LGBT causes and campaigns.


                                            

Plain and simple, $3,000 is the BARE MINIMUM required to get this site up and running. Everything has already been planned out and price quoted, now we just need the money to pay for it all.

· $400-$500 will be lost to processing fees, paying for the merchandise for our $10, $15, and $30 perks and distributing said merchandise.

· $1500 is going directly to setting up the website. This includes buying the domain name, paying for webhosting to guarantee the site will be up for at least 2 years, setting up the basic aesthetics for the site (how you’ll view things, how you’ll interact with the site, etc), and setting up the functionality of the site (making everything simple and efficient for those doing campaigns, setting up our newsletter, etc)

· $500 will be used for platform security and automation. This means setting up a proper platform so we can safely and securely collect your contributions during your campaign as well as automating features of the site (like your payment distribution, tracking of campaign progress, email distribution, etc) so everything stays very user friendly.

· $300 will be utilized for some minor advertising through facebook and google adwords to help really spread the word about SoonEnuf.

· The remaining $200-$300 will pretty much be a buffer in case of unexpected cost like perk distribution problems or addition costs for the site. I know this isn’t much of a buffer in case something goes wrong, but like I said, $3,000 is the BARE MINIMUM we need.


                                                       

We have a stretch goal of $30,000. This is what we’re really shooting for. Meeting this goal would give us the means to really push this site to its full potential!

Features that’ll be incorporated if we reach our stretch goal include:

· Having the processing fee applied at the end of your campaign CUT IN HALF, from 9% to 4.5%! We actually only need to reach half of our stretch goal for this change to happen!

· Couples who reach their campaign goal, will have the option to donate 5% of the funds they raised to any certified LGBT organization or nonprofit. Those who do, will have their processing fee reduced to 3.5%

· Availability of those from other countries (like the UK where same-sex marriage recently became legal) to do campaigns

· A simple and interactive Q&A feature will be added to the site where straight people (or anyone) can publicly and anonymously ask questions they’ve always wanted to ask a gay/lesbian/bi/trans person and have them personally answered by someone of that sexual orientation. (I’m REALLY excited about this feature because it will help foster a better understanding and less ignorance).

· An app for your smartphone so you can view and track the progress of your campaign on the go, as well as see who’s contributed and how much.

· A mobile version of our site so viewing and contributing to a campaign will be easier and more user friendly on smartphones and tablets.

· A much larger advertising budget that will feature some of our successful campaigns so we can really get the word out there!

· MANY other improvements (too many to name and some we haven’t fully considered since we don’t want to get our hopes up) to the site to really make it top notch and much more engaging for people who visit. One feature that's under heavy consideration is expanding the crowd-funding tools to allow any LGBT related campaigns rather than only those to fund same-sex marriages.

There are TONS of other things we could/would like to do with the site if we reach our stretch goal but we simply CAN’T do any of it WITHOUT SUPPORT from the LGBT community and its supporters. We feel support should be a two-way street rather than blindly donating, so we’ve put in a lot of work to offer up a long list of awesome perks to benefit people in nearly any scenario. We’ve got perks tailored for those who want to do a campaign once the site is up, for LGBT businesses and organizations who could benefit from the recognition and publicity of supporting what’s sure to be a popular site, for businesses that provide wedding services and want couples to know who they are, and even for just regular people who want to show their support through an awesome shirt, wristband or bumper sticker. There’s perks for literally everyone, so pick your favorite before the opportunity is gone! On top of all that, as a special token of appreciation, if we reach our stretch goal, one randomly selected person who contributes only $15 and claims our ‘Support Bundle!’ perk with receive a brand new iPad mini! Anyone who contributes $30 or more will get a full sized iPad with Retina Display! 


                                                            

$1 - Thank You!

Every little bit helps. ANY and ALL contributions are GREATLY appreciated.

$10 - Put A Band On It!

Showcase your support by picking one of our two “Damn Right I Support It” bracelets (shown below) and we’ll mail it straight to your doorstep!


$10 – Check the Bumper!

Choose one of our two awesome bumper stickers to show your support to all those in your rearview mirror and we’ll mail it out to you.

      


$15 – Support Bundle!

One randomly selected person who picks this perk will receive a brand new iPad mini as an extra token of appreciation for the support for SoonEnuf! Great Value and great way to show your support on a budget! Pick any three items from our two “Damn Right I Support It” bracelets and two bumper stickers and we’ll mail them out at the conclusion of the campaign. You can mix and match or pick 3 of the same item, you choose!

$25 – Supporter!

Have the name of your business, organization, brand or company permanently displayed on the “Proud Supporters” page of our website where you can be recognized by any and everyone who visits our site! This site is going to garner A LOT of attention and this perk is the perfect way to get a lot of people informed about your site and its support of the LGBT community.

$30 – Stylin’ Support!

One of my favorite perks! Pick any one of our 4 personally designed shirts (sizes: s, m, l, xl) to show off your support for marriage equality in style! On top of that, contributing $30 or more gives you a chance to receive a full sized iPad with Retina Display if we reach our stretch goal!


$50 – Recognized Supporter!

A step up from ‘Supporter’. Have the name of your business, organization, brand or company permanently displayed on the “Proud Supporters” page of our site along with your logo and a link to your website or preferred site destination. With all the publicity and traffic SoonEnuf is sure to get, this perk is a great way to get recognized while driving traffic to your own site!

$50 – SoonEnuf Newlyweds!

Thinking of doing a SoonEnuf campaign once the site is up? Take advantage of this great value ahead of time. The first 60 couples who pledge $50 to our campaign guarantee themselves a 4.5% processing fee (rather than 9%) on the funds they raise! And if we raise at least half our stretch goal, (at which point the processing fee drops to 4.5% for everyone) yours will drop to only 2.75%! This is a great way to keep money in your pocket to spend on your big day!

$100 – Premium Supporter!

Best recognition value that’s only topped by our ‘Sponsor’ perks. Have your business logo, name and web address displayed in our “Premium Supporters” section which will feature a larger space for your business info (to increase your chances of recognition). Also, you’re given the ability to call upon us (on up to 10 separate occasions!) throughout our first year of operation to utilize our resources to promote the ventures of your business or organization. That means spreading the word of your business through our social media, email contacts and newsletter! This perk is awesome for not only getting your business recognized, but for getting your cause or venture known to the masses!

$100 – SoonEnuf Newlyweds Premium!

Best value for those planning on doing a campaign! The first 25 couples to pledge $100 to our campaign will have their processing fee COMPLETELY WAIVED (regardless of if we reach our stretch goal) on the funds they raise during their campaign! That means every penny you raise, you keep!

$125 – Same-Sex Wedding Needs!

Have a business that provides wedding related services (anything ranging from space vendors, floral arrangements, cakes, etc)? By contributing $125 to our campaign, your business information will be personally provided to every couple who makes a campaign within a 75 mile radius of your location for our entire first year of operation! This is an incredible value that can not only easily pay for itself, but also allows us to bring business straight to you!

$250 – Proud Sponsor!

Getting into the heavy weights now. As a ‘Proud Sponsor’ and for providing this level of support, you’ll have our greatest appreciation and we’ll make sure people know who you are and what you do! Your business/organization will receive a full page in EVERY issue of our bi-weekly newsletter to advertise yourself, as well as special recognition ‘shout outs’ AT LEAST once a month across our various social media sites along with links to your site. In a similar fashion to a ‘Premium Supporter’, you’ll be given my personal email address with the ability to call upon us to promote your ventures/causes on up to 10 separate occasions throughout our first year of operations. Your business/organization info will also be displayed in the prominent space of our ‘Proud Sponsors’ page where it will occupy space TWICE the size of that allowed to our ‘Premium Supporters’. Finally, you’ll receive 2 of our personally designed SoonEnuf shirts along with 2 of our “Damn Right I Support It” bracelets and both of our bumper stickers. This perk is limited to an availability of only 20!

$500 – Premium Sponsor!

The Big One. Our highest level of recognition! We make sure everyone who knows us, also knows you. Everything included in the “Proud Sponsor” contribution with the addition of receiving special recognition ‘shout outs’ at least TWICE a month as well as receiving all 4 of our personally designed marriage equality shirts. Also, for our first year of operations you’ll have your logo with website link displayed on the most prominent space of our site; our HOMEPAGE! You’ll also be mentioned in every press release we send out throughout our first year of operations as well as have your business/organizations name, logo and web address featured in the welcome email sent to EVERY couple who starts a new campaign on our site. Basically, we make sure you’ll be seen everywhere we’re seen to maximize the exposure of your business/organization. DON’T HESITATE THOUGH, we only offer this perk to the FIRST 10 people who grab it.


                                                

I don’t think there’s a single LGBT person who wouldn’t be able to benefit from this site in some way. Whether it’s having the means to do a crowd funding campaign for their wedding on a site that caters specifically to LGBT individuals or just having to endure less ignorance and ridicule in the world as views and perspectives slowly change, all LGBT people have a stake in the impact this site will make. I’m a college student and completely understand that not everyone has the means to donate to something regardless of how much they believe in it. At the very least, if you could spread the word of this campaign, you’re helping not only us, but potentially millions more as we push forward. With that said, if everyone who visits this page could PLEASE ‘like’ and ‘share’ our Facebook page, follow us on twitter, share our campaign through your social media with friends and family, and tell everyone and anyone you know who could benefit from what we’re going to accomplish, you’d have our SINCEREST gratitude.
story_txt:
SoonEnuf is a multifunctional site that will establish a simple, yet engaging environment for same-sex couples to raise money from family, friends and even
    strangers to help ease the cost of their wedding expenses. A secondary function of the site (yet highly central to the overall goal I’m pushing to
    accomplish) is to act as a tool to break down the impersonal and polarizing façade that forms around highly publicized and controversial topics (in this
    case, same-sex marriage). By providing a more intimate, first-hand interaction with real people, their interests and experiences, and how they are/will be
    personally affected by the outcomes of the current battle for marriage equality, a dialogue suddenly emerges. By utilizing this dialogue while removing
    constant talk of impersonal aspects like legal battles, protests, petitions, etc… SoonEnuf, the LGBT community and any supporters can accelerate the trend
    of growing support for marriage equality (and other LGBT issues) among everyday people.


    Beyond these goals, the site will have other features to assist and support various aspects of the LGBT community and its supporters with their own
    ventures and endeavors. A particularly useful feature for both couples and businesses that cater to any of the needs associated with planning a wedding
    (especially those who specialize in the particular needs associated with same-sex weddings) is highlighted in our “Wedding Planner” perk. Every Couple who
    sets up a SoonEnuf campaign will be personally provided with a detailed list of businesses (along with contact information and services provided) within a
    75 mile radius of their location that provides wedding-related services. Keep reading below to learn more about SoonEnuf, as well as our long list of
    awesome perks, who I am, more great features the site will offer and the multitude of ways in which SoonEnuf will benefit the LGBT community and its
    supporters!



                            
                                                           


    My name is Ragin Mickens and I’m the founder of SoonEnuf. I’m currently an undergrad student studying civil engineering at the University at Buffalo in
    Buffalo, NY. SoonEnuf is the culmination of my own experiences throughout my past 3 years in college. The idea behind it all actually grew from my desire
    to find a unique and effective way to boost the confidence and self-esteem of ‘in the closet’ LGBT people. I came out to my mom during my last few months
    of high school and the results were… let’s just say pretty disastrous. A big reason I was able to make it through my final months living with my mother was
    because I have a pretty strong and confident personality. Unfortunately, MANY LGBT people (and especially youth) can’t say the same and sadly, lots of them
    go as far as ending their own life to escape the torment they constantly live with. Knowing this, ever since I came out I’ve felt it’s been a personal
    responsibility of mine to ALWAYS speak up against ignorant and demeaning remarks towards LGBT individuals and the community at large. More importantly,
    I’ve always made sure to really explain how such remarks can really damage other people, while still remaining an open-book of sorts to those around me
    with questions about being gay. As a result, I’ve actually changed perspectives and decreased ignorance amongst most (if not all) of my friends and how
    they view the LGBT community.                                                                           
                             

    I recently came to the realization that there’s a severe imbalance in the current approach to create a better life for LGBT individuals. The bulk of this
    approach is focused on either pushing for new laws that promote LGBT equality or trying to increase the confidence and self-esteem of LGBT individuals
    (especially youth). These are both ESSENTIAL to a better life for the LGBT community but they don’t really solve the core issue that spawns the needs for
    these approaches in the first place. That issue is simply the ignorance of many of those who aren’t a part of the LGBT community. Their ignorance (and the
    harmful habits that usually accompany it) is what keeps many LGBT individuals living in fear of revealing their sexual orientation to others. This lack of
    understanding and association is also at the core of why there are so many opponents to marriage equality and other LGBT issues. Obviously we need all the
    protests, rallies and legal suits to really push for equality, but the most effective way to win the overall battle is to change people’s minds and
    perspectives. The best way to do this is to simply let others see the more personal, intimate side of the issue; this is what SoonEnuf will do.


                                             


    Although the main and most visible feature of SoonEnuf will be its use as a way for same-sex couples to raise funds for their weddings, it’s the less
    visible facets that will have the most important impact. By having the sites’ main visual aspect be a diverse array of thousands of happy same-sex couples
    who are about to take the step towards the ultimate commitment to one another, SoonEnuf becomes much more than just a crowd funding website. For the LGBT
    community at large, SoonEnuf will be a very real representation of what’s at stake in the battle for equal rights and marriage equality. By displaying to
    the world the personal perspectives and insights on how growing up and living amongst constant ignorance has affected these thousands of diverse couples, a
    much more personal and intimate view into the fight for LGBT equality is suddenly unleashed. Without all the distractions of legal battles and protests,
    stereotypes will be visibly proven false, dialogues will open up and people who previously felt indifferent towards the general treatment of the LGBT
    community may begin to feel more inclined to speak up against ignorance. The change amongst many individual people may not be big, but it doesn’t need to
    be to make a difference. Something as small as hearing the word ‘faggot’ and feeling more inclined to speak up and tell someone ‘you shouldn’t say that’,
    is a step in the right direction and one more vocal supporter of the LGBT community. This site will be many things to many people. For businesses that
    specialize in LGBT weddings, it’ll be a haven of new customers and opportunities. For LGBT organizations and non-profits, it’ll be a valuable resource from
    which to spread and gain support for causes and ventures. One of SoonEnuf’s most significant and powerful functions will be to stand as a beacon of hope.
    With thousands of happy, committed couples on display to the world, this site will stand as living proof to LGBT youth and in the closet individuals
    everywhere that regardless what difficulties and torment they currently face, there is a light at the end of the tunnel and things really do get better.
    SoonEnuf has the power to change and help millions of lives all over the world but the only way it can do that is with the support of everyday people like
    you. Keep reading below to learn more about the site and how you can help make it a reality.


                                         


    It’s very simple actually. It’ll all work in a very similar fashion to typical crowd funding.


    1. Couples who want to raise some funds to help with wedding expenses make a profile on the site. Your profile will consist of photos (maybe a short video)
    that showcase the awesome love you two share for each other! You’ll be asked to answer a few questions that will be displayed on your profile including
    things like how you two met and why marriage equality is important to you. You’ll be given the option to add perks to your campaign as a way to thank your
    contributors. These perks can be anything from a personally written thank you note to a copy of the wedding ceremony video to even a special invitation to
    attend the wedding! Next, all you have to do is specify a time limit (max 90 days) that you want to run your campaign, a monetary goal you are trying to
    reach and then go live!


    2. From here we help give you the tools to spread the word of your campaign all across your social media, personal contacts, etc. The more you spread the
    word, the more funds you’re likely to raise; so tell EVERYONE.


    3. We’ll safely and securely collect the funds you raise (in a similar fashion to kickstarter or indiegogo) throughout the life of your campaign while you
    spread the word and watch as you edge closer and closer to your goal.


    4. FUNDED! Once your campaign ends (whether you reach your goal or not) we send out your money minus a 9% processing fee (if we reach at least half of our stretch goal for
    this campaign, the processing fee drops to 4.5%!) along with a special gift from SoonEnuf to congratulate you on your upcoming big day!


                                      


    · Putting couples in direct contact with businesses in their local area who provide various services related to wedding planning


    · A Q&A feature that will allow straight people (or anyone for that matter) the opportunity to ask questions they’ve always wanted to ask a
    gay/lesbian/bi/transgendered person


    · Utilizing what will be a vast network of people who are all affected by LGBT issues to get the word out about other ongoing LGBT causes and campaigns.


                                            


    Plain and simple, $3,000 is the BARE MINIMUM required to get this site up and running. Everything has already been planned out and price
    quoted, now we just need the money to pay for it all.


    · $400-$500 will be lost to processing fees, paying for the merchandise for our $10, $15, and $30 perks and distributing said merchandise.


    · $1500 is going directly to setting up the website. This includes buying the domain name, paying for webhosting to guarantee the site will be up for at
    least 2 years, setting up the basic aesthetics for the site (how you’ll view things, how you’ll interact with the site, etc), and setting up the
    functionality of the site (making everything simple and efficient for those doing campaigns, setting up our newsletter, etc)


    · $500 will be used for platform security and automation. This means setting up a proper platform so we can safely and securely collect your contributions
    during your campaign as well as automating features of the site (like your payment distribution, tracking of campaign progress, email distribution, etc) so
    everything stays very user friendly.


    · $300 will be utilized for some minor advertising through facebook and google adwords to help really spread the word about SoonEnuf.


    · The remaining $200-$300 will pretty much be a buffer in case of unexpected cost like perk distribution problems or addition costs for the site. I know
    this isn’t much of a buffer in case something goes wrong, but like I said, $3,000 is the BARE MINIMUM we need.


                                                       


    We have a stretch goal of $30,000. This is what we’re really shooting for. Meeting this goal would give us the means to really push this
    site to its full potential!


    Features that’ll be incorporated if we reach our stretch goal include:


    · Having the processing fee applied at the end of your campaign CUT IN HALF, from 9% to 4.5%! We actually only need to reach half of our stretch goal for this change to happen!

    · Couples who reach their campaign goal, will have the option to donate 5% of the funds they raised to any certified LGBT organization or nonprofit. Those
    who do, will have their processing fee reduced to 3.5%


    · Availability of those from other countries (like the UK where same-sex marriage recently became legal) to do campaigns


    · A simple and interactive Q&A feature will be added to the site where straight people (or anyone) can publicly and anonymously ask questions they’ve
    always wanted to ask a gay/lesbian/bi/trans person and have them personally answered by someone of that sexual orientation. (I’m REALLY excited about this
    feature because it will help foster a better understanding and less ignorance).


    · An app for your smartphone so you can view and track the progress of your campaign on the go, as well as see who’s contributed and how much.


    · A mobile version of our site so viewing and contributing to a campaign will be easier and more user friendly on smartphones and tablets.


    · A much larger advertising budget that will feature some of our successful campaigns so we can really get the word out there!


    · MANY other improvements (too many to name and some we haven’t fully considered since we don’t want to get our hopes up) to the site to really make it top
    notch and much more engaging for people who visit. One feature that's under heavy consideration is expanding the crowd-funding tools to allow any LGBT related campaigns rather than only those to fund same-sex marriages.

There are TONS of other things we could/would like to do with the site if we reach our stretch goal but we simply CAN’T do any of it    WITHOUT SUPPORT from the LGBT community and its supporters. We feel support should be a two-way street rather than blindly donating, so
    we’ve put in a lot of work to offer up a long list of awesome perks to benefit people in nearly any scenario. We’ve got perks tailored for those who want
    to do a campaign once the site is up, for LGBT businesses and organizations who could benefit from the recognition and publicity of supporting what’s sure
    to be a popular site, for businesses that provide wedding services and want couples to know who they are, and even for just regular people who want to show
    their support through an awesome shirt, wristband or bumper sticker. There’s perks for literally everyone, so pick your favorite before the opportunity is
    gone!
    
        On top of all that, as a special token of appreciation, if we reach our stretch goal, one randomly selected person who contributes only $15 and claims
        our ‘Support Bundle!’ perk with receive a brand new iPad mini! Anyone who contributes $30 or more will get a full sized iPad with Retina Display!

story:
About the Situation

Every 9 seconds a woman in the United States is abused. But few people are like Asma Hanif who have dedicated their entire lives to actually doing something to stop that. She founded one of the only shelters for battered Muslim women in the United States, Muslimat Al-Nisaa, and is relentless in urging leaders to stop sweeping this ugly issue under the rug and pretending like it doesn't happen.

And now, because of how much she gives to helping the women at this shelter - Asma has given up everything of her own in return. She has no income and no home. The shelter she started is where she lives too. It's a willing sacrifice she makes to help the people around her, and she of all people shouldn't have to. It wouldn't be a surprise if the women she's helped are your mothers, sisters, daughters, cousins or at least someone you know. And even if they aren't she wouldn't hesitate to take care of them if they turned to her for help.

Why can't we do the same for her? We all hope and pray that her reward will be from Allah, but she, of all people, deserves good from this life and from the people around her.

 

What We Need

By trade, Asma is a nurse. She takes care of strangers and ensures their well-being but isn't able to do the same for her very own mother. Now, she is in need of a place of her own where she can take care of her sick mother, who is suffering from a terrible disease. Someone with a bad disease and other health conditions needs proper medical attention and cannot live in a shelter that houses dozens of women and children. 

If that is not enough to help the Muslim woman devoted to improving our community, then what is?

Without her asking, her friends decided to set up this fundraiser to get Sister Asma and her mother a place to stay. Buying her a house would be ideal. However, if we can raise at least a year's worth of rent for her, it would be a great start. We have located an adequate place in the DC area that rents for about $1,200 a month (a standard rate for housing in the area). That comes out to about $14,400 a year. She would be able to stay close to the shleter and have her privacy to help her mother out in the last stage of her life.

Every penny, every dollar that we are all capable of giving, helps build a shelter for Asma as she whithers a storm that we pray nobody should have to go through. Especially alone.
 
 
 
See how others have tried to shed light on the work Sister Asma has done:
 
http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=120752667
 
http://30mosques.com/2011/08/battered-but-not-beaten/
 
http://muslimmatters.org/2009/01/30/muslimat-al-nisaa-shelter-our-sisters/
story_txt:
About the Situation
Every 9 seconds a woman in the United States is abused. But few people are like Asma Hanif who have dedicated their entire lives to actually doing something to stop that. She founded one of the only shelters for battered Muslim women in the United States, Muslimat Al-Nisaa, and is relentless in urging leaders to stop sweeping this ugly issue under the rug and pretending like it doesn't happen.And now, because of how much she gives to helping the women at this shelter - Asma has given up everything of her own in return. She has no income and no home. The shelter she started is where she lives too. It's a willing sacrifice she makes to help the people around her, and she of all people shouldn't have to. It wouldn't be a surprise if the women she's helped are your mothers, sisters, daughters, cousins or at least someone you know. And even if they aren't she wouldn't hesitate to take care of them if they turned to her for help.Why can't we do the same for her? We all hope and pray that her reward will be from Allah, but she, of all people, deserves good from this life and from the people around her.
 
What We Need


By trade, Asma is a nurse. She takes care of strangers and ensures their well-being but isn't able to do the same for her very own mother. Now, she is in need of a place of her own where she can take care of her sick mother, who is suffering from a terrible disease. Someone with a bad disease and other health conditions needs proper medical attention and cannot live in a shelter that houses dozens of women and children. If that is not enough to help the Muslim woman devoted to improving our community, then what is?Without her asking, her friends decided to set up this fundraiser to get Sister Asma and her mother a place to stay. Buying her a house would be ideal. However, if we can raise at least a year's worth of rent for her, it would be a great start. We have located an adequate place in the DC area that rents for about $1,200 a month (a standard rate for housing in the area). That comes out to about $14,400 a year. She would be able to stay close to the shleter and have her privacy to help her mother out in the last stage of her life.Every penny, every dollar that we are all capable of giving, helps build a shelter for Asma as she whithers a storm that we pray nobody should have to go through. Especially alone.
 
 
 
See how others have tried to shed light on the work Sister Asma has done:
 
http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=120752667
 
http://30mosques.com/2011/08/battered-but-not-beaten/
 
http://muslimmatters.org/2009/01/30/muslimat-al-nisaa-shelter-our-sisters/

story:
Greetings. My name is Jen Piché and I live in Temecula, California. I need your help raising money for an admirable woman to become a U.S. Citizen. Because of her generous care, my parents were able to remain at home on their beloved ranch as their health declined, right up to the end. This was their greatest wish. Now I want to grant her wish and fulfill her dream of U.S. Citizenship.

Meet Maura Gomez, age 58. From El Salvador, she's been in the U.S. - LEGALLY - for 30+ years, toiling away at various jobs. Living in Hemet, CA, she has her "Green Card," CA Driver's License, and a car. A live-in caregiver at my parents' home for almost 3 years, Maura tended lovingly to my bedridden mother, until mom died of Alzheimer's.

       

Then she cared for my father until we lost him to Parkinson's.

My Brilliant Dad:  Not everyone could cope with my dry-witted, curmudgeonly old dad. Maura handled his mischief with humor and affection. She juiced greens for his tube feedings, cajoled him to do his exercises, emptied his catheter bag, and fretted over him like a mother bird. She cried with each parent's passing, and now prefers housecleaning jobs - just can't bear the losses.

                                       

The Facts, Ma'am. Give Us the Facts:  Since she's over 50 and has been a Permanent U.S. Resident for 20+ years, all she needs for citizenship is $680+$200 for fees and paperwork, and to take a test. Maura does speak English (kind of like Chico Marx). However, since she doesn't read or write, her sister will help her. All the money raised will go to Maura, other than the small percentage for IndieGogo and Paypal.

She's a Good Woman:  When my mom first left us, Maura stayed on for $25/day - just out of the goodness of her heart - rather than abandon my dad. It was all we could afford to pay her. (Fortunately, I was able to find resources to pay her more, thanks to the State of California, family, and some very good friends.)

I'm Impressed: Maura is inspiring. Growing up very poor in El Salvador, she never had the chance to go to school. Even though she can't read the street signs, she drives all over; the woman is fearless! She will learn the route to a housecleaning job and remember it visually. A diabetic, she has taught herself to read the sugar content on packages. Divorced from an abusive husband, Maura has no children of her own, but dotes on her nieces and nephew.

Wrap It Up, Lady:  Citizenship will be a just reward for this hard-working woman, who helped 2 old folks stay home in spite of failing health. Our whole family is deeply grateful to her. Any amount you can pitch in will be hugely appreciated. Thank you heaps.

Jen (Yankee) Caulfield Piché

                    

By the way, if we exceed the goal, the money will be used to help Maura in other other ways - tires for her car, gas, etc - so many needs!

Maura's new housecleaning website:
www.MaurasGreenAndClean.com

Credits:  Videotaped by Enicia Fisher-Blake. Edited by Alden Blake - at only 15, he worked miracles, making it almost-painless to watch myself on video. Now, THAT's something.  Check out his clever films on his Vimeo channel (this is an "I-knew-him-when" type of kid):

www.vimeo.com/aldenblake

story:
Short Summary

Nancy’s Avenue is that place you will come to and relax in an invigorating atmosphere of art and forward thinkers. A one-stop shop for your design and decorating needs. From parties to weddings to holiday decorating for your home or business – Nancy’s Avenue is here for you. We want you to come in and order a cup of coffee to go – and a chair, or a lamp… It’s all art and it’s all for sale. On Friday nights we hope you’ll stop by to listen to local musicians share their gifts on a small, makeshift stage. In the back room, you can peruse the cool furniture designs for your bedroom and patio. You’ll find a fold down desk made from the tailgate of the first truck I bought my husband when he was just 20 years old. We can take your old and make it new again. If I (or you) can dream it – we’ll make it.

We’ve looked at the numbers. We checked them twice, a hundred times. Your contributions will help secure a storefront and construct a setting folks will never want to leave. Thanks to you we will purchase a walk in cooler and display cooler; Tools to turn ordinary, discarded doors into bookcases, headboards into benches, windows into canopies and more. It will cover decorating and seasonal products and supplies for design and decorating jobs. Your gifts will aide in the advertisement costs and signs and brochures.

I don’t remember a time when the ideas didn’t just start to flow the minute my feet touched the floor in the mornings. I was in the fifth grade when a teacher told me I wasn’t getting enough sleep. I couldn’t sleep – I was  dreaming. And conscious dreams are so much more fun than subconscious. They require thought and planning and art and math.

In between marriage, four kids, two battles with cancer and losing everything when the economy took a nose dive in 2008, those dreams were shelved. Then I stumbled into  a part time job as an inexperienced florist last spring and suddenly - I was… am… alive again.

In an unfortunate turn of events, the flower shop sold and took a downward turn. Brainstorming with the lead designer, we realized we both share the same vision. With his experience, loyal clientele and my love for coloring outside the lines, it is a match made in heaven. And there you have it – the birth of Nancy’s Avenue.

I hope you will support this endeavor. I assure you that your gifts and contributions will spread exponentially as we give a portion of all profits back to the community. People are valuable and amazing and I don’t sleep well knowing a single person doubts this truth. The name Nancy – it means grace and Nancy’s Avenue will be not only a place of art, but an entity that supports and encourages others…with grace.
