It's not called Retail Therapy for nothing...
Human beings are social animals and this need to connect drives the spirit behind Red Line 5ive & Dime. I was born to be a shopkeeper. Nothing excites me more than human behavior. Ok, maybe a great thrift store score...so why not combine the two and turn them into a viable, profitable business with an eye on social responsibility. Reduce, reuse, recycle and really care about others. 
With more than 15 years retail management experience including the development and maintenance of a successful on-line store, I've got the skills, the drive and the confidence needed to make Red Line 5ive & Dime a success.
I'm one man trying to make his corner of the world a better place. To borrow from Mr. Jackson, I started with the man in the mirror. After years of battling my demons, I've been able to lay them down for almost three years. Moment by moment, smile by smile, tear by tear. At last, I understand who I am and what I want. It's now time for me to give back and affect the culture of Chicago in a positive way. I firmly believe Red Line 5ive & Dime is that vehicle.
Thank you for considering a donation to the Red Line 5ive & Dime campaign. If you can't help out financially, how about letting others know about me and my dream...? Word of mouth is priceless. 
Feel free to contact me should you have any questions.
Keep making this world pretty.
R. Kelly

story:
My name is Kellie Sipos, and I am the founder and executive director of a small not-for-profit 501 c 3 that has the awesome privilege of witnessing miracles every day. Saddle Up Riding Club offers equine assisted therapy to disabled children, adults and veterans, as well as reaching out to the able-bodied community with safe, affordable, educational classes on horse care and safety.

Saddle Up became incorporated ten years ago, founded with the purpose of teaching children compassion, commitment, teamwork and good sportsmanship. We are now an equine therapy program that reaches fifty disabled riders/and or veterans a week. Fifteen to twenty children are in structured horseback riding programs, homeschool groups, school field trips and private functions for organizations. Saddle Up has also partnered with the Pinellas County Juvenile Welfare Board, working with at-risk youth offering community service opportunities instead of “doing time” in juvenile detention centers. Many of these children have merely made poor choices, and are primarily need of an opportunity for redeeming themselves.

We at Saddle Up function as a family: we have fifteen to twenty core senior volunteers that assist us weekly with therapy sessions.  We have fathers of riders who spend hours every week volunteering their time and energy by helping with grounds maintenance and repairs to boards.  We have instructors that teach because of their love of children and horses, not for the money. Our “Equine Assisted Therapy Program” is supervised by a board-certified behavior specialist, and therapeutic instructors who must be trained and certified through PATH to be qualified to teach. “Hugs are the highlight of our Saturdays,” is a common refrain, and Melissa and I receive them from riders and parents alike. Many of our clients have now been with us for five years, and we have witnessed them develope strength, self-esteem and belief in themselves and what they can accomplish. Some, unfortunately, we have lost as God has called them to be with Him.  We know that we are the highlight of the week for most. Even the nonverbal riders wear huge smiles, make happy noises, or simply hug us when they arrive and when they leave.

Unfortunately, we are at risk of loosing all of this; we have fought hard, but seem to be faced with one trial after another. Loosing our facility after six years of a continuous lease because of an arbitrary landlord was the hardest blow of all. We need to purchase a property in order to secure the future of this vital organization. We are currently living on a temporary property where all the horses are out in the elements. Our programs can only operate at a minimal level, and the necessary structure for our therapy riders and horses is becoming more difficult to maintain week after week, as we deal with the unpredictable, unseasonal winter rains and sporadic cool weather. Worse to come is in May with the summer rains, when the property we are on will be flooded. We must purchase the land we have found immediately! Lenders are in place, but we can barely maintain the horses financially, let alone raise $80,000 for the down payment. We need all of you; we need many hands to dig deep to help us overcome this financial hurdle!

HOW CAN YOU HELP AND WHAT DO YOU GET?

Our campaign consists of four phases, but we are currently working on funding for each phase one at a time. Our immediate need is the $80,000 for the down payment along with our offer on two beautiful acres in the middle of Pinellas County. We chose this property because it is an easy location to find, and has an adjoining, additional two acres that we can purchase after the loan on the first two acres is paid off. This property is beautifully set with trees for shade and has an easy access from the main roads. The property is at fair market value and the owner is willing to accommodate us.

If we cannot raise this $80,000, we may have to sell our horses and lose this greatly needed service to our veterans, children and adults. Saddle Up is the only center of its kind in Pinellas County. Other facilities work with children, many with disabled riders, and a few work exclusively with veterans, but only Saddle Up offers so many services to all such categories in need. We are a sanctioned PATH Center, one of 900 nationwide. We must follow strict guidelines and mandates to keep the PATH logo displayed on our property. Saddle Up opens its doors to the public each month, offering horse rides, chances to interact with our farm animals, have hay rides and offer wholesome family fun. For those living in the most densely populated county in the state of Florida, educating children on farm animals has become a rare experience.

For years when we were short financially we held fundraisers, and on occasion my husband and I would personally fund activities. We are no longer financially able to do this, and fundraising is difficult when there is no property where we can hold events. Crowd-funding appears to be our only option. Each and every one of you has become our only hope.

Saddle up will be able to move our horses into temporary housing once we have purchased the new property. A building campaign will then begin to raise the barn, covered arena and sensory riding trails.  On May 9 – 11th we are hosting the Royal Lipizzan Stallions for a three night event, and feel confident we can raise the funds for the building through this event. By June 1st we could be on a permanent property ready to hold camps for the summer and allow programs to operate ~ rain or shine ~ seven days a week.

We understand times are tight, and perhaps you have read this and want to give, but just do not have any extra finances in your budget. If that is so, you can still help by sharing this campaign with your friends. Help us “make some noise” about our campaign; Indiegogo has great sharing tools. Each of you, no matter where you live, can make a difference in the life of a person with a disability; will you do that today? Your donations are tax deductible, as we are a 501 c 3 listed with the IRS.  Please don’t make the mistake of thinking someone else will provide help, as all too often everyone thinks someone else will give, but then no one does.  Be that unique person, take a stand for our disabled citizens and veterans, give what you can, and provide a legacy for generations to come. For more information on Saddle Up, go to www.saddleupridingclub.org.

story:
Help Caffeine Spaces expand its presence to our new location with a membership drive!

Yes, Caffeine Spaces is moving! We are expanding to an amazing new location!

Caffeine Spaces has begun to have a major impact in our area. Now is the time to take this one step further. By expanding our local presence our community has a bigger foot print and this in turn helps our members achieve higher goals. You like reaching goals right. You should help us achieve ours!

  • Mark Laymon is the catalyst behind Caffeine Spaces and has already developed a strong supportive community around him by helping others achieve their goals.
  • We wish to expand our membership for our members to become more productive.
  • You as a contributor will help us achieve our goal in two ways; one is by sharing with your social graph, two is by claiming one of our rewards.
  • What we are creating is as close to a professional business clubhouse as possible. All the amenities of a large office are included, but none of the overhead.
  • Becoming a coworking member is much more than renting a desk, it is joining a community of likeminded individuals that want to work in a group environment, but still have the flexibility of working for yourself.

Why Coworking?

Is the coffee shop you are working at discouraging you from squatting all day at one of their many tables? You bought at least one of their overpriced drinks didn't you? Having an affordable and welcoming coworking space is the Caffeine Spaces solution.

The local coffee shop I have worked at for the past few years has gone so far as to cover their power outlets! What about renting an executive office space for your startup? Do you want to have a one year contract for a company that may only take 90 days to launch? What will you do with the office with the remaining nine months? Is your lease transferable? Maybe you should stay at home? You don't mind having clients see your laundry do you? These are just a few things you need to contemplate before you decide to join a coworking space.

Caffeine Spaces has developed a community driven office space to help like minded individuals that want to work in a group environment, achieve economies of scale without being a big company and enjoy being open and part of the community that value collaboration, openness, community, accessibility and sustainability. But this is just the beginning of what Caffeine Spaces is offering.

Caffeine Spaces influences many groups in our area. We need your support to keep going. One of the groups that we feeling strongly is the Delray and Boca Robotics League. The group is a collection of FLL (FIRST Lego League Teams) within the greater Delray Beach/Boca Raton Area. The league consists of teams of 4 students who develop strategy, build robots, and provide solutions for technological problems within a defined annual challenge. Your support helps us to keep groups like this in our area.

Help Spread the News about Coworking!

Some people just can’t contribute this we understand, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help Caffeine Spaces achieve their goals:

  • Ask your peers to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share, Share, Share!!! We would like to see 50 new members join!

•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••
The Rewards in Detail
•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

Pledge $5 or more
$5 is the minimum pledge amount that we are offering and it includes a day at Caffeine Spaces to meet other coworking enthusiasts and get the feel of our location. Come in and have a seat, work on your project, and learn from the community. A normal day at a coworking space starts at $25 and we are including a public Tweet from @CaffeineSpaces and recognition on our Facebook page to thank you for your support.

Pledge $20 or more
Caffeine Spaces T-shirt, show your support for Caffeine Spaces by wearing one of our T-shirts! Plus a public Tweet from @CaffeineSpaces and recognition on our Facebook page to thank you for your support.

Pledge $25 or more
5 days of coworking, a public Tweet from @CaffeineSpaces and recognition on our Facebook page to thank you for your support.

Pledge $50 or more
Buy the Caffeine Spaces Members lunch, show your support to our members with the gesture of buying lunch. Plus a public Tweet from @CaffeineSpaces and recognition on our Facebook page to thank you for your support. (One Super Pie and Beverages)

Pledge $100 or more
Friday Night Pass, not a member but want to support Caffeine Spaces. Full access to Friday night events. Plus a public Tweet from @CaffeineSpaces and recognition on our Facebook page to thank you for your support.

Pledge $150 or more
Your Logo on Back of T-Shirts, our startup sponsor opportunity for you to be seen on both the t-shirts and a text link on our t-shirt sponsor page. We are printing t-shirts to be giving away at local events across South Florida and to each of our Caffeine Spaces members. For $150 your logo will be displayed on the back of our Caffeine Spaces t-shirts with a limit of 25 sponsors.

Pledge $199 or more
One month 24/7 membership, come as often as you like to work at our shared tables, meet, attend events and socialize. - Includes Business Identity Plan to receive mail and packages.

Pledge $300 or more
Sponsor Geeks Night Out, each week we have a Geeks Night Out event at Caffeine Spaces. We have created an environment for like minded individuals to escape the bar scene and share what interests us. Each week we break off into groups and learn from each other. This is collaboration in its finest form. Your generosity in providing food and beverages for a Friday night event will be announce at the event, on the event page and a public Tweet from @CaffeineSpaces and recognition on our Facebook page to thank you for your support.

Pledge $500 or more
Fulltime Membership access for 3 months, come as often as you like to work at our shared tables, meet, attend events and socialize. - Includes Business Identity Plan to receive mail and packages.

Pledge $750 or more
Roll Up Banner advertising, bring us your roll up banner we will place in our main room to be seen during events.

Pledge $1200 or more
One Year Membership, come as often as you like to work at our shared tables, meet, attend events and socialize. - Includes Business Identity Plan to receive mail and packages. Plus your name on one of the paint brushes on the wall.

Pledge $3000 or more
*** Lifetime Membership, become a power coworker! *** Have access to our coworking spaces 24 hours a day any day you want to work. No you can't move in, but you can work straight through the night on those difficult projects that require your utmost attention. Plus your name on one of the paint brushes on the wall. Limited to 50 lifetime memberships.

Pledge $5000 or more
Lifetime Membership for TWO!!! I think you also deserve 100 day passes to give to your friends to join you while you work! Plus your name on one of the paint brushes on the wall. Limited to the first 20 pledges at this level.

•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

Why are we doing a membership drive on IndieGoGo?
IndieGoGo is resource for Caffeine Spaces to reach our fund raising goals. Each time we reach a goal in pledges the lower our overall costs will be. It also gives our future members a way to prove their support in our community. The ultimate goal for us to reach is $75,000. Reaching the ultimate goal will lower fundraising time from our schedule and we will incorporate that time into future growth, plus it reduces the overall fees required from our members. The more funds we raise from this CrowdFunding campaign the lower we can set our membership rates.

•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

When you donate, be sure to sign up for our newsletter on our website. Also, be sure to follow us on Facebook and Twitter for updates and our progress.

*You may claim your membership reward as soon as you make your pledge.

shared tables, meet, attend events and socialize. - Includes Business 
Identity Plan to receive mail and packages.Pledge $750 or moreRoll Up Banner advertising, bring us your roll up banner we will place in our main room to be seen during events.Pledge $1200 or moreOne Year Membership, come as often as you like to work at our 
shared tables, meet, attend events and socialize. - Includes Business 
Identity Plan to receive mail and packages. Plus your 
name on one of the paint brushes on the wall.Pledge $3000 or more*** Lifetime Membership, become a power coworker! ***  Have access to our coworking spaces 24 hours a 
day any day you want to work. No you can't move in, but you can work 
straight through the night on those difficult projects that require your
 utmost attention. Plus your name on one of the paint brushes on the 
wall. Limited to 50 lifetime memberships.Pledge $5000 or moreLifetime Membership for TWO!!! I think you also deserve 100 day 
passes to give to your friends to join you while you work! Plus your 
name on one of the paint brushes on the wall. Limited to the first 20 
pledges at this level.•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••Why are we doing a membership drive on IndieGoGo?IndieGoGo is resource for Caffeine Spaces to reach our fund raising 
goals. Each time we reach a goal in pledges the lower our overall costs 
will be. It also gives our future members a way 
to prove their support in our community. The ultimate goal for us to 
reach is $75,000. Reaching the ultimate goal will lower fundraising 
time from our schedule and we will incorporate that time into future 
growth, plus it reduces the overall fees required from our members. The 
more funds we raise from this CrowdFunding campaign the lower we can set
 our membership rates.
•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••When you donate, be sure to sign up for our newsletter on our website. Also, be sure to follow us on Facebook and Twitter for updates and our progress.*You may claim your membership reward as soon as you make your pledge.

story:
OUR QUESTION FOR YOU?

Where did you ever have your best meals growing up? If you were like my partner, Jerry and I, it was probably at your mama’s table. It’s for that reason it was easy for us to name our small restaurant in Sorgho, Ky., exactly that, Mama’s Table, a one of a kind home cooking, stick to your ribs kind of dining experience. (please feel free to like us on Facebook, Mama's Table)

WHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW ABOUT US!

Jerry and I have combined experience of more than 70 years in food service, hospitality, or the related services arena. We understand hospitality, quality, and service are all paramount for a successful food and beverage operation. Mama’s Table was built on that experience. Our restaurant is located in a small community of Sorgho, Ky.,with a population of around 1500. We are  5 miles from Owensboro,Ky., the BBQ Capital of the world (so they claim), and about 30miles from Evansville, In., with many river communities in between, with a total drawing population of around 350,000 in a 30 mile radius. Mama’s Table, once known as Red’s Fish House was a going concern for nearly fifty years. After Red died, we came in and charmed the place up, keeping a great catfish venue, while adding  those dishes that you would expect to get at Mama’s, such as fried pork chops, meatloaf, turnip greens with ham, green beans, loaded red potatoes, slow roasted prime rib, my Mama’s oven fried chicken, hickory smoked Boston Butt, slow smoked for at least 10 hrs. on our smoker and served with our  special dipping sauce unique to Mama’s only, along with outstanding made from scratch desserts. All this plus a world class Omelet Bar, with all the trimmings. But what  makes it extra special is our very own Chef Gil, a staple of our community, flipping omelets in Owensboro for nearly 20 years, and a very special addition to Mama’s. Chef Gil flips omelets on Saturday and Sunday morning left handed and right handed while sharing stories or listening to those of our guest.

WHAT WE NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL!

Now as we start our 3rd year, it's time to take Mama’s Table to the next level. It's time to make her truly a destination restaurant. To do this, we need your help to get there. The following list entails those things necessary to make Mama’s Table a true destination property.

1)  A paved parking lot to replace our gravel and grass

2)  Improved signage

3)  Outdoor stage and large pit to add a bluegrass and country music venue

4)  Enhance our kitchen and patio area

5)  Bring our social media and web presence up to the standards of the 21st century

6)  Fresh produce and herb gardens to ensure our freshness and to maintain a greener presence

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT!

For your participation no matter at what level, know it will be truly appreciated, from  $1 to a $5000 donation, any amount will serve to make Mama’s Table a place for which we can all be proud, and a place where each and everyone will always be welcome with open arms and a warm heart. Know that by picking up the phone we will always have a place for you at our table.

story:
LifeGuard Center 

The LifeGuard Center is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization in Tucson, Arizona. Our primary focus is to rescue young people that have no hope and are in need of help. National statistics report the number of homeless kids at more than 1.5 million. More than 500 thousand are still under the age of 15, and some are as young as nine! Some of the primary reasons they end up on the street include an escape from violence, drugs, abuse, neglect and abandonment.

  • Imagine if you could be the answer for a hurting teen...
  • Imagine if you could give the gift of Hope to a teen this Christmas...
  • Imagine saving a life...

You can, by taking part in the IMAGINE Campaign!

What We Need:

The LifeGuard Center needs to raise $5,000 to stay open and provide FREE programs for youth. 
  • 100% of your financial gift will go towards Scholarships. This will insure that at-risk youth that desire to be apart of the LifeGuard Center will be awarded a scholarship to attend our after school program (Lifeline Project), or our summer camp (Camp Summer Experience) for FREE!!!!
Each program the LifeGuard Center provides also includes free performances by the kids to the community. To see the kids faces as their family and friends commend them on there achievements is priceless!

With your support, the Center will stay open and we will be able to serve over 30 kids without turning them away. 

The Impact

A Sponsorship provides more than the satisfaction that comes with giving to improve the health and well-being of children; it delivers a special opportunity to witness young lives lifted over time. Through child sponsorship, two lives are changed forever: yours and the life of the sponsored child. 

Without the continued support of generous donors like you, the needs of these young people would likely go unmet. 

People need help all year around but Christmas is a great time to show that people are the best investment we could ever make! Everyone needs to know that someone cares!

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to contribute money and that is ok, but that doesn't mean you can’t help:

  • Share this page with as many people as you know . Maybe someone else you know can help!
  • Please visit our website to find out more about the LifeGuard Center (www.lifeguardcenter.org). 

THANK YOU for helping us rescue our youth!

story:
Our Project

For our Capstone project, we wanted to pursue something that really interested us. We wanted to think of a project that would give us a hands on opportunity to explore our passions. Designing and building a small dune buggy fit this criteria perfectly. Both of us have an interest in engineering and industrial design, an interest that was partially developed through our FTC robotics team. We both love to build and create so this project really gave us the opportunity to take this to a bigger scale.

The Dune Buggy

The final dune buggy will have on and off road capabilities. It will comfortably seat one person with roll-cage going over the head of the seat.

Of course, we will be designing it so it will have differences. The buggy will be controlled by a steering wheel with pedals at the feet controlling the gas and brakes. The drive system will be a live axle in the back powered by a geared down Honda GX200 7 HP engine.

In order to give the buggy some off road ability, the tires will be larger and more aggressively tread than go kart tires. They will most likely be ATV tires or something in that class. The buggy will also be equipped with independent front suspension and full back suspension. Our goal is to have to buggy be just as comfortable and powerful off road as it is on road.

Why We Need You

We need funding for our parts and materials. Being seniors in high school, we have very limited budgets. Getting the money for this project would allow us to focus on the project itself. Being freed from the burden of finding the money for it would help us be able to pursue our career interests and gain priceless experience before heading into college. If you are able to help us out by pledging a few dollars, it would be incredibly appreciated. Also, if you live in the Durham/Chapel Hill area and know anyone with a child ATV that they would be willing to sell for parts, please contact us!  Thanks so much for your support, we couldn't do it without you!

story:
Dear Friends and family:

As many of you know it was just the 20th anniversary of Steven's death. It is still so hard to believe and difficult to live with having lost him. It was such a joy to hear from many of you who expressed missing him, loving him and sorrow he left much too soon. As well, those who knew about it, participated in a long distance Pizza Party for him on June 15th. I received so many beautiful E Mails and photos of people eating Pizza in many States in America including Hawaii, London and Croatia.


A pizza party in Steven's Garden organized by some of the local Safed residents and friends of Tamar.

One way I have coped with Steven's death is by creating a memorial garden - STEVEN'S GARDEN - in Safed, Israel where I was living shortly after he died. My beloved friend, Tamar Bittelman, of blessed memory inspired me to create a garden. Her husband, Noach, dug the first beds and Tamar did weekly activities with the children for the year she lived in Safed. As well, only a short while ago the children in her class chose to donate their tzedeka money to Steven's Garden. One of her students purchased and planted a lemon tree in the garden when she and her mom came to Israel.

Many beloved friends have taken care of the Garden since I moved to Jerusalem, but no one has ever put the love and heart into it as Tamar did. As well, people got busy and the Garden was beginning to get run down. I would never want something memorializing Steven not to reflect his beauty. So, I did a major renovation in Steven's Garden in honor of the 20th anniversary of his death. I hired a Gardener to do a major clean-up, planted beautiful new plants and flowers, installed a new watering system, had the mural re-painted, and have hired someone to take care of the Garden weekly.

We are in need of some contributions in order to have a new plaque/sign designed and manufactured, and to pay a professional gardener to maintain it.The garden is in need of tools and supplies, a lighting system so that people can see and sit in the garden in the evening, and two new benches. The present sign is falling apart and I would like to reword the sign at this time and also honor my dear friend Tamar who passed away in February. Tamar inspired me to create a children's garden. It will read as follows:

STEVEN’S GARDEN
May 6, 1968-June 15, 1994

This garden is a memorial to Steven Levine, cherished son, brother and friend.
Steven 's vibrant spirit, passion for life and radiant smile captivated us all.
He loved and is loved -- eternally in our hearts.

With love and gratitude, we honor Tamar Bittelman, of blessed memory (English dates of life and death),

Whose vision inspired the creation of Steven's Garden. For the year Tamar lived in Safed, she lovingly did educational gardening activities with the local children every week.

Established in May 1996 as a children's organic garden, Steven's Garden has become a calming oasis of green among the stones of Safed.

The Levine Family

The sign needs to be printed in both English and Hebrew. I found a wonderful graphic designer here in Jerusalem who will design it. I saw a sign he designed and it was beautiful. He works with a sign maker up North, which is perfect since the garden is up North. He told me what I already knew, there are very few good sign makers in Israel, but the people he uses are the best. So, he designs the sign and the sign people make it. They use a very costly material for the sign that can endure the Israeli weather.

A small contribution would be giving a gift of love to Steven and Tamar.

With love and gratitude,

Shirel Levine

LISTEN TO SHIREL INTEVIEWED ON RADIO FREE NACHLAOT ABOUT STEVEN'S GARDEN: http://radiofreenachlaot.blogspot.com/2014/08/s...

story:
Who are we?

Philippines Communitere is the sister organization to Haiti Communitere and is guided by US-based parent organization, Communitere. We are a Filipino non-profit organization with a proven model for sustainable disaster response, relief and recovery. We are devoted to driving a shift toward collaboration, innovation and community-led recovery by creating a multi-use Resource Center in Tacloban City. When complete, our Resource Center will serve individuals and organizations striving to create better solutions for rebuilding lives in the wake of typhoon Haiyan. 

Mission Statement

The mission of the Communitere family is to foster the skills and recovery of a disaster-impacted community.

What is the project about?

Philippines Communitere is building a Resource Center in Tacloban City which will include:

  • A fully equipped workshop
  • Tool lending library
  • Makerspace 
  • 3D-Printing and Innovation Lab
  • Co-working offices 
  • Training facilities 
Thanks to a generous donation of tools, the workshop is nearing  completion and almost ready for use by the local and international community. With tools for woodworking, furniture building, metal fabrication, 3-D printing and mechanical projects, our workshop provides the space, materials and resources for individuals and organizations to meet and engage with one another while enriching the community with ideas, skills and a shared purpose.

While the workshop and tool library are almost up and running, our Resource Center is far from complete. Current fundraising efforts will be used to complete the Center and to establish our innovative Maker-to-Maker Program.

Rendering of our future Makerspace

What is Maker-to-Maker?

Because Typhoon Haiyan left many Taclobanis with no livelihood, there is a particular need for an influx of new, employable skills. At the same time, all around the world, there are many skilled, creative, committed "Makers"  who have the heart and desire to reach out and help those impacted by this disaster. Our Maker-to-Maker program will bring these motivated communities together. 

Makers who are interested in creating, learning, teaching and building will be matched with individuals in Tacloban as they choose a path to explore. These Makers will be a valuable resource and together, they will create nurturing, long distance partnerships. Our Maker-to-Maker program will build bridges between communities around the world, all working together and learning from one another. 

 

Rendering of our future Training Center

Why do we want to build a Resource Center?

Typhoon Haiyan damaged more than 1 million houses, thousands of local business, affected 16 million people and the livelihood of over 4 million workers. Although the Philippines is slowly recovering, many Filipinos are still struggling to rebuild their houses and businesses. Since our early days here in Tacloban, we have met many community members with wonderful, inspiring ideas and talents but because they lack the space, tools, training, resources and other support, they have no ability to realize them. The Resource Center will provide a place where people with ideas can gather and find support for their projects. It is our goal to give anyone in the community the resources they need and to connect them with various networks to help them establish or expand their business or to rebuild or renew their home or property.


                                                   Rendering of our future Computer and Innovation Lab

Where does my contribution go?

In order to make this project possible we have set our goal at $35,000.  Everything raised above our initial $35,000 goal will be used to buy more materials and start new projects, which will allow more community members to use our space. 

All money raised will go towards our Resource Center project (after paying IndieGoGo commission and costs related to delivering your perks!). Omprakash is our donation partner.  Because Omprakash processes all of our tax-deductible donations, the receipt for your donation will come directly from Omprakash.*  


Apart from our infinite gratitude, we will reward you with the incredible perks listed in the box to the right!

If you contribute today, you'll help to:

  • Build the first Makerspace in the Philippines.

  • Provide the local community with the resources needed to repair and rebuild their homes, businesses and other assets lost or damaged by Haiyan.

  • Create new businesses and jobs.
  • Provide workspace, tools and resources for people to realize their dreams.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money today, it doesn't mean you can't help. You can help us by:

  • Spreading the word: Share Philippines Communitere’s campaign with your family, friends, and social networks using the IndieGoGo share tools below!

  • You can also give your time. We are always looking for great people. Drop us a line to see how you can use your skills to help our organization.

  • Donate goods. Let us know if you have any tools or equipment you want to donate!

And that's all there is to it. We look forward to your active participation in Philippines Communitere and to the bright future of our community in Tacloban.

*For more information about our donation partner, please visit Omprakash.

All money raised will go towards our Resource Center project (after paying IndieGoGo commission and costs related to delivering your perks!). Omprakash is our donation partner.  Because Omprakash processes all of our tax-deductible donations, the receipt for your donation will come directly from Omprakash.*  



Apart from our infinite gratitude, we will reward you with the incredible perks listed in the box to the right!
If you contribute today, you'll help to:


Build
the first Makerspace in the Philippines.


Provide
the local community with the resources needed to repair and rebuild their homes,
businesses and other assets lost or damaged by Haiyan.

Create new businesses and jobs.

Provide workspace, tools and resources for people to realize their dreams.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute money today, it doesn't mean you can't help. You can help us by:


Spreading the word: Share Philippines Communitere’s campaign
with your family, friends, and social networks using the IndieGoGo share tools below!



You can also give your time. We are always looking for great people. Drop us a line
to see how you can use your skills to help our organization. 


Donate goods. Let us know if you have any tools or equipment you want to donate!



And that's
all there is to it. We look forward to your active participation in Philippines Communitere and to the bright future of our community in Tacloban.
*For more information about our donation partner, please visit Omprakash.

story:
Greetings everyone,

My name is Jack Nightingale and I represent over 150 people among community groups from Southern Belize and the core team of Fruit-Full.  Fruit-Full brand solar dried fruits and Ethical Business Exchange is an innovative and large undertaking with many participants and beneficiaries.  There are two themes:

1. Ethical Business Exchange, which is the promotion of ethical and conscientious business practices and

2. A model conscientious business of solar dried organic fruits. 

The third world environment in which this campaign will be achieved is many steps behind the first world.  This is an advantage as well as a detraction.  Capitalism is a world wide tool for development.  It has been poorly used for selfish ends everywhere.  However, used properly and ethically, it can be of great benefit to the entire world.  The tools exist in ethically and conscience based business models.  Our Ethical Business Exchange will produce and implement seminars, presentations, trainings and consultancies in Belize and Central America. Check our website for more details

The organic and quality solar dried fruits business has been established locally and must export its products to become well used and financially useful.  The steps mandated to export our products require physical and practical modifications to meet industry standards.  The products must be well presented in quality packaging.  Bar coding and licenses must be acquired.  International markets must be developed.  Samples must be manufactured and exported to the market place. These are the objectives for this effort. check our website for more details 

FURTHER DETAILS CONCERNING FRUIT AND FRUIT DRYING

Tropical fruits are dried in many fashions. The bulk of dried fruits are soaked in sugar baths before being electronically timed through an electric furnace. You will know these fruits because of the white, sweet powder on the surface. Other fruits are passed through citric acid or sodium benzoate to help preserve them. Sulfur is often used for a preservative.

We at Fruit-Full use nothing but the sun!

Tropical fruits are multiple, from pineapple, banana through to mangosteen. Each has properties that when consumed are valuable to the cells in your body. At Fruit-Full we can access about 12 different fruits out of this pantheon of delights. Among them is a fruit we know as Zapote. Some know it as Mamay- zapote. This fruit is not well known and to get it is sometimes a difficult task. There is no guarantee that it will ripen correctly or that bruises from falling do not over damage the fruit. When dried, coated in honey, it becomes a real sweet treat. The tree is endemic to our region and the Mayans used it for food.

Getting this fruit and all our products to you is our goal. As the end user, you are the main beneficiary. Dried fruits retain nearly all their goodness so that your body can make use of these delights.


Achieving these objectives will allow local farmers, community groups and the core Fruit-Full team to be effective citizenry in Belize and Central America.  In addition, the Ethical Business Exchange will be encouraging other entrepreneurs to realize their dreams whilst influencing ethics and conscience.  We must all take responsibility for our present and potential futures.  That is why our theme "Effort to be conscious, is conscious effort" is calling to you.  Fruit-Full's product motto is, "Nothing added but the sun" and we wish to share that with you.

WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU:

The following budget breakdown is self explanatory.

#

Action to be carried out with funds

Funds Needed USD

1

Upgrade structure of existing building

5,000.00

2

Installation of Indirect dryer

5,000.00

3

Water supply upgrade for sanitary standard

2,000.00

4

Wastewater treatment (Bio/Phyto remediation)

4,000.00

5

Upgrade dryers and pads

2,000.00

6

Design new bags for export

2,500.00

7

Purchase of new bags (100,000)

5,000.00

8

Manufacture of samples (5,000)

4,000.00

9

Distribution costs (shipping)

3,000.00

10

All printing for Ethical Business Exchange

4,000.00

11

2 Seminars in Belize (Punta Gorda)

6,000.00

12

Transport locally to deliver presentations and trainings (minimum 8)

1,600.00

13

Web site improvement and maintenance

1,300.00

14

Public relations, advertising and brochures

2,500.00

15

Bar codes (company and then per product)

8,000.00

16

Expenses for export license

1,500.00

17

Four presentations of Ethical Business Exchange

1,000.00

18

Advertising, radio and TV spots and shows

1,500.00


TOTAL

60,000.00
If by chance we do not reach our goal of $60,000 we will distribute what funds we have raised to the most urgent aspects of both project themes.  Our bi-annual newsletter will share financial information after the campaign.

WHAT WE HAVE FOR YOU:
We are excited about our perks because we wish to include more new stakeholders in this remarkable project.  Every donor becomes at minimum a stakeholder of interest.  You will receive our informative on-line newsletter. 
The perks increase with your larger donation and we will become more inclusive.  Our effort is towards conscious expression through business. Your participation, even if by will and intent alone will be recognized.

Our customers are also stakeholders!   How else can we share the full nature of conscious business? 


WHAT AND WHO THIS PROJECT WILL IMPACT:

It takes a butterfly wing moving slightly here to be related to a tornado in other quarters.  A small action here in Belize can change the world.  If the nature of consciousness is to have impact on humanity, it must start somewhere.  Using the medium of capitalism/business to transmit and inculcate ethics and conscience can affect the whole.  The impact is on all of us!

As a leading stakeholder and campaign designer, I can point to many different successes in my experience.  Many trainings delivered with large impact; many workshops attended and moved in new directions; many professional organizations and individuals affected and infected with change; many casual meetings becoming life changing moments.  I have been working with conscious awareness for over 40 years.

In the same way a new invention captures support, we want this project to capture your consciousness and your awareness.  How often will such an opportunity pass in front of you?  Become a part of this project that can make change for humanity and its future.  We are extremely pragmatic and down to earth.  Come and see where and what we do! 

Risks and contingencies have been well documented and are available in our business plan.

HOW YOU CAN HELP US OTHER THAN DONATION:
We are fully aware that this project could be placed under any category (Business, Food, Social, etc).  We are choosing Community but would have liked to place it under "Conscious Capitalism".  That category does not exist.  We think that this project and campaign needs to be seen by so called "Conscious Capitalists". 
If you are concerned with community you are also going to be concerned with awareness and conscious effort.  Please help us get this campaign in front of those who would have interest in it.

story:
On 14TH May, 2014 Bosnia and Herzegovina was hit by disastrous floods and some of its biggest cities, as well as rural areas, were flooded in an instant. From minute to minute the water is taking lives, causing enormous landslides and serious damage to country`s infrastructure and people’s private properties. Thousands of people, left with nothing, have being evacuated from their homes. The number of lives lost is still unknown. Flooded parts are left without drinking water, electricity, food, and other necessities. Local Aid in forms of basic goods and funds are slowly declining as all the sectors in the country are affected.

  We are a Non-governmental Organization Benevolentia, from Banja Luka, and we have been involved in providing help for 5 days now, but the situation in the affected areas is catastrophic, and requires constant engagement by the Governmental bodies, NGOs and foreign helpers. We already have a functional infrastructure anda large number of members and volunteers willing to provide help directly to the victims of the floods, but unfortunately, we don`t have enough  necessary goods in the form of AID packages consisting of food, drinking water, hygiene products, blankets and diapers for babies and grown-ups.

  Our goal is to collect necessary funds in order to set up a base where we would receive information about families in need, purchase mentioned necessities and distribute them directly to the victims of floods. We would start a website and open a phone line where people could give us information of those that are in need of supplies. Using this information, and the information from the terrain itself, our volunteers would constantly update the database and buy and collect supplies and package them so that they can be properly distributed around Banja Luka’s flooded suburbs and elsewhere in the country.

  We will use the funds to create different packages consisting of: bottled water, food, products for personal hygiene, blankets, clothes, baby supplies and basic cleaning supplies. We will also provide the infrastructure for our volunteers through: fuel and vans for distribution, phones, equipment and tools and establishment of the emergency headquarters for packaging of the products and coordination of the distribution of the help.

Please, make a click for the victims of floods in Bosnia and Herzegovina! Thank you!

story: Thank you to those caring supportive people that have visited this page to either share or contribute in supporting me to assist my mother. As for those of who continually return to check on whats going on, not to share in support but like to speculate and spread the contagious negativity in and around
